After a short while, the pilot tried to re-enter the cockpit. He used the intercom system to ask Lubitz to open the cockpit door, but received no answer. The pilot started knocking and can then be heard trying to break the door down. The plane crashed less than a minute later, killing all 150 people on board.
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Germanwings report,Andreas Lubitz,Germanwings cockpit,Germanwings crash,cockpit recording before crash,Germanwings flight 9525,Bureau d’Enquetes et d’Analyses

item.title: Silence held to mark tenth anniversary of London bombings
item.description: A minute's silence was held at several sites in the UK Tuesday to mark the tenth anniversary of the the London Underground and bus bombings of 7 July 2005 in which 52 people were killed.Several underground stations started their silences at 08:50am - the time of the first bomb.The four bombs, three on subway trains and one on a bus, were carried out by four al-Qaeda sympathisers carrying backpacks full of explosivesIt remains the worst terrorist atrocity on British soil.Shezad Tanweer detonated his device on a Circle Line train between Liverpool Street and Aldgate.The explosion at the rear of the train’s second carriage killed seven people.The second suicide bomb exploded on the 311 train travelling south from King’s Cross to Russell Square.Twenty six people were killed when bomber Germaine Lindsay set off his bomb near the second set of double doors of the first carriage.Mohammad Sidique Khan set off his bomb on a Circle Line train as it was leaving Edgware Road station.The bomb, located in the second carriage, killed six people.Almost one hour later Hasib Hussain detonated his bomb on the upper level of a number 30 bus as it travelled through Tavistock Square.The force of the explosion tore the bus apart, killing 13 people.More than 700 others were injured by the explosions.
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,UK,United Kingdom,London,bombing,terrorist,al-Qaeda,tube,underground,Shezad Tanweer,Liverpool Street,Aldgate

item.title: El Chapo prison escape: Overview of the drug lord’s escape from Altiplano prison
item.description: Joaquin ‘El Chapo’ Guzman escaped from a prison in central Mexico on Saturday night, embarrassing Mexican officials who had promised that El Chapo’s 2001 escape, achieved with the help of prison guards, would not be repeated.Guzman escaped from Altiplano Federal Penitentiary at around 8:52 p.m. local time on Saturday by crawling through a series of tunnels located right underneath the shower of his prison cell. The longest tunnel, a 1,500-metre-long horizontal tunnel included lighting and ventilation, and ended at an isolated house in the nearby neighborhood of Santa Juanita.Mexican authorities have begun a manhunt in the area and are holding at least 30 employees for questioning, including the head of the prison.In 2001, Guzman paid prison guards to help him escape from the high-security Puente Grande prison in the Mexican city of Guadalajara. After he was finally recaptured in 2014, President Enrique Pena Nieto said that another El Chapo escape must “never happen again.”
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,El Chapo,prison escape,Altiplano prison

item.title: Shark attacks man in shallow water at Myrtle Beach
item.description: A man was bitten by a shark at Myrtle Beach in what may have been a case of mistaken identity. Ryan Orellana-Moczynski, 25, from St John, Indiana, was swimming on a boogie board about a block away from the 2nd Avenue Pier around 7:45pm when a shark bit him. Beach Patrol Sergeant Phillip Cain said sharks typically feed around dusk and advised people to not swim at that time. Orellana-Moczynski may have swam into a school of fish that the shark was feeding on. He was sent to Grand Strand Regional Medical Center and had successful surgery Saturday night.
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,shark,attack,myrtle beach,north carolina,boogie board,nature,animals

item.title: Landslide in Kuala Lumpur buries nine cars
item.description: A landslide buried nine cars at a car park on Jalan Ampang in Kuala Lumpur yesterday. It was reported that heavy rain hit the area at 6:30pm and a landslide occurred 30 minutes later.The Kuala Lumpur Fire and Rescue department confirmed that nine cars were completely buried and one of them was damaged by a fallen tree. No casualties or injuries were reported in the incident. The landslide also brought the traffic to a standstill in the area.This animation illustrates how a landslide is caused by heavy rain.
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,kuala lumpur,landslide,car park,jalan ampang,natural disaster

item.title: The invisible tank PL-01 unveiled.
item.description: Obrum, part of Poland Defence Holdings, has revealed its latest product, the Tank PL-01 CONCEPT at the MSPO 2013 defence exhibition. In cooperation with Polish companies and British conglomerate BAE Systems, the PL-01 which weighs 35 tonnes, measures 7 meters long, 3.8 meters wide and 2.8 meters high. Three people can fit in the hull of the vehicle.The Adaptiv technology protects the tank from detection. An array of hexagonal Peltier plates on the surface can be heated and cooled to project a desired image, such as the background and or a separate object, making the tank invisible. The tank is also equipped with a system of 350-degree continuous observation day and night. Comprised of a chassis with an unmanned turret that has an autoloading 105 mm or 120 mm caliber cannon, the PL-01 is intended to act as a fire support combat vehicle.According to Poland Defence Holdings, production on the PL-01 is expected to begin in 2018 with exports to take place in 2022.
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,tank pl-01,pl-01 concept,invisible tank,adaptiv,autoloader tank,new poland tank,obrum pl-01

item.title: Glass-bottomed pool suspended 35 m high to bridge luxury London flats
item.description: A group of British architects and property developers have unveiled their plan to build a suspended glass pool, bridging two luxury apartments.Enclosed in glass 20 cm thick, the pool will be 25 metres long and 5 metres wide, with water approximately 1.2 metres deep.The so-called sky pool will be suspended 10 stories high, or 35 metres above ground. In comparison, Big Ben, London’s famous clock tower, stands at 96 metres high.The glass pool will connect two apartments of the Embassy Gardens development in southwest London’s new Nine Elms quarter.‘The experience of the pool will be truly unique, it will feel like floating through the air in central London,’ said Sean Mulryan, CEO of the developer Ballymore Group.
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,united kingdom,london,glass pool,glass-bottomed pool,nine elms,embassy gardens

item.title: US security: US - Mexico border fence unrealistic, Israel company to build digital wall
item.description: Ahead of the 2016 United States presidential election, a number of Republican hopefuls have again made US border protection a key issue and several have suggested that border walls are a key solution. The history of U.S. border protection, however, shows how unfeasible the idea of a bricks-and-mortar wall is. The construction of the so-called 2,000-mile-long “Border Wall” began in 1993 between San Diego and Tijuana. However, by 2006, only 14 miles of the fence had been completed at a cost of $39 million dollars. By 2011, 646 miles of the fence was scattered along the southwest border, with 299 miles of the existing wall made up of vehicles barriers built at an approximate cost of $1.7 million per mile and 350 miles of pedestrian fencing, built at an estimated cost of $6.5 million per mile.The project proved too expensive to finish.That same year, under the Obama administration, a virtual wall using mobile surveillance and unmanned drones covering the entire 2,000-mile border, was announced at a cost of over $7 billion. A pilot program with 53 miles of virtual surveillance was launched in Arizona. After $1 billion was spent, that project was also abandoned due to its inability to meet standards for viability and cost effectiveness.But the problem is not only financial. Physical walls have not deterred immigrants from making the trip across the border.Instead, the walls have caused a rise in migrant deaths as migrants still attempt the crossing, but in more remote and risky border areas. While doing little to prevent illegal immigration, walls create many environmental problems such as the erosion of mountains, the dumping of erosion waste into rivers and consequential flooding. A physical wall along the entire US-Mexico border is unrealistic and is not a viable solution to the United States’ immigration woes. And equally costly, virtual walls both eliminate some of the environmental issues with building a physical wall, but also invite new questions regarding the privacy rights of Americans as well as health concerns.
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,us security,us-mexico border,illegal immigration,donald trump,immigration,us canada border

item.title: Utah-Arizona flood: Flash flood kills eight and sends two vehicles downstream
item.description: Flash flooding ravaged a Utah town best known as the former home base for imprisoned polygamist sect leader Warren Jeffs. The town of Hildale on the Utah-Arizona border was hit by a flash flood that swept away two vehicles, killing at least eight people and leaving five missing. On Monday evening, the canyons above Hildale received intense rain and, within minutes, Hildale was flooded. Witness Chris Wyler told CNN the flash flood happened very quickly, within half an hour. A full-size van and an SUV carrying a total of 16 people, mainly women and children, were hit by a wall of water that sent the two vehicles hundreds of yards downstream. The water receded as quickly as it appeared. By late Monday night, most of the water was gone. Residents of the community are trying to find those missing and reaching for help on social media. Hilldale is the headquarters of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, a polygamist sect that split off from the Mormon church 100 years ago. Its leader, Warren Jeffs, was sentenced to life in prison for having sexual relations with young girls he viewed as brides.
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,biblical rain,terrential rain,fundamentalist church of jesus christ of latter-day saints,polygamist town,polygamy,warren jeffs polygamist sect,utah-arizona flood,arizona flood,colorado city arizona,hildale utah flooding,flash flood

item.title: Volkswagen scandal: 11 million cars worldwide affected by emissions test-beating cheat
item.description: Automobile manufacturer Volkswagen has admitted to cheating on emissions tests, which in turn has affected 11 million cars worldwide.Officials from the Environmental Protection Agency say Volkswagen has installed an algorithm in vehicles that switches the emissions-control on and off when one of their diesel-powered cars undergo emissions testing.Diesel engines are more durable, while diesel fuel is also cheaper and can have up to 30 percent more mileage in a gallon of fuel than petrol-powered vehicles. However, isel engines emit more nitrogen oxides into the atmosphere, which could result in smog formation, according to VOX Explained.According to VOX Explained, an independant group International Council on Clean Transportation joined forces with researchers from West Virginia University when they noticed varied emission rates during field-testing of two Volkswagen vehicles. Volkswagen admitted to tampering with the emissions test when the EPA reportedly threatened to not approve the 2016 line of diesel-powered vehicles.According to the EPA, the algorithm tracks steering wheel position, pedal movements and atmospheric pressure to determine whether the vehicle is in a lab for testing. Full emissions control will be turned on during testing and off during normal driving conditions to maximize engine performance.The cheat has resulted in vehicles emitting up to 40 times more nitrogen oxides than what is considered standard, the EPA said.Volkswagen may be fined up to US$18 billion for violating the Clean Air Act.
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,volkswagen,volkswagen scandal,algorithm,cheat,emissions test,pollution,diesel,gasoline

item.title: Pope Francis in the US: Pope opts for a modest Fiat and Jeep Wrangler as his popemobiles
item.description: For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twPope Francis will be travelling in a newly modified Jeep Wrangler for most of the duration of his trip in the United States. However, the pontiff started his U.S. tour this Tuesday in a black Fiat 500L that was waiting for him on the tarmac at Joint Base Andrews, reported the Telegraph.The modest Fiat tops at 100 miles per hour, about 60 miles per hour less than the Mercedes-Benz Pope Benedict used when he was in the U.S. in 2008.The Pope has opted for the Jeep Wrangler to be an open-sided vehicle so that he can be closer to the people. However, this also puts the pontiff at greater risk. The bottom of the vehicle is reportedly fitted with blast-proof technology to protect him in case there are explosives on the road, according to the International Business Times.Pope Francis had also compared the feeling of being inside a traditional Popemobile with a bullet-proof glass enclosure to being stuck in a ‘sardine can,’ and prefers the open-sided popemobile to get closer to his ministry, reported La Vanguardia, an Italian paper.“It’s true that anything could happen, but let’s face it, at my age I don’t have much to lose,” Pope Francis said to a Barcelona newspaper. “I know that something could happen to me, but it’s in the hands of God.”Over the course of his papacy, Pope Francis has used modified Mercedes, Toyotas, Kias, and Hyundais among others as modes of transportation. The Pope will continue his U.S. tour to the Capitol on Thursday.
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,pope francis,pope francis 2015,pope francis in the us,popemobile,jeep wrangler,fiat,pope franscis popemobile

item.title: Germanwings crash: French authorities release preliminary timeline
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFrench authorities on Wednesday released a preliminary report on the March 24 Germanwings crash, using the flight recorders and recordings of radio communications to provide the most detailed picture to date of what happened inside the plane in the moments before its copilot is suspected of crashing it into the Alps.According to the French Bureau d’Enquetes et d’Analyses accident investigation agency’s preliminary report, shortly after Germanwings flight 9525 reached a cruising altitude of 38,000 feet, the captain left the cockpit. About half a minute later, copilot Andreas Lubitz set the plane’s autopilot to fly the plane to the lowest possible altitude, 100 feet, and increased the rpm in both of the plane’s engines. After a short while, the pilot tried to re-enter the cockpit. He used the intercom system to ask Lubitz to open the cockpit door, but received no answer. The pilot started knocking and can then be heard trying to break the door down. The plane crashed less than a minute later, killing all 150 people on board.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Germanwings flight at 38,000 feet 2. Pilot and co-pilot chatting in the cockpit; pilot leaving the cockpit 3. Autopilot ordered to fly the plane to 100 feet 4. Pilot knocking on cockpit door, then kicking it5. Co-pilot putting the aircraft in controlled descent mode 6. Germanwings flight crashing into a mountain VOICEOVER (in English): “The Germanwings plane was at a cruising height of 38,000 feet around half an hour into its flight shortly at 9:27 GMT.” “The cockpit voice recorder shows the pilot and co-pilot were chatting before the pilot got out of his seat at 9:30 GMT.” “About half a minute later, the selected altitude on the Flight Control Unit changed from 38,000 feet to the minimum 100 feet.” “Noises similar to a person knocking on the cockpit door were recorded on six occasions between 9:35 GMT and 9:39 GMT,”“followed by five noises similar to violent blows on the cockpit door.” “Seconds later, the ‘Pull Up’ aural warning from the Ground Proximity Warning System triggered. The recording stopped at the moment of impact.” SOURCES: Bureau d’Enquetes et d’Analyseshttp://www.bea.aero/docspa/2015/d-px150324.en/pdf/d-px150324.en.pdfhttp://www.bea.aero/en/enquetes/flight.gwi18g/info24mars2015.fr.php***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Amtrak engineer hit emergency brake before train derailed in Philadelphia, NTSB says
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twAn engineer used an emergency brake moments before Amtrak Train 188 derailed in Philadelphia on Tuesday night at more than 100 miles per hour, according to National Transportation Safety Bureau official Robert Sumwalt, as reported by NBC.At least seven people were killed and more than 200 injured in the derailment.According to Sumwalt, the train was placed into engineered-induced braking moments before the derailment, meaning engineers applied the full emergency braking application. While the maximum speed at the curve was 50 mph, Sumwalt said the train was traveling at 106 mph when the engineer induced the brake application. Three seconds later the train speed was at 102 mph after the brake was applied and then it fully derailed, according to Sumwalt.Amtrak’s Northeast Regional Train 188 derailed Tuesday at around 9.30 p.m. in Philadelphia’s Port Richmond section along the Delaware River. The train was en route from Washington, DC to New York. The accident disrupted services along the Northeast Corridor, which runs from Boston to Washington and is the busiest and most congested passenger railroad in the United States. The Northeast Corridor served 11.6 million passengers in 2014 and has more than 2,200 commuter and freight trains operating from Boston to Washington each day.The train was heading into a bend in the track near Frankford Junction when it went off the tracks at a point where a 70 mph stretch turns into a 50 mph curve. All seven train cars derailed and one of the cars, which separated from the rest, was completely wrecked.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Amtrak train traveling with 238 passengers and five crew from Washington, DC to New York2. Train heading into a bend in the track near Frankford Junction3. Engineer’s cab4. Emergency brake is activated5. Train’s wheels slow6. Train derails7. AftermathVOICEOVER (in English): “Amtrak’s Northeast Regional Train 188 derailed Tuesday night in Philadelphia while en route from Washington, DC to New York carrying 238 passengers and five crew members.” “A National Transportation Safety Board official says an investigation shows an Amtrak engineer applied the emergency brakes just as the train was heading into a bend in the track near Frankford Junction, slowing the locomotive from 106 mph to 102 mph.”“The train went off the tracks at a point where a 70-mph stretch turns into a 50-mph curve.”“All seven train cars derailed, and the engine, which separated from the rest, was completely wrecked.” SOURCES: CNN, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, WCAU, NBC News, CNN, New York Times, Amtrakhttp://edition.cnn.com/2015/05/13/us/philadelphia-amtrak-train-derailment/http://www.wsj.com/articles/deadly-train-wreck-in-philadelphia-leaves-disastrous-mess-1431499608http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/05/13/uk-usa-train-derailment-idUKKBN0NY04C20150513http://www.reuters.com/article/2015/05/13/us-usa-train-derailment-idUSKBN0NY04E20150513http://www.nbcphiladelphia.com/news/local/Amtrak-Derailment-Philadelphia--303536331.html?_osource=SocialFlowTwt_PHBrandhttp://www.cnbc.com/id/102673436http://edition.cnn.com/2015/05/13/us/philadelphia-amtrak-train-derailment/http://www.nytimes.com/2015/05/14/us/amtrak-train-derails-crash-philadelphia.html?_r=0#http://www.amtrak.com/ccurl/238/481/Amtrak-FY2014-Ridership-and-Revenue-ATK-14-096%20.pdfhttp://nec.amtrak.com/facts-and-datahttp://www.wgal.com/news/several-people-injured-in-amtrak-crash/32989264***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Thai police look for “foreign suspect” after deadly Bangkok shrine bombing
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThai police have issued an arrest warrant for an “unidentified foreign man” who they believe is the chief suspect in the deadly bombing of Bangkok’s Erawan Shrine.Thai police released a sketch of the chief suspect based on the surveillance video and a description by a motorbike taxi driver who gave the suspect a ride shortly after the explosion, the New York Daily News reported.The suspect reportedly gave the driver a piece of paper with the name of a central city park written in English. The driver said the man also spoke in an unfamiliar language on his phone during the ride, according to CNN.“When I dropped him, he still appeared very calm, just like (a) normal customer. He seemed not in a hurry at all,” Driver Kasem Pooksuwan told CNN.The suspect was caught on camera leaving a backpack at the crowded shrine before the stands up and walks away. Police said the two people seen standing in front him are possible accomplices. The bomb went off just 15 minutes after the suspect left the shrine, according to New York Daily News.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Depiction of Thai police making a sketch of the suspect 2. Suspect leaving a backpack at the shrine3. Two possible accomplices standing in front of him4. Bomb goes off 15 minutes after the suspect leaves the shrine5. The suspect in a motorcycle taxiVOICEOVER (in English): “Thai police composed a sketch of the chief suspect in the bombing of Erawan Shrine based on surveillance video and a description by a motorbike taxi driver who gave the suspect a ride shortly after the explosion.”“The suspect was caught on camera leaving a backpack at the crowded shrine before standing up and walking away. Police said the two people seen standing in front him are possible accomplices.”“The bomb went off 15 minutes after the suspect left the shrine.”“After allegedly planting the bomb, the suspect then hailed a motorbike taxi and gave the driver a piece of paper with the name of a central city park written in English. The driver said he also spoke in an unfamiliar language on his phone during the ride.”SOURCES: CNN, Bangkok Post, New York Daily Newshttp://edition.cnn.com/2015/08/19/asia/thailand-bangkok-bombing/http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/general/660032/police-after-ratchaprasong-bomb-suspecthttp://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/bangkok-bombing-thai-police-issue-arrest-warrant-forei-article-1.2330626***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Australia prison break: second prisoner to escape Goulburn Correctional Centre in less than a month
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA prisoner escaped today from the minimum security facility at the Goulburn Correctional Centre in New South Wales, the second break-out from the prison in less than a month, The first prison break from the Goulburn Correctional Centre, which is also known as the Goulburn Supermax and is considered Australia’s most secure jail, happened in August, when maximum-security prisoner Stephen Jamieson escaped using bedsheets and a blanket, the Sydney Morning Herald reported.Jamieson, 28, tied a pillow around his waist, most likely to climb over razor wire at the top of the prison wall. He then stole a pickup but was caught almost 12 hours later after leading police on a 40-kilometre high-speed chase, Australia’s ABC News reported.Jamieson had been in segregation after being identified as a suspect over the discovery of a 60-cm-deep hole in the prison’s floor, which was found earlier in August.According to the Australian, on Wednesday morning, another prisoner, Beau Wiles, 25, escaped from the Goulburn Correctional Centre around 10 a.m.after he jumped one of the prison’s fences.Wiles was serving an 18-month sentence for shoplifting, assault, robbery, car theft and driving while disqualified.Goulburn Correctional Centre is a maximum and minimum security institution for males located in the Southern Tablelands, 197 kilometers southwest of Sydney.SOURCES: United States Patent and Trademark Office, Quartz, News.com.auhttp://pdfaiw.uspto.gov/.aiw?PageNum=0&docid=20150274298&IDKey=0410F6F462F7&HomeUrl=http%3A%2F%2Fappft.uspto.gov%2Fnetacgi%2Fnph-Parser%3FSect1%3DPTO2%2526Sect2%3DHITOFF%2526p%3D1%2526u%3D%25252Fnetahtml%25252FPTO%25252Fsearch-adv.html%2526r%3D1%2526f%3DG%2526l%3D50%2526d%3DPG01%2526S1%3D20150274298%2526OS%3D20150274298%2526RS%3D20150274298http://www.news.com.au/travel/travel-advice/enjoy-the-space-on-planes-while-youve-got-it/story-fn6yjmoc-1227559525929***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Airbus lodges patent for ‘stacked’ airline passenger seating
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFrench airplane maker Airbus has filed patents in Europe and the United States for split-level passenger seating configurations an idea which has been likened to stacking passengers like blocks.In the document, published with the United States Patent and Trademark Office on October 1, several illustrations depict possible futures wherein flyers would be arranged in alternating rows on upper and lower levels. The document presents the idea as a way to make better use of unused “upper lobe” space in wide-bodied models such as the A380.The economic benefits to airlines are obvious. The proposed seating configurations would allow airlines to fit more people into a plane than they do currently. And with what it calls mezzanine seating, more passengers could recline to a flat-lying position, a setup the patent application suggests would be “suitable” for use in business class sections.But flyers may not be ready for these controversial ideas. Both aviation commentators and the flying public panned the idea of near-standing “saddle” seating when it was revealed in one of the company’s hundreds of patent filings in 2014.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. An Airbus A380 in flight2. Aircraft passenger cabin with two levels; a passenger walking along the aisle3. Passenger on upper level reclines in her seat4. Flight attendant delivering beverage to passenger; passengers on upper level facing the back of the plane5. Passengers seated on upper level facing each otherVOICEOVER (in English): “Hoping to make better use of unused ‘upper lobe’ space in wide-bodied models such as the A380 ...“… Airbus has filed patents in Europe and the United States for split-level seating configurations.”“With what the company calls mezzanine seating, more passengers could recline to a flat-lying position.”“The proposed seating configurations would allow airlines to fit more people into a plane than they do currently.”“The economic benefits to airlines are obvious, but flyers may not be ready for these controversial ideas.”SOURCES: United States Patent and Trademark Office, Quartz, News.com.auhttp://pdfaiw.uspto.gov/.aiw?PageNum=0&docid=20150274298&IDKey=0410F6F462F7&HomeUrl=http%3A%2F%2Fappft.uspto.gov%2Fnetacgi%2Fnph-Parser%3FSect1%3DPTO2%2526Sect2%3DHITOFF%2526p%3D1%2526u%3D%25252Fnetahtml%25252FPTO%25252Fsearch-adv.html%2526r%3D1%2526f%3DG%2526l%3D50%2526d%3DPG01%2526S1%3D20150274298%2526OS%3D20150274298%2526RS%3D20150274298http://www.news.com.au/travel/travel-advice/enjoy-the-space-on-planes-while-youve-got-it/story-fn6yjmoc-1227559525929***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Flight MH17 shot down by Russian-made Buk missile, Dutch report says
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twMalaysia Airlines Flight 17 was shot down over eastern Ukraine by a Russian-made Buk missile, the Dutch Safety Board concluded on Tuesday in its final report on the crash in July 2014 that killed all 298 people on board. The board however did not point the finger at any group or party for firing the missile. At the time of the crash, a war was raging in eastern Ukraine between Russian-backed separatists and Ukrainian government forces when the aircraft was downed. “A 9N314M warhead detonated outside the airplane to the left side of the cockpit. This fits the kind of warhead installed in the Buk surface-to-air missile system,” said the Safety Board head Tjibbe Joustra. Russia disputes that a Buk may have been used. Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov responded to the findings by saying there had been “an obvious attempt to draw a biased conclusion, and carry out political orders,” according to Russian news agencies. The makers of the Buk said their tests had shown that the aircraft could not have been hit by a missile launched from rebel-controlled territory. The safety board’s report said that a 9N314M warhead had exploded to the left of the plane’s flight cabin, sending shrapnel towards the aircraft with “tremendous force.”The detonation killed three crew members in the cockpit instantly and caused the breakup of the plane, which exploded when it hit the ground tail-first. The report said shrapnel fragments all pointed to a ground-launched Buk missile. Joustra said it was likely that passengers not killed by the impact of the missile would have been rendered unconscious very quickly by the sudden decompression of the plane and the lack of oxygen at 33,000 feet. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. The Buk surface-to-air missile being fired 2. The Buk missile traveling towards MH173. The Buk missile exploding on the left side of the cabin4. Shrapnel from the explosion hitting the front of the aircraft5. Shrapnel killing three crew members6. The plane heading down before it crashes into the groundVOICEOVER (in English): Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 was shot down over eastern Ukraine by a Russian-made Buk missile, the Dutch Safety Board concluded in its final report on the crash in July 2014 that killed all 298 people on board. The safety board’s report said that a 9N314M warhead had exploded to the left of the plane’s flight cabin, tearing off the front of the plane. The detonation from the missile sent shrapnel towards the plane with tremendous force” and killed the three crew members in the cockpit instantly. The detonation caused the breakup of the plane, which exploded when it hit the ground tail-first. SOURCES: Reuters, Guardianhttp://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/10/13/uk-ukraine-crisis-mh-idUKKCN0S71C020151013http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/oct/13/mh17-crash-report-plane-partially-reconstruced-blames-buk-missile-strike***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Flight MH17,MH17 dutch report,MH17 shot down buk missile

item.title: Russia and the ESA set sites on permanent moon colony with planned landing
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe European Space Agency and its Russian counterpart are sending a lander to the moon’s south pole as part of their plan to settle humans permanently on Earth’s closest neighbor.In one of a number of missions led by the Russian Federal Space Agency, it and the ESA hope to land the Luna 27 probe on the moon’s South Pole Aitken Basin in 2020. The spacecraft’s mission is to assess whether or not there is enough raw material on the moon’s surface to support human life during future missions. As parts of the south pole are shielded from the heat of the sun, the region is darker and colder than other sections of the moon. The environment has allowed water to collect and freeze at the surface of the moon and scientists say that this water could be used as a potential resource for the future.The ESA already has ideas about what these future missions may be as the agency hopes to build lunar habitats in the lunar south pole as early as 2024. The agency plans to deploy inflatable domes on the moon’s surface as shelter for astronauts. 3D-printing robots will be sent to the moon and will be used to build a layer of dirt around the domes.The ESA says the lunar base they hope to build within the next decade could replace the International Space Station as the new base for astronauts to experience life in space. Scientists also hope that the moon base will help astronauts prepare for later missions to Mars. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Location of the probe landing site on the moon2. Colder temperatures in the moon’s south pole craters3. Large amounts of water-ice on the surface within the craters4. Water and other chemicals could be used to support human life on the moon5. The European Space Agency’s vision for a moon base6. Moon base will include an inflatable domeVOICEOVER (in English): “In five years, European and Russian space agencies will land the Luna 27 probe on the edge of the moon’s South Pole Aitken Basin.”“As parts of the south pole are shielded from the heat of the sun, the region is darker and colder than other areas of the moon.”“Scientists say that here, water has frozen and collected at the surface.“This water could be used as a potential resource to support future human missions at this location.”“The European Space Agency hopes to build lunar habitats on the lunar south pole as early as 2024…”“...and plans to deploy inflatable domes on the moon’s surface as shelter for astronauts. 3D-printing robots will build a layer of dirt around the domes.”SOURCES: BBC, Business Insider, Spacehttp://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-34504067http://www.bbc.com/future/story/20150712-should-we-build-a-village-on-the-moonhttp://www.businessinsider.com/european-space-agency-plans-to-build-lunarville-moon-habitat-in-2024-2015-6http://www.space.com/18175-moon-temperature.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Luna 27,moon base,moon colony,moon settlement,International Space Station,manned moon mission ISS,lunar lander

item.title: Siberian unicorns may have walked the earth with humans
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twAn ancient relative of the rhinoceros described as a “Siberian unicorn” may have walked the earth alongside humans.The giant horned beasts were thought to have become extinct 350,000 years ago. However, the discovery of a fossilised skull shows Elasmotherium sibiricum only died out 29,000 years ago, according to a study published in the American Journal of Applied Sciences.That means the Siberian unicorn may have shared the earth with humans.Researchers found fragments of the giant skull in the Pavlodar region of northeast Kazakhstan.Fossils suggest the Siberian unicorn stood 2 meters tall, 4.5 meters long and weighed 4 tons, making it bigger than today’s rhinos.Researchers believe the Siberian unicorns were herbivores, according to science website Phys.org. Their habitat extended from western Russia to eastern Kazakhstan, according to the study.Western Siberia may have been a refuge for the beasts, which allowed them to survive much longer than similar creatures, Andrei Shpanski, a paleontologist at Tomsk State University, told Phys.org.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Siberian unicorn walking in Kazakhstan 30,000 years ago 2. Location in Kazakhstan of fossil discovery3. Archeologists discovering skull fragment fossils4. Comparison of Siberian unicorn size with other mammals5. Group of Siberian unicorns eating grass6. Siberian unicorns fightingVOICEOVER (in English): “A study published in the American Journal of Applied Sciences claims the Siberian unicorn may have lived at the same time as humans.”“The discovery of a skull in Kazakhstan suggests the creatures died out 29,000 years ago more than 300,000 years later than previously thought.” “Researchers found fragments of the giant skull in the Pavlodar region of northeast Kazakhstan.”“Fossils suggest the Siberian unicorn stood 2 meters tall, 4 1/2 meters long and weighed 4 tons, making it bigger than today’s rhinos.”“Scientists believe the Siberian unicorns were herbivores and their habitat extended from western Russia to eastern Kazakhstan.”“One theory is that the south of Western Siberia was a refuge for the beasts, which allowed them to survive much longer than similar creatures.”SOURCE: American Journal of Applied Scienceshttp://thescipub.com/PDF/ajassp.2016.189.199.pdf***For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,unicorn,unicorns,unicorns are real,unicorns caught on tape,siberian unicorn,unicorn skull,rhino,kazakhstan

item.title: Huge drugs tunnel discovered under US-Mexico border
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA massive state-of-the-art tunnel used to smuggle drugs between Mexico and the US was discovered by authorities during a raid, federal officials announced on Wednesday. The tunnel, connecting warehouses in Otay Mesa, near San Diego, and Tijuana in Mexico was discovered on Wednesday following simultaneous raids on both sides of the border.Officials said the tunnel was about 30 feet deep and around 2,400 feet long and featured lighting, (pause) a ventilation system, (pause) and rail tracks for transportation of the drugs.While pulleys were believed to be used by the smugglers for loading and unloading on the U.S. side of the tunnel, according to police. The bust came after a six-month operation by Homeland Security’s ICE division that saw undercover agents arrange to provide drivers for the smugglers.Sixteen people were arrested in Mexico and six were detained in the U.S., while a total of 12 tonnes of marijuana was recovered. Mexican police said that two of the suspects told them they were working for a drug cartel operating in the state of Jalisco a reference to the Jalisco New Generation that is linked to the cartel of Joaquin ‘El Chapo’ Guzman, who escaped from a maximum security prison in July.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Location of drug tunnel near San Diego2. Cutaway showing dimensions of the tunnel (depth 30 feet, length 2,400 feet)3. Features of the tunnel (lighting, ventilation and rails)4. Pulley system used in tunnel5. Depiction of an undercover agent striking a deal with the smugglers6. Details of bust including number of arrests (22) and amount of drugs recovered (12 tonnes)VOICEOVER (in English): The tunnel, connecting warehouses in Otay Mesa, near San Diego, and Tijuana in Mexico was discovered on Wednesday following simultaneous raids on both sides of the border.Officials said the tunnel was about 30 feet deep and around 2,400 feet long and featured lighting, (pause) a ventilation system, (pause) and rail tracks for transportation of the drugs.While pulleys were believed to be used by the smugglers for loading and unloading on the US side of the tunnel, according to police. The bust came after a six-month operation by Homeland Security’s ICE that saw undercover agents arrange to provide drivers for the smugglers.Sixteen people were arrested in Mexico and six were detained in the US, while a total of 12 tonnes of marijuana was recovered. SOURCE: ABChttp://abcnews.go.com/US/sophisticated-super-drug-tunnel-california-mexico-discovered/story?id=34666647***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: White House has plan to counter catastrophic solar storms
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twNo internet. No mobile phones. No electricity to power refrigerators, run the vacuum cleaner or keep the lights on. No respite for weeks or possibly months. No Netflix. This is what would happen should a massive solar storm hit Earth, the threat of which the White House is taking seriously.In October, the White House published a 19-page paper outlining preparations and responses to massive solar electromagnetic pulses (EMP) that could potentially cripple key infrastructure.Dubbed the “National Space Weather Strategy,” the document calls for more studies on potential effects of space weather on power grids; more research to better model and predict space weather; and more cooperation among scientists and agencies at the international level, among other proposals.Scientists for years have warned of the potential dangers of solar EMPs. In 2013, insurance company Lloyd’s of London estimated the economic fallout as high as $2.6 trillion should a massive storm hit.Space weather can be traced to coronal mass ejections, or huge bursts of gas most often associated with solar flares. These solar storms send huge quantities of electromagnetic radiation toward Earth. That’s not good for power grids. A solar EMP could take entire power grids offline, plunging the world into darkness. In 1859, one of the biggest solar storms ever recorded hit Earth, in what scientists now call the Carrington event. Society before the start of the Civil War didn’t depend on electricity as we do today. So the impact was limited to disrupted telegraph lines and shocked telegraph operators. But the world today wouldn’t get off so easy. In 1989, a much smaller solar storm caused the collapse of Hydro-Quebec’s electricity transmission system, resulting in a nine-hour power outage.In 2012, we got lucky. Scientists observed a solar storm believed to be as big the Carrington event. Fortunately, because the sun rotates on its own axis, Earth was facing away from the storm and missed it by about nine days.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Depiction of coronal mass ejection2. Electromagnetic radiation hitting Earth3. Power grids and electricity shutting down4. Depiction of Carrington event5. Depiction of 1989 solar storm6. Depiction of 2012 solar storm7. Depiction of White House proposals VOICEOVER (in English): “So-called space weather events can be traced to coronal mass ejections, or huge bursts of gas most often associated with solar flares.”“These solar storms send huge quantities of electromagnetic radiation toward the earth.”“That’s not good for power grids. A solar electromagnetic pulse, or EMP, could take entire power grids offline, plunging the world into darkness.”“In 1859, one of the biggest solar storms ever recorded, the Carrington Event, hit the earth. It disrupted telegraph systems and shocked telegraph operators.”“A much smaller solar storm in 1989 caused the collapse of Hydro-Quebec’s electricity transmission system, resulting in a nine-hour power outage.”“In 2012, scientists observed a solar storm believed to be as big the Carrington Event. Fortunately, it missed earth by about nine days.”“The US is preparing for the next large solar EMP. It’s studying potential effects of space weather on power grids, backing research to better model and predict space weather, and calling for greater cooperation among scientists and agencies at the international level.” SOURCES: https://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/microsites/ostp/final_nationalspaceweatherstrategy_20151028.pdf***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,solar storms,space weather,solar electromagnetic pulses,EMP,coronal mass ejections

item.title: Workers find skeletons, coffins in burial vaults under Washington Square Park
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twDozens of skeletal remains were unearthed in the Big Apple just days after Halloween near an area that used to be a public burial ground.According to Fox 5, contractors for the New York City Department of Design and Construction were digging to replace water mains near Washington Square Park earlier this week when they discovered crypts containing human remains three feet beneath the ground.Two 15-by-20 foot burial vaults were discovered side-by-side, each with a wooden door and about 8 feet deep. One crypt contained the skeletal remains of about 9 to 12 people, while the other had wooden coffins stacked one on top of the other, reports the New York Post.Both are believed to date back to the late 18th or early 19th century, and was likely part of a cemetery that may have belonged to one of two Presbyterian churches that stood in the area.Archaeologists working with the city are investigating the vaults and will be focusing on identifying those buried. Engineers are planning a new route for the water main project in order to avoid disturbing the burial grounds, reports NBC.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Washington square park on map2. Construction ongoing3. 19th century New York4. Burial vaults5. Archaeologists studying skeletonsVOICEOVER (in English): “New York City workers were carrying out construction to replace water mains near Washington Square park earlier this week...”“...when they discovered crypts containing human remains three feet beneath the ground.”“Two 15-by-20-foot burial vaults were discovered side-by-side, each about 8 feet deep, with wooden doors.”“One crypt contained the skeletal remains of about nine to 12 people, while the other had wooden coffins stacked together.”“Both date back to the late 18th or early 19th century, and were possibly part of a Presbyterian church cemetery.”“Archaeologists working with the city are now focusing on identifying each of the skeletons.”SOURCES: New York Post, Pix11 News, CNN, Fox 5, NBC New Yorkhttp://nypost.com/2015/11/05/vault-full-of-skeletons-found-under-washington-square-park/http://pix11.com/2015/11/04/old-burial-vault-human-bones-found-beneath-greenwich-village-park/http://edition.cnn.com/videos/world/2015/10/27/ancient-greek-warrior-tomb-discovered-orig.cnn/video/playlists/ancient-discoveries/http://www.fox5ny.com/news/44849964-storyhttp://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/local/Old-Burial-Vault-Found-Beneath-Greenwich-Village-Park--340589992.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Woman sues Honda after airbag severs her throat during car crash
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA woman has filed a lawsuit against Honda and other companies after an airbag that deployed wrongly during a car crash severely damaged her throat and left her unable to speak, KUTV reported.According to the lawsuit, 25-year-old Randi Johnston was driving her 2003 Honda Civic to work on September 29, when she rear-ended a car in front of her. Her airbag failed failed to deploy properly, instead exploding with shrapnel and causing damage to her neck and head.Earlier this year several car manufacturers, including Honda, recalled nearly 34 million cars over problems with Takata airbags. Inside airbags is an inflator, which is filled with propellant granules and propellants, reported Reuters. Unlike most brands, Takata-designed propellants are made from ammonium nitrate. If exposed to high humidity, the propellants can end up damaged, which causes them to produce excess pressure inside the inflator, making it crack and explode.During the crash Johnston’s trachea was severed and vocal chords damaged by a piece of shrapnel, reported the Salt Lake Tribune. As a result she cannot currently speak and is suing several corporations including Takata and Honda for her injuries.Johnston can only communicate by writing on a notepad and her family are uncertain if she’ll ever get her voice back, reported KUTV. Currently no court dates have been set for her case.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Car crash 2. Interior view of crash3. Explanation of airbag4. How the inflator may explode5. Johnston’s injuriesVOICEOVER (in English): 25-year-old Randi Johnston was driving her 2003 Honda Civic to work on September 29, when she rear-ended a car in front of her. Her airbag failed to deploy properly, the explosive force sending shrapnel into her head and neck.In May several car manufacturers, including Honda, recalled nearly 34 million cars over problems with Takata airbags. Airbags contain an inflator, which is filled with granules and propellants. Unlike most brands, Takata-designed propellants are made from ammonium nitrate.If exposed to high humidity, the propellants can end up damaged, which causes them to produce excess pressure inside the inflator, making it crack and explode.During the crash, Johnston’s trachea was severed and her vocal chords damaged by a piece of shrapnel. She now cannot speak and is suing Takata, Honda and others for her injuries.SOURCES: Motley Rice LLC, KUTV, Fox 13 Now, Salt Lake Tribune, Reutershttp://www.motleyrice.com/sites/default/files/documents/General/Johnstonv.Takata-Filed_Complaint.pdfhttp://kutv.com/news/local/utah-family-joins-airbag-lawsuit-after-shrapnel-almost-kills-daughterhttp://fox13now.com/2015/11/11/centerville-woman-sues-after-airbag-malfunction-severs-her-trachea-and-vocal-chords/http://www.sltrib.com/home/3166129-155/utah-woman-sues-honda-local-dealershiphttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/10/20/us-autos-takata-rosekind-idUSKCN0SD1VO20151020http://www.reuters.com/article/2015/06/25/us-autos-takata-idUSKBN0P503D20150625***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,airbag injury,utah,throat severed,takata,five car crash,salt lake city,tomonews,takata airbags,takata recall,randi johntson

item.title: NASA says mysterious star is likely surrounded by comets
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twMysterious debris surrounding a star that scientists earlier this year posited may be an alien megastructure is actually likely to be just comets, according to NASA.The space agency used its Spitzer Space Telescope to observe infrared light data from the star, KIC 8462852, to test for other possibilities of what the debris maybe. NASA explained that if planetary impact or an asteroid collision was the cause of the debris, there would have been excess infrared light surrounding the star. Spitzer found none.“Spitzer has observed all of the hundreds of thousands of stars where Kepler hunted for planets, in the hope of finding infrared emission from circumstellar dust,” Michael Werner, the Spitzer project scientist at NASA, said in a press release on the Jet Propulsion Laboratory’s website.While NASA doesn't specifically rule out the megastructure theory, it gives more credence to the idea that comets of varying shapes and sizes are what caused the anomaly initially observed.The research was led by Massimo Marengo of Iowa State University and has been accepted for publication in the Astrophysical Journal Letters.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Star surrounded by alien megastructure, then by comets2. Spitzer telescope observing star3. Asteroid collision, infrared image 4. Comets in front of the starVOICEOVER (in English): “An anomaly around the star KIC 8462852 that scientists earlier this year posited may be evidence of an alien megastructure is likely to be a swarm of comets, new research suggests.”“NASA used the Spitzer Space Telescope to observe data from the star in infrared light to test for other possibilities of what the debris may be.”“NASA says that if planetary impact or an asteroid collision was the cause of the debris, there would have been excess infrared light surrounding the star. Spitzer found none.”“While NASA doesn't rule out the megastructure theory, it gives more weight to the notion that comets of varying shapes and sizes are what caused the anomaly initially observed.”SOURCES: NASA, CNNhttp://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/news.php?feature=4777http://edition.cnn.com/2015/11/25/us/nasa-space-anomaly-comets/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Alien megastructure star,nasa,alien megastructure nasa,debris,KIC 8462852,comets nasa megastructure

item.title: Graphene solar panels could generate electricity from raindrops
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twScientists in China are producing solar panels that can produce energy from the last source you’d expect rainwater.In a study published in the journal Angewandte Chemie, researchers in China introduced a new type of solar panel that adds a layer of graphene, or carbon atoms arranged in a honeycomb structure, to dye-sensitized solar cells. A flexible layer of indium tin oxide and plastic is included underneath.Graphene has unusual properties that allow electrons to move freely throughout the entire layer. According to the researchers, rainwater contains positively charged ions like ammonium, calcium and sodium. When water binds to the panel’s surface, a double-layer of positive ions and negatively charged electrons is created, which ends up producing a voltage and current.Tests of the new solar panels have been able to produce hundreds of microvolts, which is small even compared to a standard AA battery, reports Quartz. The solar-to-electric energy conversion stood at about 7 percent, which is much lower than the 20 percent energy conversion achieved by the best solar panels on the market. So there’s a long way to go before the new solar panels become more widely used. But more efficient future versions could mean big things for the solar industry.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. How a normal solar panel works2. Scientists added a layer of graphene onto solar panels3. Electrons moving across the graphene layer4. Rainwater contains various compounds5. Positive ions from rain bind to the graphene surface, create voltageVOICEOVER (in English): “In a typical solar panel, photons from a light source knock electrons free from atoms within the panel, and the action generates a flow of electricity.”“Researchers are introducing a new type of solar panel by adding a layer of graphene, or carbon atoms arranged in a honeycomb structure, to dye-sensitized solar cells. A flexible layer of indium tin oxide and plastic is included underneath.”“Graphene has unusual properties that allow electrons to move freely throughout the entire layer.”“Rainwater contains positively charged ions like ammonium, calcium and sodium. When water binds to the panel’s surface, a double-layer of positive ions and negatively charged electrons is created, which ends up producing a voltage and current.”SOURCES: IEEE Spectrum, Science Daily, Quartz, Science News Journalhttp://spectrum.ieee.org/energywise/green-tech/solar/graphene-could-help-generate-power-from-rainhttps://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/04/160406075516.htmhttp://qz.com/658757/graphene-coated-solar-panels-can-create-electricity-from-raindrops/http://sciencenewsjournal.com/future-solar-panels-will-generate-energy-raindrops/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,solar power,how do solar panels work,how does solar energy work,graphene solar cell,graphene technology,green technology,new green technology,future green technology

item.title: Radiation still a concern 30 years after Chernobyl blast
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twThirty years after a botched experiment resulted in a catastrophic nuclear disaster, engineers are still working to contain the radiation.Reuters reports that on April 26, 1986, an explosion tore through a reactor at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant in Pripyat, Ukraine. It sent deadly clouds of atomic material into the air and is considered to be the world’s worst nuclear accident.Months after the blast, a concrete sarcophagus was built over Reactor 4 to contain the radioactive material inside. Years later, radiation is still present. A recent investigation carried out by the Associated Press showed that milk from nearby farms contained a radioactive isotope 10 times higher than the allowed limit.With the sarcophagus having since deteriorated, engineers are currently building a giant stainless steel arch more than 350 feet high and 500 feet long to replace it, according to the Wall Street Journal. Called the New Safe Confinement, the 36,000-ton structure will be wheeled in place upon its completion in 2017, effectively sealing the sarcophagus.Giant hover cranes in the arch will then disassemble and clean up the exploded reactor contained inside, reports National Geographic.More than 40 countries donated funding for the arch, which is expected to prevent further leaks for the next 100 years.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Concrete sarcophagus over Reactor 4 blast area2. High radiation levels in milk3. Stainless steel arch being built to replace sarcophagus4. Enclosure wheeled into place in 20175. Giant cranes inside will break down and clean exploded reactorVOICEOVER (in English): “Months after the Chernobyl blast in 1986, a concrete sarcophagus was built over Reactor 4 to contain the radioactive material inside.”“Years later, radiation is still present. Recent findings show milk from nearby farms contain a radioactive isotope 10 times higher than the allowed limit.”“The sarcophagus has since deteriorated, and engineers are currently building a giant stainless steel arch more than 350 feet high and 500 feet long to replace it.”“Called the New Safe Confinement, the 36,000-ton structure will be wheeled in place upon completion in 2017, effectively sealing the sarcophagus.”“Giant hover cranes in the arch will then disassemble and clean up the exploded reactor contained inside.”SOURCES: Wall Street Journal, Reuters, National Geographic, Associated Press, CNNhttp://www.wsj.com/articles/30-years-after-chernobyl-disaster-an-arch-rises-to-seal-melted-reactor-1461526871http://www.reuters.com/article/us-chernobyl-anniversary-idUSKCN0XN008http://news.nationalgeographic.com/2016/04/042516-chernobyl-new-safe-confinement-contains-radiation/http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/E/EU_CHERNOBYL_RADIOACTIVE_FOOD?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULThttp://edition.cnn.com/2016/04/25/world/containing-chernobyl-dome-anniversary-radiation/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Chernobyl anniversary,chernobyl nuclear plant,chernobyl explosion,chernobyl blast,nuclear accident,radiation,radioactive materials,nuclear blast,nuclear explosion,nuclear,radioactive,new safe confinement

item.title: Aerospace firm patents solar window shade that can charge electronic devices
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twB/E Aerospace has filed a patent for a solar window shade that can charge electronic devices in an airplane.The device is designed with solar panels on the outer surface to receive sunlight, which would convert solar energy into power. The shades, which would be equipped with wired or wireless charging ports, would allow passengers to directly plug in their devices.The high tech window shade weighs only slightly more than an ordinary window shade (29-50 grams), according to B/E Aerospace. The company also claims it will actually “generate more energy than the extra fuel required” to carry it.B/E Aerospace says a single 737 making six 1000 nautical mile trips everyday would save around $22,000, conserve over 7300 gallons of fuel per year, and reduce 154,000 pounds of CO2 emissions.Modern planes that are equipped with traditional power points or USB outlets are powered by the plane’s internal electrical system. These systems require long lengths of wiring and interconnections, which add significant cost and weight to the interior construction of the plane, B/E Aerospace says.B/E Aerospace’s patent filing states the shade could easily be adapted for use on current airplanes or other aircraft, and requires no change to the rest of a cabin’s components.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Solar panel window shade charging2. Passenger charging electronic devices through window shade3. Weight comparison between old and new window shade4. Savings for airlines using new window shades5. Traditional electric wiring increasing costs for airlinesVOICEOVER (in English): “B/E Aerospace has filed a patent for airplane wi ndow shades that are equipped with solar panels.”“The solar cells integrated into the window shades harness energy from the sun and turn it into power passengers can charge their electronic devices with.”“The company claims these new devices would only weigh slightly more than ordinary window shades …”“ … and generate more energy than the extra fuel required to carry them. These devices would allow airlines to save money, conserve fuel, and reduce CO2 emissions.”“Modern planes equipped with traditional power points or USB outlets that are powered by the plane’s electrical system require long lengths of wiring that end up being costly.”SOURCES: DAILY MAIL, SKIFThttp://www.dailymail.co.uk/travel/travel_news/article-3617817/Plane-window-shade-charge-passengers-phones.htmlhttps://skift.com/2015/04/17/this-eco-friendly-airplane-window-shade-could-be-your-smartphones-new-best-friend/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: California may end observance of daylight saving time
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twCalifornia may soon join Arizona and Hawaii as the only states without daylight saving time.A bill to end the state’s observance of daylight saving time has cleared its first committee. Assembly Bill 385 needs to gain approval by a two-thirds majority of both houses of the California Legislature and be signed by Governor Jerry Brown. The measure would then be put before the public for a referendum, asking voters whether or not the state should eliminate the practice.Proponents of the bill say that altered summertime hours lead to a higher risk of health issues stemming from interrupted sleep cycles.According to a study presented at the American Academy of Neurology’s 68th Annual Meeting in April, overall rate for stroke was 8 percent higher in the two days after daylight saving time. Cancer victims were 25 percent more likely to have a stroke during that time, and people older than 65 were 20 percent more likely to have a stroke. A study conducted by the University of Alabama at Birmingham found that the changing of clocks in spring for daylight saving time is associated with a 10 percent increase in risk of heart attacks.Opponents of the bill argue the practice saves energy, which was one of its original intended purposes.A Department of Energy report released in 2008 found that U.S. electricity use was decreased by 0.5 percent for each day of the extended DST, resulting in a savings of 0.03 percent for the year as a whole. Those savings amount to 1.3 billion kilowatt-hours, enough to power about 122,000 average U.S. homes for a year. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Daylight saving time: spring forward2. Daylight saving time: fall back3. Hour and sunlight differences4. Energy savings5. Health risks6. Areas that observe daylight saving timeVOICEOVER (in English): “Daylight saving time was introduced to conserve energy during wartime. In spring, clocks are turned one hour forward,""so that the evening lasts one hour longer without sacrificing normal sunrise times. During the fall, clocks are readjusted back one hour to normal, standard time.” “The practice allows for more natural sunlight hours, thereby reducing the need to use electricity to power lights in the evening.”“Supporters of daylight saving time say the practice conserves energy. A Department of Energy report released in 2008 found that due to daylight saving time, the U.S. saved 1.3 billion kilowatt-hours, enough to power about 122,000 average U.S. homes for a year.”“Opponents of daylight saving time argue that altering clocks lead to greater health risks. Studies show that in the days following daylight saving time, the overall rate for stroke was 8 percent higher. The rate for heart attacks was 10 percent higher. The rates correspond to the effects of sleep deprivation.”“Only 70 countries and 48 states currently observe daylight saving time. Arizona and Hawaii are two states that opt out of daylight saving time.”SOURCES: The Sacramento Bee, Department of Energy, CNN, American Academy of Neurology, University of Alabama at Birminghamhttp://www.sacbee.com/news/politics-government/capitol-alert/article83558137.htmlhttp://energy.gov/articles/top-8-things-you-didn-t-know-about-daylight-saving-timehttp://www.cnn.com/2016/03/11/health/daylight-saving-time-health-effects/https://www.aan.com/PressRoom/Home/PressRelease/1440https://www.uab.edu/news/focus-on-patient-care/item/2141-heart-attacks-rise-following-daylight-saving-time***For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Daylight saving,daylight saving time,dst,daylight savings time,spring forward,fall back,time change,california,assembly bill 385

item.title: Survival Capsule designed to save lives during tsunami
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twA new emergency shelter, the Survival Capsule, was designed to help save lives during a tsunami.The 2011 tsunami off Japan’s coast that was triggered by the Tōhoku earthquake, killing almost 16,000 people and injuring 6,000 more, was what inspired Julian Sharpe and Scott Hill to create the Survival Capsule. Sharpe and Hill designed to capsule with the less-mobile the elderly, the infirm, and the young in mind.The Survival Capsule team entered the concept in a May 2011 NASA Tech Brief competition and placed ninth out of 350 entries. In emergency situations, the survival capsule could act as a safety shelter for those who have problems evacuating, especially on last-minute’s notice. The capsules are spherical metal cages sheathed in aircraft-grade aluminum shells to absorb impact. The internal walls are lined with ceramic thermal blankets to protect passengers from extreme heat. Each capsule is equipped with 60-minute air tank in case it is submerged under water. Tsunami waves typically move at around 25 mph, but the Survival Capsule’s tests have found that the capsule can withstand impacts from objects at up to 75 mph.Capsules are available for pre-order in five different capacities ranging from two to 10 people each, with varying seating designs.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Shelter is boarded.2. Shelter age and wall.3. Shelter interior wall.4. Air tank.5. Seating.6. Shelter during tsunami.VOICEOVER (in English): “In emergency situations, the survival capsule could act as a safety shelter for those who have problems evacuating, especially on a last-minute’s notice.” “The capsules are spherical metal cages sheathed in aircraft-grade aluminum shells to absorb impact.” “The internal walls are lined with ceramic thermal blankets to protect from extreme heat.”“And each capsule is equipped with 60-minute air tank in case it is submerged under water.” “Capsules come in five different capacities ranging from two to 10 people each with varying seating designs.”“Tsunami waves typically flow around 25 mph, but Survival Capsule’s tests have found that the capsule can withstand impacts from objects at up to 75 mph.”SOURCES: Create the Future Design Contest, Survival Capsule, Fast Companyhttp://contest.techbriefs.com/2011/entries/safety-and-security/1472http://survival-capsule.com/http://www.fastcompany.com/3047684/innovation-agents/can-this-capsule-help-you-survive-a-tsunami***For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,tsunami,shelter,survival,survivalist,survival capsule,emergency shelter,survival tactics,survival kit,survival shelter,technology,shelter from the storm,tsunami safety,tsunami shelter,natural disaster

item.title: Road collapses just 200 meters from Florence’s historic Ponte Vecchio bridge
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twA stretch of road collapsed in central Florence on Wednesday, swallowing a row of parked cars and cutting water supplies.The sinkhole formed under Lungarno Torrigiani, a road that runs alongside the Arno River. It was 200 meters long, 6 meters wide and up to 7 meters deep, according to reports.The collapse occurred just 200 meters from the Ponte Vecchio, a 14th century bridge that is one of the key landmarks of the ancient city, La Repubblica reported.At around 1 a.m., a crack occurred in a cast-iron water pipe running underneath Lungarno Torrigiani. Cracks then formed in the road above, before the leak was temporarily fixed, La Repubblica reported.Several hours later, a second blowout in the 60-centimeter-diameter pipe led to more underground flooding. The road then collapsed, submerging some 20 parked cars, according to La Repubblica.No one was injured in the incident. Florence mayor Dario Nardella assured residents there was no threat to the city’s historic center, the Guardian reported.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Map of Italy and location of Florence2. Road collapses3. Cross-section beneath the road; first crack in water pipe4. Water flows out of crack; cracks form in road5. Second crack forms in pipe6. Water flows out of second cracks, road collapses forming sinkholeVOICEOVER (in English): “A 200-meter stretch of road collapsed on the banks of the Arno River, which runs through Florence.”“The chasm formed in the early hours of Wednesday and submerged some 20 parked cars in water.” “At around 1 a.m., a crack occurred in a cast-iron water pipe running underneath a road by the riverbank.”“Cracks then formed in the road above, before the leak was temporarily fixed.” “Several hours later, a second blowout in the 60-centimeter diameter pipe led to more underground flooding.”“The road then collapsed, with the sinkhole reaching up to 7 meters deep in some places.” SOURCES: The Guardian, Washington Post, La Repubblicahttp://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/may/25/florence-road-collapse-sinks-row-of-cars-ponte-vecchio-street-italyhttps://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2016/05/25/massive-sinkhole-along-florence-river-swallows-dozens-of-cars/http://firenze.repubblica.it/cronaca/2016/05/25/news/florence_road_at_ponte_vecchio_collapses-140561179/?refresh_ce***For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,florence,firenze,ponte vecchio,arno river,florence road collapse,florence sinkhole,road collapse,sinkhole,sink hole,sinkhole appears,road sinkhole,sinkholes,sinkhole florence,sinkholes 2016,sinkhole 2016,lungarno torrigiani

item.title: Australia develops cattle-herding robots
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twAustralian researchers have developed a special robot that can herd cattle in large, rugged terrain that may eventually replace farmers and herding dogs.The robot is known as the SwagBot. It is a battery-operated, omnidirectional ground vehicle developed by Australian Centre for Field Robotics.The SwagBot can move as fast as 20 kilometers per hour on smooth terrain. During its first field test, the robot demonstrated that it can also navigate through rugged terrain.“The trial has been very successful so far, so it’s given us the confidence to move to the next phase,” Salah Sukkarieh of the University of Sydney, the leader of the trial told New Scientist.The team is working on algorithms that will allow the SwagBot to detect changes in body temperature and postures of the cattle in order to monitor their health. It will also be equipped with colour and shape sensors to identify a good pasture land for the cattle.According to the New Scientist, the Swagbot will be the first robot in the world to be able to monitor the health of livestock if the algorithms are tested successfully.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Depiction of SwagBot is battery-powered and omnidirectional2. Speed of SwagBot on smooth terrain; SwagBot moves on rugged terrain3. Depiction of algorithm in SwagBot allows it to detect body temperature and movement4. SwagBot detects colour and shape in a fieldVOICEOVER (in English): “The SwagBot is a battery-operated, omnidirectional ground vehicle.”“It can move as fast as 20 kilometers per hour on smooth terrain, as well as navigate through rugged terrain.”“The creators of the device are working on algorithms that will allow the SwagBot to detect changes in body temperature and the posture of the cattle in order to monitor their health.”“It will also be equipped with color and shape sensors to identify good pasture for the cattle.”SOURCES: Australian Centre for Field Robotics, New Scientist, Mashablehttp://confluence.acfr.usyd.edu.au/display/AGPub/Our+Robotshttps://www.newscientist.com/article/2097004-cattle-herding-robot-swagbot-makes-debut-on-australian-farms/http://mashable.com/2016/07/13/swagbot-agriculture-robot-australia/#oqPTluDW4mqL***For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Luxury cruise ship Crystal Serenity prepares to enter Arctic waters
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twHigh-end tourism came to one of the last wildernesses on the planet on Tuesday, when a huge luxury cruise ship entered Arctic waters.The Crystal Serenity is 82 feet long and weighs more than 68,000 tons. The ship is carrying around 1,000 passengers, who have each paid upwards of $22,000 for a trip only made possible by the melting of ice in the notoriously treacherous waters of the Northwest Passage linking the Pacific and northern Atlantic oceans.The ship left Seward, Alaska last week and docked in the city of Nome on Monday, its last stop before entering Arctic waters, Crystal Berg reported.The ship’s sold-out voyage has raised concerns among the green lobby, who believe it is taking advantage of climate change and could lead to environmental damage in the Arctic by opening the gates to more cruise ships.The Crystal Serenity is accompanied by an ice-breaking boat and two helicopters. The ship is expected to stop in Greenland as it makes its way through the Northwest Passage to New York.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Crystal Serenity carrying 1,000 tourists paying at least $22,000 each2. Route of ship from Seward to Nome, Alaska3. Crystal Serenity accompanied by ice-breaking ship and two helicopters4. Route of ship from Nome to New YorkVOICEOVER (in English): “The Crystal Serenity is carrying around 1,000 passengers, who have each paid upwards of $22,000 for the trip.”“The ship left Seward, Alaska last week and docked in the city of Nome on Monday, its last stop before entering Arctic waters.”“The Crystal Serenity is accompanied by an ice-breaking boat and two helicopters.”“The ship is expected to stop in Greenland as it makes its way through the Northwest Passage to New York.”SOURCES: Washington Post, Capital Berg, Arctic Journalhttps://www.washingtonpost.com/news/energy-environment/wp/2016/08/16/a-luxury-cruise-ship-sets-sail-for-the-arctic-thanks-to-climate-change/?tid=pm_business_pop_b&utm_term=.4a863bbc7d5ehttp://www.capitalberg.com/crystal-serenity-arrives-nome/29867/http://arcticjournal.com/business/2527/destination-uncertain***For story suggestions please contact tips@nextanimation.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
