item.title: NASA-funded study says cryogenic sleep may be key to space travel
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA NASA-funded study written by aerospace engineering company SpaceWorks says that keeping astronauts unconscious during long flights in space cuts down on the equipment and resources needed on the shuttle, and also eliminates the negative psychological effects of long hauls in space.According to SpaceWorks’ study on cryogenic sleep, which borrowed ideas from doctors, a human body can be forced into a state of hibernation by simply lowering the body temperature to 93 degrees Fahrenheit. The lowered body temperature causes the body’s heart rate and metabolism to decrease, effectively placing it in a state of unconsciousness. The body will subsist on intravenous feeding tubes that pump the necessary lipids, amino acids and various nutrients into the body. Other tubes will drain urine as well as monitor the body.According to mockups, a torpor-statis habitat can hold six astronauts at once and robotic arms will ensure everyone’s basic needs are met. In their study, SpaceWorks says that they imagine the crew would wake up in a staggered pattern so that at least one person is awake at all times. So far humans are only able to maintain stasis for two weeks, although the trip from Earth to Mars is expected to take up to nine months.NASA has declined to fund the second stage of the research though and SpaceWorks, citing its potential therapeutic benefits, is now looking into using the technology here on Earth.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Hypothermia used to put an astronaut in a state of hibernation2. How hypothermia affects the body’s state3. How the astronauts will obtain sustenance while they’re asleep4. Spaceworks’ “Torpor Statis Habitat” can support six astronauts at once5. Robots will ensure everybody’s basic needs are met6. So far humans are only able to maintain stasis for two weeksVOICEOVER (in English): “According to the NASA-funded study on cryogenic sleep, a human body can be placed in hibernation by simply lowering the body temperature to 93 degrees Fahrenheit.”“The lowered body temperature causes the body’s heart rate and metabolism to decrease.”“The body will subsist on intravenous feeding tubes that pump the necessary nutrients into the body. Other tubes will drain urine as well as monitor the body.”“According to mockups, a torpor-statis habitat can hold six astronauts at once and robotic arms will ensure everyone’s basic needs are met.”“So far humans are only able to maintain stasis for 14 days, although the trip from Earth to Mars is expected to take up to nine months, or about 274 days.”SOURCES: Digital Journal, NASA, CNNhttp://www.digitaljournal.com/science/how-cryogenic-sleep-might-become-a-reality/article/441920http://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/files/NIAC_Torpor_Habitat_for_Human_Stasis.pdfhttp://edition.cnn.com/2014/10/07/tech/innovation/mars-hibernation-flight/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: U.S. train passengers could soon face ‘airport-level’ security measures
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twAmtrak is stepping up security measures on trains after an attack on a high-speed rail in France was foiled on August 21 and ahead of Pope Francis' visit to the United States next month.According to CBS News, Amtrak has a 500-officer police force, as well as New York Metropolitan Transit Authority (MTA) police and a Transportation Security Administration (TSA) program to assist with security on the Northeast Corridor. But many small train stations have little security, which means anyone could potentially run right up to a train and get on it without being stopped or asked questions.The most sensitive target at the moment seems to be the Northeast Corridor between New York and Washington, which will see an increase in ridership during the Pope’s visit next month. Homeland Security already deploys what are called VIPR teams along the Northeast Corridor, which include agents in uniform and bomb-sniffing dogs, as well as agents out uniform who blend in with passengers to detect any suspicious activity. Unlike at U.S. airports, mandatory full-body scan have not been introduced, but the VIPR program, which has a budget of more than $100 million, is expanding. In a statement published on its website, Amtrak said that “passengers failing to consent to security procedures will be denied access to trains.”Amtrak aimed at introducing such security measures at train stations already five years ago, but high costs and the complexity of the project prevented Amtrak from investing in it.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Amtrak police force, MTA police and TSA program2. Small train station with no security check3. The Northeast Corridor between New York and Washington and increase of passengers 4. Agents in uniform and bomb-sniffing dogs along the Northeast Corridor5. Agents out of uniform blending in with passengers6. Full-body scanning at train station entranceVOICEOVER (in English): “Amtrak has a 500-officer police force, as well as New York Metropolitan Transit Authority police and a TSA program to assist with security on the Northeast Corridor.”“But many small train stations have little security, which means anyone could potentially run right up to a train and get on it without being stopped or asked questions.”“The most sensitive target at the moment seems to be the Northeast Corridor between New York and Washington, which will see an increase in ridership during the Pope’s visit next month.”“Homeland Security already deploys what are called VIPR teams along the Northeast Corridor, which include agents in uniform and bomb-sniffing dogs, as well as agents out uniform who blend in with passengers to detect any suspicious activity.”“Unlike at U.S. airports, mandatory full body scan have not been introduced, but the VIPR program, which has a budget of more than $100 million, is expanding.”SOURCES: CBS News, Amtrakhttp://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2015/08/24/trains-could-soon-see-airport-level-security/http://www.amtrak.com/safety-security***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: China’s land reclamation in the South China Sea grows
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA new Pentagon report released on Thursday says that China’s reclamation efforts in the Spratly Islands has grown dramatically over the last few months, and at a rate far faster than earlier this year.Previous estimates that China has reclaimed 2,000 acres since December 2013 are wrong, the Pentagon report says, and the real amount is around 2,900 acres. According to the Pentagon, China has reclaimed more land in the past 20 months than the other claimants combined over the past 40 years. China said in early August that it has halted its reclamation efforts in the island chain, although many countries question these claims.On Fiery Cross Reef, China has built an airstrip that the country could use as an alternative to an aircraft carrier. Reuters reports that the 3,000-metre-long runway will most likely be operational by the end of this year.At many of the reclamation sites in the Spratlys, China has also built channels and berthing areas for large ships.The new Pentagon report, titled “The Asia-Pacific Maritime Security Strategy,” was required by Congress ahead of a 2015 defense bill.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Territorial claims in the South China Sea by country2. The amount of land China has reclaimed compared to other countries3. How much land China’s has reclaimed, according to the Pentagon4. China constructing an airstrip on Fiery Cross Reef5. China building channels and berthing areas for shipsVOICEOVER (in English): “The Spratly Islands are a string of islands in the South China Sea simultaneously claimed by China, Vietnam, Taiwan, Philippines and Malaysia.”“According to the Pentagon, compared to the reclamation efforts of other claimants combined over the past 40 years, the amount of land China has reclaimed within the last two years is 17 times greater.” “Initial reports that China has reclaimed 2,000 acres since December 2013 are wrong, the Pentagon report says, and the real amount is around 2,900 acres.” “On Fiery Cross Reef, China has built an airstrip...”“...and at many of the reclamation sites in the Spratlys, China has also built berthing areas for large ships.”SOURCES: Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, Business Insiderhttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/08/21/us-southchinasea-china-pentagon-idUSKCN0QQ0S920150821http://www.wsj.com/articles/pentagon-says-china-has-stepped-up-land-reclamation-in-south-china-sea-1440120837http://www.businessinsider.com.au/r-chinas-land-reclamation-in-south-china-sea-grows-pentagon-report-2015-8***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,South China Sea disputes,China land reclamation,China Spratly Islands,Spratly Island disputes,Pentagon South China Sea,US Asia-Pacific security

item.title: Former US President Jimmy Carter to be treated for brain cancer
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFormer U.S. president Jimmy Carter will treat his melanoma with pharmaceutical company Merck & CO’s Keytruda, a new treatment that stimulates a patient’s immune system so that it can fight cancer on its own, Reuters reported.Earlier this month, doctors removed about one tenth of Carter’s liver after he was diagnosed with a melanoma. The cancer, however, had already spread to his brain. To treat it, doctors have decided to use a new class of drug that works by boosting the body’s immune system.Our immune system works by recognizing invading bodies, such as viruses, using surface proteins on T-cells called receptors. These receptors interact with viruses like a lock and key. Once inside the T-cell, the virus is enveloped and destroyed.Cancer cells though, are able to evade T-cells by hiding from the receptors and are also able to suppress the receptors’ activity. Unlike viruses, cancer cells are not as easily destroyed and on the contrary they can multiply and spread to other tissues.The new drug works by removing the cancer cells’ blockade on T-cell receptors so that at that point it will be up to the patient’s own immune system to fight the cancer. T-cells would then be able envelope tumoral cells and destroy them. Pembrolizumab, which is sold under the brand name Keytruda, can cost as much as US $150,000 a year and, according to Dr. Anna Pavlick, co-director of the melanoma program at NYU Langone Medical Center's cancer center, only an estimated 40 percent of patients will respond positively to the treatment. Keytruda’s side-effects include fatigue and rash. Carter, who took his first infusion of the drug on Wednesday, said he only had a slight reaction and doctors think he will soon be able to resume many of his regular activities. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Jimmy Carter’s liver removal and cancer spreading to his brain2. Four cancer spots on Carter’s brain and the new drug3. T-cell being approached by a virus4. The virus being enveloped through receptors into the T-cell and being destroyed5. Cancer cells approaching T-cell and creating a blockade on T-cells receptors 6. The new drug pushing away the blockade and the cancer cells being enveloped into the T-cell and destroyedVOICEOVER (in English): “Earlier this month, doctors removed about one tenth of Carter’s liver after he was diagnosed with a melanoma. The cancer, however, had already spread to his brain.” “To treat the four spots of melanoma found in Carter’s brain, doctors will use a new class of drugs that works by boosting the the body’s immune system.”“Our immune system works by recognizing invading bodies, such as viruses, using surface proteins on T-cells called receptors.”“Viruses enter T-cells through these receptors, which interact with the viruses like a lock and key. Once inside the T-cell, the virus is enveloped and destroyed.” “Cancer cells though, are able to evade T-cells by hiding from the receptors and are also able to suppress the receptors’ activity. Unlike viruses then, cancer cells are not as easily destroyed and on the contrary they can multiply and spread to other tissues.” “The new drug works by removing the cancer cells’ blockade on T-cell receptors so that T-cells will be able to envelope tumoral cells and destroy them.”SOURCES: Washington Post, Reutershttp://www.washingtonpost.com/national/health-science/another-weapon-against-cancer/2015/05/28/7da387ae-057b-11e5-a428-c984eb077d4e_graphic.htmlhttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/08/20/us-usa-carter-idUSKCN0QP1M820150820http://www.reuters.com/article/2015/08/20/us-usa-carter-treatment-idUSKCN0QP2DS20150820***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Glass-bottomed pool suspended 35 m high to bridge luxury London flats
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA group of British architects and property developers have unveiled their plan to build a suspended glass pool, bridging two luxury apartments.Enclosed in glass 20 cm thick, the pool will be 25 metres long and 5 metres wide, with water approximately 1.2 metres deep.The so-called sky pool will be suspended 10 stories high, or 35 metres above ground. In comparison, Big Ben, London’s famous clock tower, stands at 96 metres high.The glass pool will connect two apartments of the Embassy Gardens development in southwest London’s new Nine Elms quarter.‘The experience of the pool will be truly unique, it will feel like floating through the air in central London,’ said Sean Mulryan, CEO of the developer Ballymore Group.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Bird’s eye view of planned suspended glass pool2. Dimensions of the pool3. Size comparison between the pool and Big Ben4. Man swimming in the pool5. View of the glass pool from belowVOICEOVER (in English): WORLD’S FIRST SUSPENDED GLASS POOLTO BRIDGE LUXURY FLATS IN LONDON“A group of British architects and property developers have unveiled their plan to build a suspended glass pool, bridging two luxury apartments.”“Enclosed in glass 20 cm thick, the pool will be 25 metres long and 5 metres wide, with water approximately 1.2 metres deep.”“The so-called sky pool will be suspended 10 stories high, or 35 metres above ground. In comparison, Big Ben, London’s famous clock tower, stands at 96 metres high.”“The glass pool will connect two apartments of the Embassy Gardens development in southwest London’s new Nine Elms quarter.”“‘The experience of the pool will be truly unique, it will feel like floating through the air in central London,’ said Sean Mulryan, CEO of the developer Ballymore Group.”SOURCES: CBC, Design Boom, Dezeen, HAL Architects, Inhabitat, The Vergehttp://www.cbc.ca/news/trending/floating-pool-london-sky-1.3198022http://www.designboom.com/architecture/glass-bottomed-sky-pool-embassy-gardens-legacy-buildings-london-hal-architects-arup-08-20-2015/http://www.dezeen.com/2015/08/19/glass-bottomed-swimming-pool-arup-associates-nine-elms-south-london/http://www.halarchitects.co.uk/#!embassy-gardens-legacy-buildings/cgynhttp://inhabitat.com/worlds-first-crazy-glass-sky-pool-will-be-suspended-115-feet-in-the-airhttp://www.theverge.com/2015/8/20/9181333/sky-pool-london-embassy-gardens***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Man admits to smuggling cocaine via underwater tunnel across US-Mexico border
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA Honduran national admitted Wednesday in the federal court in San Diego that he tried to smuggle about 25 kilos cocaine across the Mexico-US border using an underwater tunnel, EFE reported.Border Patrol agents discovered a soaked Evelio Padilla-Zepeda, 28, in a wetsuit next to the All-American Canal, about 7 miles east of Calexico, California, on April 25.Near him, they found a breathing tank with a rebreather, to prevent surface bubbles, and 25 vacuum-sealed and giftwrapped packages, containing a total of 25 kilos of cocaine.That led Border Patrol agents to the discovery of a 45 meter-long underwater tunnel that began in Mexicali, Baja California, Mexico and ended under the water of the All-American Canal.The drugs were put on a trolley system on the dry Mexico side of the tunnel and were transported until the end of the tunnel. Smugglers would then use scuba diving suits and gear to retrieve the drug from under the water.Padilla-Zepeda, who had been living in Mexicali, says he was initially asked to help smuggle people across the border into the US, but was eventually forced to instead smuggle drugs.The smuggler pleaded guilty to charges of narcotics possession with the intention to distribute in San Diego’s federal court and could now face up to 20 years in prison.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. The smuggler found near Calexico on April 252. Police finding breathing tank with a rebreather and 25 kilos of cocaine 3. The underwater tunnel 4. Cocaine packages going into the tunnel through a trolley system 5. Cocaine packages being recollected by smugglers underwater 6. People smuggling across border replaced by drug smuggling VOICEOVER (in English): “Border Patrol agents discovered a soaked Evelio Padilla-Zepeda in a wetsuit next to the All-American Canal, about 7 miles east of Calexico, California, on April 25.”“Near him, they found a breathing tank with a rebreather to prevent surface bubbles, and 25 vacuum-sealed and giftwrapped packages, containing a total of 25 kilos of cocaine.”“That led Border Patrol agents to the discovery of a 45 meter-long underwater tunnel that began in Mexicali, Baja California, Mexico and ended under the water of the All-American Canal.”“The drugs were put on a trolley system on the dry Mexico side of the tunnel. Then smugglers would use scuba diving gear to retrieve the drugs.”“Padilla-Zepeda, who had been living in Mexicali, says he was initially asked to help smuggle people across the border into the US, but was eventually forced to instead smuggle drugs.”SOURCES: FOX NEWS, EFEhttp://www.foxnews.com/us/2015/08/20/arrest-man-in-scuba-gear-leads-to-us-mexico-border-tunnel-that-ends-underwater/http://www.wradio.com.co/noticias/internacional/hondureno-reconoce-que-trafico-droga-por-un-tunel-submarino-de-mexico-a-eeuu/20150819/nota/2900204.aspx***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Nazi gold train reportedly found in Poland
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twAfter 70 years of unsuccessful attempts by various treasure hunters, two men claim to have found a legendary Nazi gold train in Poland.BBC News reports that the two men, a Pole and a German, filed a “finder's claim” for an armored train carrying precious metals. Under Polish law, they are entitled to 10 percent of their find.According to Polish legend, the Germans packed an armored train with gold, jewels and guns and sent it southwest in 1945 as the Soviets were closing in, the Telegraph writes.The train is rumored to have disappeared near Ksiaz castle, in the mountainous Lower Silesia region. It is believed the train entered a tunnel, never to emerge.BBC News reports that the train was filled with 300 tons of gold. The duo claim to have found it near Walbrzych, only 3 km from Ksiaz Castle.The Nazis had an extensive history of looting. They are known for having stolen famous artwork and confiscated their prisoners’ money, jewelry and precious belongings.Some sceptics believe there is no evidence to support the existence of such a train, but some historians point out that the Nazis dug miles of tunnels in southwestern Poland.“Lawyers, the army, the police and the fire brigade were dealing with this,” Marika Tokarska, a Walbrzych district council official, told Reuters.Tokarska added that she did not know anything about either the location or the contents of the missing train.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Two men entitled to 10 percent of their find2. Nazi soldiers loading a train with gold, jewels and guns3. Train enters a tunnel, entrance is blocked4. Possible location of the missing train5. Nazi soldiers looting artwork and jewels6. Network of tunnels in southwestern PolandVOICEOVER (in English): “The two men, a Pole and a German, filed a ‘finder's claim’ for an armored train carrying precious metals. Under Polish law, they are entitled to 10 percent of their find.”“According to Polish legend, the Germans packed an armored train with gold, jewels and guns and sent it southwest in 1945 as the Soviets were closing in.”“The train is rumored to have disappeared near Ksiaz castle, in the mountainous Lower Silesia region. It is believed the train entered a tunnel, never to emerge.”“It is said the train was filled with 300 tons of gold. The duo claim to have found it near Walbrzych, only 3 km from Ksiaz Castle.”“The Nazis had an extensive history of looting. They are known for having stolen famous artwork and confiscated their prisoners’ money, jewelry and precious belongings.”“Some sceptics believe there is no evidence to support the existence of such a train, but historians point out that the Nazis dug miles of tunnels in southwestern Poland.”SOURCES: BBC, Daily Mail, Telegraph, Expresshttp://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-33994483http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3203511/Poland-looking-report-Nazi-treasure-train-found.htmlhttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/germany/11812174/Has-a-lost-Nazi-ghost-train-carrying-gold-finally-been-found-Two-treasure-hunters-think-so.htmlhttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/germany/9880969/Hunt-begins-for-legendary-1billion-in-Nazi-gold.htmlhttp://www.express.co.uk/news/world/599442/Nazi-gold-train-Walbrzych-Poland***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Japan sees more cases of flesh-eating bacteria in 2015
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA number of people have been infected with necrotizing fasciitis, more commonly known as flesh-eating disease, in Japan since the beginning of the year.There had been a total of 273 cases of flesh-eating bacteria in Japan as of December 2014. Following the appearance of several new cases this year, the total number of cases has risen to 279. After infection, people initially experience skin inflammation, fever and an increased heart rate. The disease often causes the infected area to appear swollen and those infected usually feel an intense pain. The most common symptom experienced among infected children is fever. The symptoms are usually more severe for adults, and the fatality rate is approximately 30 percent. The disease has mostly occurred in high-density areas. As of now, 44 people have died from the disease in Tokyo, 28 in Osaka and Kanagawa prefecture has experienced 20 deaths in total.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. The number of people infected has increased2. The disease occurs mostly in areas with population density3. Symptoms of the disease4. The disease is fatal in 30 percent of the cases5. Symptoms of the disease in children and adultsVOICEOVER (in English): As of December 2014, there had been a total of 273 cases of flesh-eating bacteria in Japan. A number that has since risen to 279. The disease mostly occurs in areas with high population density. Forty-four people have died of the disease in Tokyo, 28 in Osaka, and 20 in Kanagawa prefecture.The disease is caused by the bacteria Streptococcus pyogenes. It typically enters the body through the mouth or the nose, and normally only leads to a sore throat.However, if the bacteria enters the body via blood vessels, it can cause infections in the arms, legs and abdominal wall. The fatality rate in such infections is 30 percent. The most common symptom of the disease in children is fever. Symptoms, however, are usually more severe in adults.SOURCES: NHK, Huffington Post, Tokyo Shimbun, Asahi, FNNhttp://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20150818/k10010194241000.htmlhttp://www.huffingtonpost.jp/2015/08/18/streptococcus-pyogenes_n_8002614.html?utm_hp_ref=japanhttp://www.tokyo-np.co.jp/article/gunma/20150725/CK2015072502000166.htmlhttp://news.tv-asahi.co.jp/news_society/articles/000056976.htmlhttp://www.fnn-news.com/news/headlines/articles/CONN00300446.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Canadian company patents 20km-high, inflatable ‘space elevator’
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA new technology with the potential to change how spacecrafts enter orbit has recently been patented in both the UK and the US.To get shuttles into orbit, rockets traditionally use large amounts of fuel and energy during initial take off. Canadian firm Thoth Technology aims to change this, by essentially allowing astronauts to travel partway into space on an electrical elevator.The inflatable structure would stand at 20km high, over 20 times higher than the world’s tallest building, the Burj Khalifa. From the top, spacecrafts could launch into orbit in a single stage, eliminating the initial need for vertical launch rockets.Inventor Ben Quine told the CBC the tower could resist lightning, meteors and even category 5 hurricanes. The company’s CEO, Caroline Roberts, believes the invention, along with the development of self-landing rocket technologies could herald a new era in space transport.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Rocket launch2. Astronauts traveling in elevator3. Height of structure compared to Burj Khalifa4. Shuttles taking off and landing 5. What the tower is resistant toVOICEOVER (in English): To get shuttles into space, rockets currently use large amounts of fuel and usually also carry extra fuel.Canadian firm Thoth Technology aims to change that by essentially allowing astronauts to travel partway into space on an electrical elevator.The inflatable structure could, in theory, stand up to 20km high, over 20 times higher than the world’s tallest building, the Burj Khalifa. From the top, spacecrafts could launch into orbit in a single stage, eliminating the initial need for vertical launch rockets.Inventor Ben Quine told the CBC that the tower could resist lightning, meteors as well as category 5 hurricanes.SOURCES: Thoth Technology, CBC, The Guardianhttp://thothx.com/news-2/http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/space-elevator-with-inflatable-tower-patented-by-thoth-technology-1.3194738http://www.theguardian.com/science/2015/aug/17/space-elevator-thothx-tower***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: FDA approves Flibanserin, the ‘female viagra’
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe Food and Drug Administration has approved a libido-enhancing pill for premenopausal women whose lack of sexual desire causes distress, Reuters reported.Despite being dubbed the female viagra, unlike Viagra, which affects blood flow to the genitals, Flibanserin, works on the brain.According to Sprout Pharmaceuticals, the privately held startup that designed the drug, Flibanserin focuses on the brain's prefrontal cortex and enables sexual desire to manifest by rebalancing neurotransmitters that influence it.Specifically, flibanserin increases dopamine and norepinephrine, responsible for sexual excitement, and decreases serotonin, which is responsible for sexual satiety and inhibition. This is likely achieved by a reduction of glutamate transmission. Women who took the drug in a clinical study have shown an increase of about 1.0 more sexually satisfying events per month, Reuters reported. The pill needs to be taken every day and its most common side effects are dizziness, nausea and sleepiness.Advocates claim that the increase in sexually satisfying events is meaningful, while critics say the benefit is outweighed by the drug’s risks.Flibanserin will be sold under the brand name Addyi.As the drug could potentially cause dangerously low blood pressure and fainting when taken with alcohol it will be sold exclusively through certified health care professionals and pharmacies. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Flibasterin and viagra affecting areas on men and women2. Brain’s prefrontal cortex neurotransmitters3. Flibanserin increasing dopamine and norepinephrine and decreasing serotonin4. Increase of 1.0 more sexually satisfying events per month.5. Flibanserin side effectsVOICEOVER (in English): “Despite being dubbed the female viagra, unlike Viagra, which affects blood flow to the genitals, Flibanserin, works on the brain.” “Flibanserin focuses on the brain's prefrontal cortex and enables sexual desire to manifest by rebalancing neurotransmitters that influence it.”“Specifically, flibanserin increases dopamine and norepinephrine, responsible for sexual excitement, and decreases serotonin, responsible for sexual satiety and inhibition.” “Women who took the drug in a clinical study have shown an increase of about 1.0 more sexually satisfying events per month.”“The pill needs to be taken every day and its most common side effects are dizziness, nausea and sleepiness.”SOURCES: REUTERS, BBChttp://news.yahoo.com/fda-approves-womens-libido-drug-strong-warning-232453345--finance.htmlhttp://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-33979526http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/sprout-pharmaceuticals-resubmits-flibanserin-new-drug-application-for-the-treatment-of-hypoactive-sexual-desire-disorder-in-premenopausal-women-300036681.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Scientists predict this year’s El Nino will be strongest on record
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twScientists at NOAA’s Climate Prediction Center released a forecast on Thursday predicting that this year’s El Nino event could be one of the strongest ever.Conditions are ripe for the most powerful El Nino ever recorded as sea surface temperatures in the Pacific Ocean are as much as 3.5 degrees fahrenheit above average. NOAA’s noted much of the ocean conditions they are seeing now are comparable to the ones they saw before the disastrous El Nino winters of 1982 -83 and 1997-98. During these periods, El Nino wreaked havoc across the western United States and in parts of South Asia, South America and East Africa. Weakened winds that usually blow warm waters in the eastern Pacific to Indonesia and Australia, as well as the unusually warm atmosphere that characterizes El Nino will shift a subtropical jet stream that usually travels through Latin America toward California and the southern states, causing the area to experience extreme rainfall. After the 1997 El Nino event, southern California got double its annual amount of rainfall while Los Angeles received a year’s worth of rainfall in one month alone.CNN reports that warmer waters will drive away coldwater fish in the eastern Pacific, a key component of many economies along the American coast.While increased rainfall in California may help counter the area’s four-year drought, scientists caution against thinking that the El Nino event will solve the state’s water issues. California needs 2.5 times its average rainfall to patch its current water deficit. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Warming waters in the eastern Pacific Ocean2. Atmospheric heating3. Jet stream sending warmer airs and storms to California coast4. Warmer surface waters drive coldwater fish away5. Increased rainfall from El Nino won’t cure California’s droughtVOICEOVER (in English): “Scientists at NOAA’s Climate Prediction Center released a forecast on Thursday predicting that this year’s El Nino could be one of the strongest ever.”“Conditions are ripe for the most powerful El Nino ever recorded as sea surface temperatures in the Pacific Ocean are as much as 3.5 degrees fahrenheit above average.”“Weakened winds that usually blow warm waters in the eastern Pacific to Indonesia and Australia, as well as the unusually warm atmosphere that characterizes El Nino...”“...will shift a subtropical jet stream toward California and the southern states, causing the area to experience extreme rainfall.”“CNN reports that warmer waters will drive away coldwater fish in the eastern Pacific, a key component of many economies along the American coast.”“While increased rainfall in California may help counter the area’s four-year drought, the state needs 2.5 times its average rainfall to patch its water deficit.”SOURCES: USA Today, Time, San Francisco Chronicle, CNN, Los Angeles Timeshttp://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2015/08/13/godzilla-el-nino/31647757/http://time.com/3996227/el-nino-forecast/http://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/article/El-Ni-o-getting-bigger-and-bigger-6442359.phphttp://edition.cnn.com/2015/08/13/weather/el-nino-2015/http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-el-nino-20150813-htmlstory.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Philae lander’s touchdown error gives ESA unexpected data on Comet 67
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe European Space Agency’s Philae lander’s botched comet touchdown has produced a silver lining, as it has allowed the lander to take important measurements in two separate spots instead of one, the Los Angeles Times reported. The Philae lander attempted to land on comet P67/Churyumov-Gerasimenko on November 12, in an area later named Agilkia, but its anchoring harpoons and retro-rockets failed, resulting in the lander bouncing off the comet and landing on another spot later named Abydos. Thanks to the bouncing trajectory data, researchers were able to analyze not one but two sites, and found that Agilkia is made of a softer surface layer of dust and ice, while the crust at Abydos is much harder.If Philae had landed in its intended spot at Agilkia, it would have been fried by the sun many months ago. In its current location however, it was able to restart and discover that the comet has daily temperature swings, from about minus 296 degrees to minus 226 degrees Fahrenheit, and that it is made up of 16 organic molecular species, four of which had never being found on comets. It also discovered that the comet’s surface contains radiation-caused formaldehyde polymer, which is considered an important discovery as many scientists believe that the chemical building blocks for life on Earth might have been delivered by a comet. The Rosetta mission team hasn’t heard from Philae for weeks since it sent messages upon waking up from hibernation. The team hopes more data will eventually be sent, but if not, they are content with the amount of information that was received so far.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Philae lander landing on Agilkia 2. Philae lander bouncing back 3. Philae landing at Abydos4. The differences between the intended destination and the new location5. Philae stopped working at intended destination 6. Philae’s experiments in its current locationVOICEOVER (in English): “The Philae lander tried to land on comet P67 on November 12, in an area later named Agilkia.” “But its anchoring harpoons and retro-rockets failed, resulting in the lander bouncing off the comet.”“After hitting a crater rim and bouncing again, Philae eventually landed in a spot later called Abydos.”“Thanks to the bouncing trajectory data, researchers could then analyze not one but two sites, and found that Agilkia is made of a softer surface layer of dust and ice, while the crust at Abydos is much harder.” “If Philae had landed in its intended spot at Agilkia, it would have been fried by the sun many months ago.”“In its current location however, it was able to restart and discover that the comet has daily temperature swings, and that it is made up of 16 organic molecular species and its surface contains radiation-caused formaldehyde polymer.” SOURCES: LOS ANGELES TIMEShttp://www.latimes.com/science/sciencenow/la-sci-sn-rosetta-philae-comet-67p-churyumov-gerasimenko-organic-bounce-20150730-story.html#page=1***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: The tomb of Egyptian Queen Nefertiti may have been found
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA British archaeologist who says he may have found the tomb of ancient Egyptian Queen Nefertiti, might have made one of the biggest discoveries in the field’s history.Nicholas Reeves at the University of Arizona has published a paper describing analysis of detailed scans of the tomb, which revealed two previously concealed doors in the tomb of King Tutankhamun. He believes that one of the doors would likely lead to a storeroom. The other door could lead to a room holding the remains of Queen Nefertiti, believed by some to be Tutankhamun’s mother.“I have been testing the evidence ever since, looking for indications that what I thought I was seeing was, in fact, not there ... but the more I looked, the more information I found that I seemed to be looking at something pretty real”, Reeves told the BBC.Finding the tomb of Queen Nefertiti would be a huge breakthrough for archaeologists. However, many insist that more tests are needed to strengthen Reeves’s theory.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Location of the tomb of King Tutankhamun2. Floor plan of the tomb3. Depiction of a hidden storeroom4. Depiction of the hidden tomb of Queen NefertitiVOICEOVER (in English): “University of Arizona archaeologist Nicholas Reeves believes new evidence may have located the remains of Egyptian Queen Nefertiti in a chamber in the tomb of King Tutankhamun.”“Reeves’s theory is based on an analysis of detailed scans of the tomb, that reveal two previously concealed doors.”“Reeves believes that one of the doors likely leads to a storeroom. The other door could lead to a room containing the remains of Queen Nefertiti.”SOURCES: The Washington Post, BBChttp://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2015/08/12/archaeologist-believes-he-may-have-found-remains-of-ancient-egyptian-queen-nefertiti-hidden-in-king-tuts-tomb/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-33868103***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Japan reopens first nuclear reactor since Fukushima
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twJapan’s Kyushu Electric Power restarted one of the two reactors at its Sendai nuclear power plant in Kagoshima on Tuesday. The reopening of the Sendai reactor will mark the first time Japan has generated nuclear power after the start of its post-Fukushima ‘zero nuclear’ period.During the nuclear plant’s hiatus, Japan desperately relied on thermal energy, however, the country has struggled with meeting the soaring costs of purchasing oil, gas and other fuels. Kyushu Electric Power announced that the reason they are reopening the reactor is the country’s lack of electricity. On August 11, the reactor successfully sustained a nuclear chain reaction and will soon begin to generate electricity.In hopes of strengthening the nuclear plant’s safety measures, 11 electric companies will invest 3 trillion JPY towards the facility’s safety systems. Residents living near nuclear power plants are still anxious about their safety though, and the possibility of insufficient emergency measures in the event of a nuclear accident.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Kyushu Electric Power restarts the Sendai reactor2. Nuclear power is necessary for lowering electricity prices3. Lack of electricity supply is the reason for restarting the reactor4. The reactor achieves a sustained nuclear chain reaction5. Eleven electric companies invest to strengthen the facility’s safety measuresVOICEOVER (in English): In September 2013, Kansai Electric Power's Oi plant in Fukui Prefecture went offline for a routine safety check. The reopening of the Sendai reactor will mark the first time Japan has generated nuclear power after the start of its post-Fukushima ‘zero nuclear’ period.During Japan’s nuclear power hiatus, Japan has relied on thermal energy. However, the country now struggles with meeting the soaring costs of purchasing oil, gas and other fuels.Kyushu Electric Power announced that the reason they are reopening the reactor is the country’s lack of electricity. On August 11, the reactor successfully sustained a nuclear chain reaction and will soon begin to generate electricity.In hopes of strengthening the nuclear plant’s safety measures, 11 electric companies will invest 3 trillion yen towards the facility’s safety systems.SOURCES: Kyodo News, The Japan Times, The Asahi Shimbun, The Mainichi, Jiji Press, NHK Worldhttp://english.kyodonews.jp/news/2015/08/368599.htmlhttp://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2015/08/11/national/nuclear-restart-highlights-government-dilemma-lack-waste-disposal-sites/#.VcqOivntlBchttp://ajw.asahi.com/article/behind_news/social_affairs/AJ201508110066http://mainichi.jp/english/english/newsselect/news/20150811p2a00m0na017000c.htmlhttp://jen.jiji.com/jc/eng?g=eco&k=2015081200003http://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/english/news/20150812_03.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: US efforts to cut ozone levels hindered by Chinese pollution
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA study published in Nature Geoscience claims the U.S.’ effort to cut ozone levels have gone to waste due to pollution arriving on the west coast from China. Observations of the phenomena were made using satellites coupled with computer models of how air-borne molecules travel in the lower atmosphere. According to the study, from 2005 to 2010, the US managed to cut ozone-producing nitrous oxide emissions by 20 percent by imposing strict standards for motor vehicles and industry. During the same period of time, however, China's growth pushed its own ozone levels up by about 7 percent.Half of the increase in China came from the ground up, while the other half descended from the stratosphere. Although the study says that some of that pollution may have been blown to China from India and other parts of Asia.In the same way that the dominant westerly winds blow China’s air pollution into the troposphere, straight across the Pacific Ocean, and into the United States, causing ozone levels to rise again. According to the study lead researcher Willem Verstraeten, of the Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute, local and national efforts to fight pollution could have a limited impact if the problem is not also dealt at an international level. “Our atmosphere is global rather than local,” he was quoted by the Japan Times as saying.High levels of pollution can cause respiratory problems, damage to crops and climate change.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Ozone levels decreasing in the US from 2005 to 2010 by 20 percent2. Ozone levels rising in China from the 2005 to 2010 by seven percent3. Half ozone levels increase in China coming from the ground up, the other half descending from the stratosphere. 4. Pollution going into China from other parts of Asia5. Pollution particles going from China to the US west coast 6. Effects of pollutionVOICEOVER (in English): "From 2005 to 2010, the US managed to cut ozone-producing nitrous oxide emissions by 20 percent by imposing strict standards for motor vehicles and industry.”"During the same period of time, however, China's growth pushed its own ozone levels up by about 7 percent."“Half of the increase in China came from the ground up, while the other half descended from the stratosphere.” “Although some of that pollution may have been blown to China from India and other parts of Asia.”“In the same way that the dominant westerly winds blow China’s air pollution into the troposphere, straight across the Pacific Ocean, and into the United States, causing ozone levels to rise again.”“High levels of pollution can cause respiratory problems, damage to crops and of course global warming.” SOURCES: JAPAN TIMES, http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2015/08/12/world/science-health-world/china-exporting-ozone-pollution-to-us-study/#.VcsLUJ2qqkq***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Millions of plastic shade balls will protect the water in LA’s reservoirs
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twMillions of plastic shade balls were poured into the Los Angeles Reservoir on Monday to help protect water quality and prevent evaporation.Hollow and weighted down with water, the balls will remain on the water’s surface and protect the water from dust, rain, birds and reduce algae growth. The balls will also block the water surface from the sun, preventing bromide and chlorine in the water from reacting and forming bromate, a known carcinogen. Less than $35 million was used to produce the shade balls, an amount much smaller than the estimated $300 million cost of covering the 175-acre facility."This is a blend of how engineering really meets common sense. We saved a lot of money, we did all the right things," said Los Angeles Department of Water and Power General Manager Marcie Edwards at a press conference.Los Angeles is the first city in the United States to use shade balls. Ninety-six million shade balls have been poured into several reservoirs in LA. According to ABC 7 News, the balls will prevent an estimated 300 million gallons of water from evaporating into the air each year.The balls can last 10 years inside the reservoirs before they are recycled and replaced. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Showcasing the shade balls2. Balls will protect water against dust, rain, birds and algae growth3. Balls will prevent bromate formation4. Other locations that use shade balls5. How much water will be conservedVOICEOVER (in English): “The shade balls have a four-inch-long diameter and are hollow, made from plastic, and are coated in a chemical that blocks out ultraviolet light.”“The balls, which are weighted with water, protect the reservoir against dust, rain, birds and reduce algae growth.”“The balls will also block the water surface from sunlight, thereby preventing bromide and chlorine in the water from reacting to form bromate, a carcinogen.”“Ninety-six million shade balls have been poured into several reservoirs in LA and will prevent an estimated 300 million gallons of water from evaporating into the air each year.”SOURCES: http://abc7.com/news/millions-of-shade-balls-protecting-los-angeles-reservoir/920083/http://www.vox.com/2015/8/11/9130563/shade-balls-are-californias-most-mesmerizing-water-saving-trick***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Japan develops world’s first portable electric vehicle
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twTOKYO, JAPAN- Japanese start-up Cocoa Motors plans to release the world’s first portable electric vehicle, the ‘Walkcar’. The walkcar weighs between 2 to 3kg (4.4 lb to 6.6lb). Despite it’s lightweight design, the portable electric vehicle can carry loads of up to 120kg(265lb). It can travel at 10kph (6.2 mph) at top speed, for up to 12 km (7.41 miles) on a single three-hour charge. Walkcar does not require a parking space as it can be carried in a bag or by hand. It is intended for use in public places such as airports and amusement parks.Customers will be able to begin reserving their device starting in October 2015, with each one costing around $800.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. 新しく発売予定の電気自動車は持ち運びが可能。かばんに入れることができる。2. 薄くて軽いが、重さは120キロ（265ポンド）まで耐えられる、3時間充電すれば、12キロメートル（7.4マイル）まで移動が可能。最高速度は時速10キロ3. 駐車場が必要ない4. 空港などでの使用を想定RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. World’s smallest electric vehicle “Walkcar”, can be carried in a bag or by hand.2. The Walkcar can carry loads up to 120kg. It can reach 10kph (6.2 mph) at top speed and travel up to 12 km (7.4 mi) on a single charge3. Parking space is not needed.4. Can be used in various public places such as airports. VOICEOVER (in English): A miniature portable electric vehicle called the “Walkcar” will go on sale in Japan this autumn.Japanese start-up Cocoa Motors recently launched a crowdfunding campaign in an attempt to begin manufacturing the “Walkcar”, a portable electric vehicle.The walkcar weighs between 2 to 3kg (4.4 lb to 6.6lb). Despite it’s lightweight design, the portable electric vehicle can carry loads of up to 120kg(265lb). It can travel at 10kph (6.2 mph) at top speed, for up to 12 km (7.41 miles) on a single three-hour charge. The “Walkcar” can be carried by hand and therefore does not require a parking space.The designer says the “Walkcar” can be used in public places such as theme parks and airports.SOURCES: http://www.reuters.com/article/2015/08/10/us-japan-walkcar-idUSKCN0QF1BC20150810http://www.reuters.com/article/2015/08/07/us-japan-walkcar-idUSKCN0QC1MS20150807http://www.bbc.com/news/technology-33849622http://gizmodo.com/a-tiny-personal-transporter-that-looks-like-a-macbook-y-1722720141***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Dutch university aims to use solar panels as highway noise barriers
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe Netherland’s Eindhoven University of Technology is developing solar panels that could be used to accomplish goals beyond simply electricity generation, such as acting as noise barriers along highways, Popular Mechanics reports.A practical test using the new technology is being run along the Netherland’s A2 highway, one of the nation’s busiest, near the city of Den Bosch.Two sets of sound barriers with incorporated LSCs, or “luminescent solar concentrators”, will be placed alongside the highway until early summer of 2016, as a full year of testing is crucial in order to verify the durability and performance of the panels under all weather conditions.The LSCs can absorb sunlight by using transparent dyed plastic sheets, which then emit and direct concentrated radiation onto solar cells hidden inside the panels’ frames.The LSCs come in a variety of colors, making highways more visually appealing.The two noise barriers currently in use measure 4.5 meters high by 5 meters wide.If the panels manage to pass the testing process, a single kilometer of barriers is expected to be able to generate enough energy to power 50 households. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. The luminescent solar concentrators, LSCs, near the city of Den Bosch2. The LSCs absorbing sunlight; sunlight going into solar cells inside the panels frames3. The variety of colors the LSCs come in4. The LSC barrier dimensions5. Electricity produced by a kilometer of LSC barriers VOICEOVER (in English): “A practical test is being run along the Netherland’s A2 highway, one of the nation’s busiest, near the city of Den Bosch.”“Sound barriers with incorporated LSCs or “luminescent solar concentrators” can absorb sunlight by using transparent dyed plastic sheets which then emit and direct concentrated radiation onto solar cells hidden inside the frames.”“The LSCs can come in a variety of colors, making highways more visually appealing.” “The current test features only two noise barriers, which measure 4.5 meters high by 5 meters wide.”“A single kilometer of the barriers could generate enough energy to power 50 households.” SOURCES: POPULAR MECHANICS, SEAChttp://www.popularmechanics.com/science/green-tech/a16740/solar-panel-sound-barriers/http://www.seac.cc/projects/solar-noise-barriers-sonob/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Lexus showed its hoverboard in action in Barcelona, Spain
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twLexus has created a working hoverboard that uses liquid nitrogen and magnets to glide above a magnetic track. The hoverboard was formally unveiled on Tuesday in a 2-minute video posted on YouTube.Lexus engineers used a copper oxide superconductor as the main “engine” of the hoverboard. Liquid nitrogen is poured onto the copper oxide to make it superconductive. When the chilled superconductor is placed above the magnetic track, a phenomena called “flux pinning” traps the superconductor in space above the magnet, maintaining the hover height of the board.Lexus and its German engineering partner Evico installed hundreds of magnets at a skate park in Barcelona to convert it into a hoverboard track where Lexus debuted the hoverboard.The hoverboard was developed by engineers at Lexus’ Tokyo division and is the fourth project in the company’s “Amazing Motion” publicity campaign.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. The idea of hoverboard’s mechanics is shown.2. Liquid nitrogen is poured in and the superconductor cools down.3. The board is made of bamboo and it can carry 200 kg.4. Cryostats keep the superconductor cool until it needs nitrogen again.5. A man skates using the hoverboard on a narrow magnetic pathway.6. The hoverpark has magnetic pathways built below it.VOICEOVER (in English): [TITLE CUT]LEXUS SHOWS OFF MAGICFUNCTIONING HOVERBOARD “Lexus formally unveiled a functioning hoverboard on Tuesday in a 2-minute video posted on YouTube.”“The hoverboard uses electromagnets to lift it off a surface, allowing for near frictionless movement.”“Inside the hoverboard is a copper oxide superconductor, which is cooled to below 200 degrees Celsius using liquid nitrogen to make it superconductive.”“The board itself is made of bamboo and can carry weights of up to 200 kg.”“Cryostats on both ends of the board allow for constant cooling of the superconductor. The board can be refilled with liquid nitrogen if needed.”“The board achieves levitation on pathways lined with hundreds of magnets. The board and the pathway interact to create ‘flux pinning,’ a trapped magnetic field.”“The hoverboard can only glide on these magnetic pathways and not on ordinary surfaces.”“The hoverboard was developed by engineers at Lexus’ Tokyo division and is the fourth project in the company’s ‘Amazing Motion’ publicity campaign.”SOURCES: Lexus, Inside Sciencehttp://www.lexus-int.com/amazinginmotion/slide/http://www.insidescience.org/blog/2015/06/26/how-lexus-hoverboard-gets-ground***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: New Japan technology helps determine what missing fugitives from long ago look like today
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe National Research Institute of Police Science in Japan has developed a new program that uses anatomical data to simulate what a person would look like after aging in order to determine what fugitive suspects who went missing years ago might look like today.The National Police Agency believes the technology will help them track down fugitives who went missing long ago more efficiently, as previous methods do not render images that look like what the suspects currently look like.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. People looking at a wanted poster, but it does not look like what the suspect currently looks like2. Previous methods only added wrinkles or other imperfections to images3. New technology helps police determine what 876 missing people from 10 years ago might look like today4. The suspect responsible for a sarin gas attack in 1995 looked nothing like his poster when he was arrested in 2012VOICEOVER (in English): “The National Research Institute of Police Science in Japan has developed a program to more accurately simulate what a person would look like after aging. This will help police more efficiently pursue fugitive suspects or find long-lost missing persons.”“Japanese police renderings of long-lost fugitives or missing person’s faces previously only added wrinkles, but these images did not accurately depict what a person looks like after aging.”“New technology has enabled police to render the faces of 876 missing people with added anatomical data to more accurately depict what they look like 10 years later.”“The new technology comes after the 2012 arrest of the suspect charged with a sarin gas attack in Japan’s subway system in 1995. At the time of his arrest, the suspect looked nothing like the image of his face police had distributed.”SOURCES: Nikkeihttp://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXLASDG02H4R_S5A800C1000000/Sankeihttp://www.sanspo.com/geino/news/20150803/sot15080305010004-n1.htmlReutershttp://jp.reuters.com/article/2015/08/02/idJP2015080201001236Kyodohttp://www.47news.jp/CN/201508/CN2015080201001208.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Facebook to test drone designed to distribute Internet to the masses
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFacebook has announced that it is planning to test fly its own drone that is designed to bring Internet connectivity to remote parts of the world.The drone, named Aquila, has a 140-foot wingspan, the same as a Boeing 737, but only weighs 880 pounds, about a third of the weight of a Prius, according to Tech Crunch. The unmanned aircraft is able to fly between 60,000 and 90,000 feet in the air, and can stay airborne for 90 days at a time.According to Facebook, the drones can offer Internet speeds of 10 gigabits a second to an area 50 miles across, and hit a target as small as a dime from 10 miles away. Tech Crunch reports that the data speed is 10 times faster than what was previously possible.According to the BBC, Jay Parikh, Facebook's vice president of global engineering and infrastructure said, "When finished, our laser communications system can be used to connect our aircraft with each other and with the ground, making it possible to create a stratospheric network that can extend to even the remotest regions of the world."RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Aquila wingspan and weight2. How high the Aquila can fly3. How long the Aquila can remain in flight4. Range of Internet distribution5. Speed and accuracy of laser6. Aquila able to create stratospheric networkVOICEOVER (in English): “Facebook’s Aquila drone has a 140-foot wingspan, the same length as a Boeing 737, but only weighs 880 pounds, about one-third as much as a Prius.”“The solar-powered drone can remain in the air for 90 days, and flies between 60,000 and 90,000 feet above weather and commercial airspace.”“It is able to distribute Internet to an area around 50 miles across below.”“The drones are also able to offer Internet speeds of 10 gigabits a second, which is roughly 10 times faster than previously possible. It is also able to hit targets the size of a dime from more than 10 miles away.”“Facebook says the drones’ laser communications systems can connect to each other and with the ground, making it possible to create a stratospheric network.”SOURCES: BBC, Tech Crunch, Wiredhttp://www.bbc.com/news/technology-33728704http://techcrunch.com/2015/07/30/facebook-wont-be-an-isp-but-is-building-internet-shooting-drones-for-carriers/#.bpzvwi:0Gighttp://www.wired.com/2015/07/facebook-poses-test-737-sized-solar-powered-drone/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Amazon proposes delivery drone traffic control at NASA conference
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twU.S. online retailer Amazon on Tuesday called for new air traffic rules for commercial drone flights. The proposal was unveiled by Gur Kimchi, Amazon’s vice president in charge of the company’s fledgling drone delivery program, at a NASA-sponsored conference at the agency’s Ames Research Center in Mountain View, California. The Ames Research Center is home to a NASA team charged with the development of an air-traffic system called Unmanned Aerial System Traffic Management. Amazon proposed that airspace be segregated between unmanned and manned aircraft. Unmanned aircraft, or drones, making local deliveries and moving slowly would be restricted to airspace under 200 feet. Airspace between 200 and 400 feet would be reserved for high-speed drones traveling long distances. No aircraft would be able to fly between 400 and 500 feet, and only manned aircraft could fly above 500 feet. High-speed delivery drones would file a flight plan with a central computer and be required to maintain internet connectivity while in flight. High-speed delivery drones would also download a list of obstacles and airspace to avoid from the central computer. All high-speed delivery drones would have sensors to detect manned aircraft, birds and other unexpected obstacles that might enter the drone’s path of travel. The drone would give way to manned aircraft and automatically avoid other threats.Amazon’s proposal envisions a future with thousands of drones sharing the sky in a manner similar to automobile traffic on a highway. Amazon hopes its proposal will speed the FAA’s acceptance of the company's drone delivery model. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Cross section of airspace reserved for slow drones, fast drones and manned aircraft2. Drones have flight plan to avoid obstacles3. Drones can detect and avoid aircraft4. Drones can detect and avoid birds5. Drones traveling along “highways” in the air6. Drone delivers package to private residenceVOICEOVER (in English): [TITLE CUT]AMAZON PROPOSES NEW AIR RULESFOR HIGH-SPEED DRONE DELIVERIES read this VO for title cut:[PHOTO] AMAZON.COM 1,2,3On Tuesday, Amazon proposed new air traffic rules for controlling delivery drones at a NASA sponsored conference in Mountain View, California. [CUT 1]10sec - altitude levelsVO: Amazon proposed that airspace under 200 feet be reserved for slow-moving drones, and airspace between 200 and 400 feet for high-speed drones. No aircraft would be able to fly between 400 and 500 feet, and only manned aircraft could fly above 500 feet. [CUT 2]7sec - avoiding obstaclesVO: High-speed delivery drones will file a flight plan with a central computer and download a list of obstacles and airspace to avoid. [CUT 3]4sec - avoiding helicopter-VO: High-speed drones can detect aircraft in their path and will always give way. [CUT 4]4sec - avoiding birds-VO: They can also detect smaller, unexpected obstacles, like birds. [CUT 5]4sec - descending from traffic laneVO: The proposed regulations envision a future with thousands of drones sharing the sky,[CUT 6]5sec - receiving packageVO: and Amazon hopes its proposal will speed the FAA’s acceptance of its drone delivery model. [PHOTO]SOURCES: Bloomberg, Amazon Prime Air, IEEE Spectrum, http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-07-28/amazon-envisions-distinct-drone-zones-for-future-delivery-fleethttp://www.amazon.com/b?node=8037720011http://spectrum.ieee.org/view-from-the-valley/robotics/aerial-robots/drone-control-heres-how-amazon-thinks-drones-should-fit-into-us-airspacehttp://spectrum.ieee.org/view-from-the-valley/robotics/aerial-robots/package-delivery-by-drone***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Flaw in Android software may allow hackers access to phones with just a single text
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twSecurity firm Zimperium told NPR that a weakness in an Android-based software may allow hackers to affect 95 percent of Android phones with just a single text. According to Zimperium, hackers can take advantage of flaws in Android software Stagefright, a multimedia processing tool in Android devices. However, the firm discovered the bug in their lab and don’t believe hackers are using it just yet.Malware can be incorporated into a video file and sent to an individual’s Android phone. If the message is received via Google Hangouts, Stagefright will immediately process the video and release the malware whether the file was actually opened or not. Though, if an individual is using the standard messaging software they would need to open the text before the video is processed. The malware can take complete control over the phone and allow hackers to gain access to all of the information stored inside, including taking over the phone’s camera and microphone.Google has developed patches that can protect Android users and has reportedly sent them out, but it’s ultimately up to phone carriers and phone makers to push the updates through to individual phones. Old devices often stop receiving updates altogether and are therefore left vulnerable to hacks and new issues that crop up.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Percentage of Androids that may be affected2. Malware takes advantage of Android software Stagefright3. How the malware may be released on the phones4. Malware will take complete control over the phone5. Challenges Google faces in responding to the threatVOICEOVER: “Security firm Zimperium told NPR that a weakness in an Android-based software may allow a malware to affect 95 percent of Android phones.”“According to Zimperium, hackers can take advantage of flaws in Android software Stagefright, a multimedia processing tool.”“Malware can be incorporated into a video file and sent to an individual’s Android phone. If the message is received via Google Hangouts, Stagefright will immediately process the video and release the malware whether the file was actually opened or not.”“The malware can take complete control over the phone and allow hackers to gain access to all of the information stored inside.”“Google has developed patches that can protect Android users and has reportedly sent them out, but it’s ultimately up to phone carriers and phone makers to push the updates through to individual phones.”SOURCES: CNET, NPR, PCWorldhttp://www.cnet.com/news/researcher-finds-mother-of-all-android-vulnerabilities/http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2015/07/27/426613020/major-flaw-in-android-phones-would-let-hackers-in-with-just-a-texthttp://www.pcworld.com/article/2953052/security/most-android-phones-can-be-hacked-with-a-simple-mms-message-or-multimedia-file.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Japan’s experimental plane creates quieter sonic boom
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) has successfully tested an experimental supersonic aircraft that emits a quieter sonic boom.The plane’s design reduces shockwaves typically created during supersonic flight, resulting in a quieter sonic boom, according to Popular Mechanics.In an experiment, the plane was dropped from a balloon at an altitude of 30 kilometers and reached supersonic speeds during free fall. The sonic boom data was collected via several aerial microphones attached to a blimp.However, according to Popular Mechanics, it is unclear how the Japanese plane accomplishes this.Sonic booms are created when shockwaves produced by an aircraft that has reached supersonic flight merge into a single sound.The plane, flight tested by Japanese space agency JAXA, and reportedly built to specifications conceived by Sweden’s Esrange Space Center, represents an attempt to rectify some of the issues faced by the world’s first supersonic commercial jet, the Concorde, which had its European routes cancelled due to noise levels.JAXA expects to release detailed data from the experiment in the near future. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Previous supersonic plane causing a lot of noise2. Concorde aircrafts no longer used starting in 20033. JAXA pairs up with Swedish company for experimental plane4. Depiction of experimentVOICEOVER (in English): “The plane’s design reduces shockwaves typically created during supersonic flight, resulting in a quieter sonic boom, according to Popular Mechanics.”“The aircraft represents an attempt to rectify some of the issues faced by the world’s first supersonic commercial jet, the Concorde, which had its European routes cancelled due to noise levels.”“The plane, flight tested by Japanese space agency JAXA, was reportedly built to specifications conceived by Sweden’s Esrange Space Center.”“In an experiment, the plane was dropped from a balloon at an altitude of 30 kilometers and reached supersonic speeds during free fall. The sonic boom data was collected via several aerial microphones attached to a blimp.”SOURCES: Japan Aerospace Exploration Agencyhttp://www.jaxa.jp/press/2015/07/20150727_dsend2_j.htmlhttp://www.jaxa.jp/article/special/aviation/oonuki01_j.htmlhttp://global.jaxa.jp/press/2015/07/20150727_dsend2.htmlKyodohttp://www.47news.jp/CN/201507/CN2015072701001846.htmlYomiurihttp://www.yomiuri.co.jp/science/20150727-OYT1T50094.htmlSankeihttp://www.sankei.com/life/news/150727/lif1507270038-n1.htmlNikkeihttp://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXLASDG27HBR_X20C15A7CR8000/Mynavihttp://news.mynavi.jp/news/2015/07/27/371/Popular Mechanicshttp://www.popularmechanics.com/flight/news/a16619/jaxa-experiemental-plane-has-quieter-sonic-booms/Military Technologieshttp://www.military-technologies.net/2015/07/27/release-results-for-the-second-phase-of-the-drop-test-for-the-simplified-evaluation-of-non-symmetrically-distributed-sonic-boom-project-d-send2/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: NASA discovers Earth-like planet
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twKepler-452b, a planet located 1,400 light-years away from Earth, was announced on Thursday as the most Earth-like planet ever found by NASA, which is naming it ‘Earth 2.0’.The exoplanet Kepler-452b orbits around a G-star similar to our sun every 385-days in the constellation Cygnus. It is five percent farther away from its sun than Earth is to our sun, but receives the same amount of sunshine, as its sun is 10 percent larger, NASA said in the press conference.NASA believes the exoplanet is five times more massive than Earth, with a rocky surface and a thicker atmosphere, while gravity would be about twice as strong on Kepler-452b than it is on Earth.This is the 1,030th planet confirmed by the Kepler Space Telescope, according to NASA. The telescope will continue its mission of finding ‘Goldilocks planets’ planets that are not too cold nor too hot for liquid water to form.NASA plans to carry out a spectroscopic analysis of Kepler-452b to gain a better understanding of its atmosphere.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Distance between Kepler-452b and Earth2. Kepler-452b rotates around its sun every 385 days3. Distance between Kepler-452b and its sun4. Gravity on Kepler-452bVOICEOVER (in English): “Kepler-452b, a planet located 1,400 light-years away from Earth, has been announced as the most Earth-like planet ever found by NASA.”“The exoplanet orbits around a G-star similar to our sun in a 385-day year in the constellation Cygnus.”“Kepler-452b is five percent farther away from its sun than Earth is to our sun, but receives the same amount of sunshine, as its sun is 10 percent larger than ours.”“Gravity would be about twice as strong on Kepler-452b as it is on Earth.”SOURCES: NBC News, Reutershttp://www.nbcnews.com/science/space/nasas-kepler-space-telescope-discovers-new-planet-n397141?cid=sm_tw&hootPostID=de6b314fefab8b208644f41140b14b86http://www.reuters.com/article/2015/07/23/us-space-usa-nasa-planet-idUSKCN0PX24520150723***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Japan calls on China to halt exploration work in East China Sea
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twJapan on Tuesday called on China to halt the construction of oil and gas exploration platforms in a disputed area of the East China Sea.The claims were made in as part of a Defence White Paper approved by the Japanese Cabinet on Tuesday.The disputed areas lies southeast of Shanghai and Japanese officials said that there are 16 Chinese platforms close to Japan’s side of the sea, with 12 of those platforms being built since June 2013.Japan has long expressed concern that platforms close to the maritime border could be used to extract resources from the Japanese side of the line.Tokyo is also worried that the platforms could be used as radar stations to monitor air and sea activity in the region, which is close to the disputed Senkaku, or Diaoyu Islands claimed by both countries.China immediately hit back, saying that it would make a “necessary reaction” after Beijing had reviewed the full text of the White Paper.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. A map of the disputed region 2. A close up of the position of the 16 platforms3. Depiction of a Chinese rig tapping reservoirs under Japan’s territory4. Depiction of a rig being used for tracking purposesVOICEOVER: The disputed areas lies southeast of Shanghai and Japanese officials said that there are 16 Chinese platforms close to Japan’s side of the sea, with 12 of those platforms being built since June 2013.Japan has long expressed concern that platforms close to the maritime border could be used to extract resources from the Japanese side of the line.Tokyo is also worried that the platforms could be used as radar stations to monitor air and sea activity in the region, which is close to the disputed Senkaku, or Diaoyu Islands claimed by both countries.SOURCES: REUTERS, BLOOMBERG, JAPAN MOFA http://www.reuters.com/article/2015/07/21/us-japan-defence-idUSKCN0PV04420150721http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-07-22/japan-releases-photos-of-chinese-rigs-in-disputed-east-china-seahttp://www.mofa.go.jp/mofaj/area/china/higashi_shina/tachiba.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Honda’s robotic walking assistant aids people learning to walk again
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twHonda has announced that in November it will begin to lease a robotic device designed to help people learning to walk again after sustaining an injury.According to the company, the Honda Walking Assist Device has been undergoing development since 1999 and has already been trialled at roughly 50 hospitals and other facilities in Japan since 2013.The technology was carried out as part of the research and development of ASIMO, Honda’s advanced humanoid robot. It is based on the inverted pendulum model, which is a theory of bipedal walking. Two motors on the device helps people lift their legs at the thigh as the leg it moves forward and backward. This lengthens the user’s stride, allowing them to walk further and faster.Honda says that the motors and control system have also been designed to be ultra-light weight, while the belt design and size-adjustable frames make it more accessible to put on and take off for all patients.The technology comes with a variety of training modes, including follow mode, where the device follows the patients' walking patterns, and symmetric mode, where the device adjusts the user’s walking pattern to help them achieve more symmetry in their motions when they bend and extend both legs. The step mode alters the user’s steps repeatedly to enable them to shift their weight from heel to sole and sole to toe more smoothly.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. An elderly person having trouble walking2. Robotic walking assistant measuring the walking patterns of a user3. Weight and lifespan of the robotic walking assistant4. Robot set to be available to hospitals starting in November 20155. Elderly people walking with ease with the help of robotic walking assistantVOICEOVER (in English): Automobile manufacturer Honda has developed a robotic walking assistant device to help rehabilitate patients learning to walk again. The device can also aid the elderly and those with walking disabilities.When the device is attached around a person’s pelvis and thighs, a sensor measures the walking patterns of each user and submits data displayed visually on a tablet.The robotic walking assistant device weighs around 2.7 kilograms, and has a battery life that lasts about 60 minutes.In November 2015, the robotic walking assistant device will be available to medical institutions in Japan.The device is expected to improve users’ motor skills and increase the distance they can walk.SOURCES: http://www.honda.co.jp/news/2015/p150721.html?from=topbannerhttp://car.watch.impress.co.jp/docs/news/20150722_712728.htmlhttp://www.sankei.com/economy/news/150721/ecn1507210042-n1.htmlhttp://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXLASDZ21HH1_R20C15A7TI5000/http://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20150721/k10010161361000.htmlhttp://japan.cnet.com/news/service/35067649/http://eandt.theiet.org/news/2015/jul/honda-walking.cfm***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
