item.title: China plans to build new 130 million people megacity around Beijing
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe Chinese government is embarking on an ambitious project to merge several megacities with the capital Beijing and create a super metropolis capable of housing as many as 130 million people, according to the New York Times. The megalopolis, called Jing-Jin-Ji, would link Beijing, Tianjin and Hebei province, will be spread over 82,000 square miles, about six times the size of New York City, but with a population of as much as one third of the United States.The plan aims to revamp northern China’s economy, by moving parts of Beijing’s bureaucracy, factories and hospitals to the hinterland, while offering new services that are lacking in areas around Beijing such as bus terminals, schools, cinemas and parks.A subway and better light rail system are also under construction and will open in the next three to five years. A new bridge over the Chaobai River will connect to Beijing. With this new super city, the Chinese government aims to assign new economic rules to the cities: Beijing will focus on culture and technology, Tianjin will become a research base for manufacturing and Hebei will more likely focus on minor industries, such as textiles.The entire project, which has the support of President Xi Jinping, is likely to see a deep reconsideration of how taxes are collected and distributed within the territory, which would mean instituting property taxes and allowing local governments to keep them.“This is a huge project and is more complicated than roads and rail,” Wang Hu, a historian of Beijing’s development was quoted by the New York Times as saying. “But if it can succeed, it will change the face of northern China.”RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. The megacity’s size 2. The megacity’s population 3. The megacity’s plan linking Beijing to Hebei province and Tianjin4. Subway, light rail and a new bridge to be constructed5. Beijing becoming the focus on culture and technology, Tianjin a research base for manufacturing, Hebei a focus on minor industries6. The megalopolis plan offering services and infrastructures lacking in the hinterland VOICEOVER (in English): “The megalopolis would be spread over 82,000 square miles, about six times the size of New York City...“but with a population larger than a third of the United States.”“The new plan will link Beijing to Hebei province and the economic area of Tianjin, with China’s capital moving part of its bureaucracy, factories and hospitals to the hinterland.”“A subway and better light rail system are planned to open in the next three to five years, and a new bridge over the Chaobai River to Beijing is under construction.”“With this new super city, Beijing will become the focus for culture and technology, Tianjin a research base for manufacturing with Hebei more likely to focus on minor industries, such as textiles.”“The plan is aimed at revamping northern China’s economy by offering services that are now lacking in the hinterland such as bus terminals, schools, cinemas and parks.” SOURCES: THE NEW YORK TIMEShttp://www.nytimes.com/2015/07/20/world/asia/in-china-a-supercity-rises-around-beijing.html?_r=1***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Giant earthquake predicted to hit Pacific Northwest of the United States
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twAccording to peer review studies recently highlighted in a New Yorker article, a giant earthquake is expected to hit the Pacific Northwest along the Cascadia subduction zone and strike an area that’s currently ill-prepared to handle its consequences.The Cascadia subduction zone is a fault line that runs from Cape Mendocino in northern California to Vancouver Island, Canada. It sits next to Juan de Fuca, an oceanic plate that continuously pushes against the North American continental plate.When the Juan de Fuca plate slides under the North American plate, it will cause an earthquake of a magnitude between 8.7 and 9.2 on the Richter scale, which dwarfs any earthquake unleashed by the San Andreas fault line. When the oceanic plate slides under Canada and the U.S., the entire coastal area will sink at least six feet in less than five minutes.Experts predict that northern California and Oregon will receive the greatest impact from the massive quake. They also predict that the massive earthquake and the tsunami that follows it, will displace millions, obliterate the region’s economy, and the Pacific Northwest may end up going months without electricity or water afterwards.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Location of the Cascadia fault line2. Juan de Fuca oceanic plate moving against the North American plate3. Plate moving underneath the North American plate4. North American plate sinking5. Region that will receive the greatest impact6. Frequency of Cascadia earthquakesVOICEOVER (in English): “A massive earthquake is expected to occur at the Cascadia subduction zone, a fault line that runs from Cape Mendocino in northern California to Vancouver Island, Canada.” “Next to the fault line is Juan de Fuca, an oceanic plate that continuously pushes against the North American continental plate.”“When the Juan de Fuca plate slides under the North American plate…” “... it will cause an earthquake. The entire coastal area will sink at least six feet in less than five minutes.”“Northern California and Oregon are expected to receive the greatest impact from the massive quake.”“There is usually a large quake along the fault every 300 years. As the last Cascadia earthquake took place on January 26, 1700, the Pacific Northwest is long overdue for a giant earthquake.”SOURCES: Southwest Neighborhoods, Inc., The New Yorker, Oregon State Universityhttp://swni.org/ep/cascadiahttp://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/07/20/the-really-big-onehttps://ceoas.oregonstate.edu/features/pnwearthquakerisk/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: World's longest water slide finds its new home at Action Park in Vernon, New Jersey
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe most awesome water slide in the world has found a new home at Action Park in Vernon, New Jersey. New Zealander Jimi Hunt, the co-founder of Live More Awesome charity, said that he had the slide constructed to raise awareness about depression and mental illness. The Guinness Book of World Records has recognized it as the longest in the world.It takes three days to fully set up the slide, which measures 1,975 feet long and uses about a thousand gallons of water per hour in order to facilitate sliding speeds reaching up to 40 miles per hour. It is made from the same PVC material that bouncy castles use. Up to 15 air blowers are used to keep it inflated.Initial test runs with park employees proved successful, but the slide still requires the state’s approval. Chances are it may be open to the public in 2016. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Man slides and the length of the slide is measured2. A modified snow machines trickle water3. The slide is moved from New Zealand to USA4. Air blowers keep the slide inflated5. Park employees enjoy the slideVOICEOVER (in English): The slide measures 1,975 feet in length and is wide enough for one adult.Modified snow-making machines pour a thousand gallons of water per hour onto the slide, allowing riders to reach speeds of 35 to 40 miles per hour. Jimi Hunt, the creator of the slide, brought it from his homeland of New Zealand to its current location at Action Park in Vernon, New Jersey.According to Hunt, the waterslide uses 15 air blowers to stay inflated and takes two to three days to fully set up.Though initial test runs with park employees were successful, the waterslide still requires state approval before opening to the public.SOURCES: Daily Mail, WGNOhttp://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3159952/World-s-longest-inflatable-water-slide-comes-New-Jersey-Action-Park.htmlhttp://wgno.com/2015/07/13/the-worlds-longest-inflatable-water-slide-is-now-in-the-us/

item.title: Inhalable Ebola vaccine works in animal tests
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe first needle-free vaccine against the Ebola virus has shown promise results on monkeys and researchers should begin human trials soon.The needle-free Ebola vaccine contains parainfluenza virus type 3, a common cause of respiratory tract infections in children. It is an Ebola virus glycoprotein that stimulates an immune response against the virus, according to AFP.During tests, the vaccine was inhaled by monkeys through nebulizer masks. Test results show that the vaccinated animals survived even when they were later injected with lethal dose of Ebola virus, AFP reported.“A needle-free, inhalable vaccine against Ebola presents certain advantages," AFP quoted Michelle Meyer, lead author of the study and University of Texas Medical Branch postdoctoral fellow in the department of pathology as saying. “Immunization will not require trained medical personnel.”RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. The vaccine contains HPIV3 virus and Ebola virus glycoprotein2. A monkey inhales the vaccine3. The vaccine prevents EbolaVOICEOVER (in English): “The needle-free Ebola vaccine contains parainfluenza virus type 3, a common cause of respiratory tract infections in children. It is an Ebola virus glycoprotein that stimulates an immune response against the virus.”“Tests had monkeys inhale the vaccine through nebulizer masks ...”“... with results showing that the vaccinated animals survived even after being injected with a lethal dose of the Ebola virus later.”SOURCES: AFPhttp://www.businessinsider.com/afp-needle-free-ebola-vaccine-shows-promise-in-animal-tests-2015-7***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Science solves dishwasher loading dispute
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twExperts working at Birmingham University’s Department of Chemical Engineering say the best way to pack a dishwasher is in a circular pattern with cutlery in the center.Dishes used for protein-heavy foods should sit on the edges and be placed lower in the machine to allow enough time for chemical detergents to effectively work, the researchers said, while plates and dishes used for carbohydrate-based foods should be packed in the center of trays or on top shelves to be closer to water jet sprays that dislodge these food remnants. Water in a dishwasher travels at a higher velocity towards the center of the machine and at a lower velocity along the edges. The slower-moving detergent-filled water breaks down proteins, while the faster-moving water swirling around the outside edges of the dishwasher helps break up and clean away carbohydrate-type foods.Media reported researchers also noted that rinsing dishes before washing them is unnecessary and simply scraping off excess food is sufficient.They also explained that that an overloaded dishwasher cannot properly clean dishes as there is not enough room between items to ensure dish surfaces come in contact with water and are cleaned properly.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. A dishwashing machine is x-rayed as dishes enter the machine in a circular pattern. 2. A dish containing protein-based food is placed in the recommended location. 3. A dish containing carbohydrate-based food is placed in the recommended location.4. X-ray shows water traveling at higher and lower velocities inside the machine. 5. An inside look of the dishwashing machine shows water moving at varying velocities which has an effect on dirty dishes inside the machine. 6. The effects of an overloaded dishwasher. VOICEOVER (in English): “Experts working at Birmingham University’s Department of Chemical Engineering earlier this year said that the best way to pack a dishwasher is in a circular pattern with cutlery in the center.”“Dishes used for protein heavy foods should sit on the edges and be placed lower in the machine to allow enough time for chemical detergents to effectively work.” “Dishes used for carbohydrate-based foods should be packed in the center of trays or on top shelves to be closer to water jet sprays that dislodge these food remnants.” “Water in a dishwasher travels at a higher velocity towards the center of the machine and at a lower velocity along the edges.” “Slower-moving detergent-filled water breaks down proteins, while faster-moving water helps break up and clean away carbohydrate type foods.”“When a dishwasher is overloaded there is not enough room between items to ensure dish surfaces come in contact with water and are cleaned properly.” SOURCES: The Wall Street Journal, The Daily Mailhttp://www.wsj.com/articles/youre-loading-the-dishwasher-wrong-a-chore-and-a-power-struggle-1435682078http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3158188/Finally-advice-save-marriage-experts-say-stack-dishwasher.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Technical trouble at United Airlines, The Wall Street Journal and the NYSE
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twTechnological problems at United Airlines, the Wall Street Journal and the New York Stock Exchange have ignited fears about cybersecurity and raised concerns about the vulnerabilities of many of the nation’s Internet-based systems.A series of internal technical issues that cropped up on Wednesday grounded United Airlines flights for several hours, downed the Wall Street Journal’s website and halted trade in the New York Stock Exchange.While none of the issues were due to cyberattacks, Wednesday’s events have sparked fears that many Internet-based systems are vulnerable to hackers. As the world has become increasingly connected to the Internet, more and more of the vital systems people use are Internet-reliant, and therefore potentially more vulnerable.Problems with the Internet are inevitable, and there’s always the potential for broken codes, human error and cyberattacks that mess with the system. Carl Wright, general manager of TrapX, a security company told the Los Angeles Times that a company could better protect their system by using two internet providers rather than one, with one serving as the backup. The company could also increase their security budget and train employees on how to handle internet failures quickly.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Technical issues at United Airlines, the Wall Street Journal and the NYSE2. World becoming more dependent on the Internet3. Hacker targeting an internet-based system 4. Current spendings on technological security5. Ways to strengthen a company’s internet-based systemVOICEOVER (in English): “As the New York Stock Exchange tweeted yesterday, the issues were ‘not the result of a cyber breach,’ but the problems have still ignited fears about cybersecurity in the U.S.”“A series of technical issues that cropped up on Wednesday grounded United Airlines flights for several hours, downed the Wall Street Journal’s website and halted trade in the New York Stock Exchange.” “Many of the world’s systems are increasingly Internet-reliant.”“Problems with the Internet are inevitable, and there’s always the potential for broken codes, human error and cyber attacks that disrupt with the system.”“However, the Los Angeles Times reports that many companies spend as little as 6 percent of their IT budget on security, leaving their systems vulnerable to issues.”“To better protect their system, a company could use two Internet providers rather than one, with one serving as the backup. The company could also increase their security budget and train employees on how to handle internet failures quickly.”SOURCES: http://www.latimes.com/business/technology/la-fi-tn-technical-problems-united-nyse-20150708-story.htmlhttp://www.wsj.com/articles/why-the-nyse-outage-may-not-matter-to-investors-1436374396http://www.politico.com/blogs/media/2015/07/wall-street-journal-website-down-amid-nyse-united-210137.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,News,Politics,Education,Educational,News & Politics,technical outages,NYSE,United Airlines,The Wall Street Journal,technical glitches,cyberattack

item.title: Silence held to mark tenth anniversary of London bombings
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA minute's silence was held at several sites in the UK Tuesday to mark the tenth anniversary of the the London Underground and bus bombings of 7 July 2005 in which 52 people were killed.Several underground stations started their silences at 08:50am - the time of the first bomb.The four bombs, three on subway trains and one on a bus, were carried out by four al-Qaeda sympathisers carrying backpacks full of explosives It remains the worst terrorist atrocity on British soil.Shezad Tanweer detonated his device on a Circle Line train between Liverpool Street and Aldgate.The explosion at the rear of the train’s second carriage killed seven people.The second suicide bomb exploded on the 311 train travelling south from King’s Cross to Russell Square.Twenty six people were killed when bomber Germaine Lindsay set off his bomb near the second set of double doors of the first carriage.Mohammad Sidique Khan set off his bomb on a Circle Line train as it was leaving Edgware Road station.The bomb, located in the second carriage, killed six people.Almost one hour later Hasib Hussain detonated his bomb on the upper level of a number 30 bus as it travelled through Tavistock Square.The force of the explosion tore the bus apart, killing 13 people.More than 700 others were injured by the explosions.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Depiction of first bomb attack by Shezad Tanweer2. Depiction of second bomb attack by Germaine Lindsay3. Depiction of third bomb by Mohammad Sidique Khan4. Depiction of fourth bomb by Hasib HussainVOICEOVER (in English): “Shezad Tanweer detonated his device on a Circle Line train between Liverpool Street and Aldgate.”“The explosion at the rear of the train’s second carriage killed seven people.”“The second suicide bomb exploded on the 311 train travelling south from King’s Cross to Russell Square.”“Twenty six people were killed when bomber Germaine Lindsay set off his bomb near the second set of double doors of the first carriage.”“Mohammad Sidique Khan set off his bomb on a Circle Line train as it was leaving Edgware Road station.”“The bomb, located in the second carriage, killed six people.”“Almost one hour later Hasib Hussain detonated his bomb on the upper level of a number 30 bus as it travelled through Tavistock Square.”“The force of the explosion tore the bus apart, killing 13 people.”SOURCES: BBChttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/shared/spl/hi/uk/05/london_blasts/what_happened/html/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Japanese weather satellite goes active
item.description: For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.tw A Japanese weather satellite that was launched to forecast typhoon movements and heavy rainfall went into operation today.The Himawari-8 was launched into geostationary orbit in October of 2014. It can capture images much faster and at a higher resolution than its predecessor, the Himawari-7. The Himawari-8 can take pictures every two minutes and 30 seconds, compared to once every 30-minutes for the Himawari-7.The full-color images taken by the Himawari-8 will allow scientists to more easily differentiate between cloud formations and yellow sand dust clouds, and help officials make more accurate weather forecasts and prepare for dangerous weather conditions. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Himawari-8 was launched in October of 20142. Himawari-8 went into operation at 11 a.m. today Japanese time 3. Himawari-8 can capture images much faster and at a higher resolution 4. Himawari-8 allows for more accurate weather forecasts and disaster prevention5. Himawari-8 identifies yellow dust clouds and clouds via color footageVOICEOVER (in English): “Japan’s Himawari-8 weather satellite was launched in October of 2014.”“Since then, the satellite has been in orbit, but it goes into full operation today.”“The satellite has a much clearer resolution than its predecessor, and can take pictures every two minutes and 30 seconds. Previously, the Himawari-7 was only able to snap pictures in 30-minutes intervals.”“The technology allows officials to make more accurate weather forecasts as well as become more prepared for dangerous weather conditions.”“The color images taken by the satellite also allow scientists to more easily differentiate between cloud formations and yellow sand dust clouds.”SOURCES: http://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20150707/k10010141351000.htmlhttp://www.huffingtonpost.jp/tenkijp/triple-typhoon_b_7734878.htmlhttp://www.47news.jp/CN/201507/CN2015070701000989.htmlhttp://www.data.jma.go.jp/mscweb/ja/himawari89/http://www.jma-net.go.jp/sat/satellite/satellite.htmlhttp://www.jma-net.go.jp/sat/data/web89/himawari8_sample_data.html#cbhttp://www.jma.go.jp/jma/jma-eng/satellite/news/himawari89/20150501_himawari8_sample_data.htmlhttp://scienceportal.jst.go.jp/news/newsflash_review/newsflash/2014/10/20141007_03.htmlhttp://www.mitsubishielectric.co.jp/me/eco_changes/lp/03/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Japan early industrial sites win UNESCO heritage status
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twJapan won UNESCO World Cultural Heritage status for 23 Meiji Industrial Revolution sites on Sunday.The sites, including Hashima Island, also known as Battleship Island, a coal mine island off Nagasaki Port, illustrate Japan’s rapid industrialisation.South Korea says many of the sites employed forced labour from the Korean Peninsula. Due to disagreements with South Korea over the recognition of the forced labor issue, the assessment was delayed by a day until Sunday the 5th.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1.Steel, shipbuilding, coal facilities and 8 Prefectures and 23 sites (including 2 sites in Kumamoto Prefecture) are certified as World Heritage Sites.2.The introduction of western industrialization in Japan.3.South Korea insisted that "the Korean Peninsula-born people were engaged in forced labor."4.Consultations between Japan and South Korea, on July 4th the assessment was postponed to July 5th.5.Japan has 15 registered cultural sites, , including the natural sites sums up a total of 19 sites.VOICEOVER (in English): Twenty-three sites in 8 prefectures from the Meiji Industrial Revolution have been recognized, including steel, shipbuilding, and coal mining facilities. The sites were recognised for their key role in bringing industrialization to Japan.South Korea says large numbers of Koreans were employed at the sites as forced labour. Due to disagreements with South Korea over the recognition of the forced labor issue, the assessment was delayed by a day until Sunday the 5th.Japan now has 15 registered UNESCO cultural sites, and 19 sites in total. SOURCES: http://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20150705/k10010139851000.htmlhttp://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20150706/k10010140011000.htmlhttp://www.yomiuri.co.jp/culture/20150705-OYT1T50086.htmlhttp://www.huffingtonpost.jp/2015/07/05/world-heritage-gunkanjima_n_7730182.html?utm_hp_ref=japanhttp://www.47news.jp/CN/201507/CN2015070501001437.htmlhttp://www.asahi.com/articles/ASH755FLLH75UHBI011.htmlhttp://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2015/07/05/national/unesco-decides-to-add-meiji-industrial-sites-to-world-heritage-list/#.VZmuBPntlBchttp://the-japan-news.com/news/article/0002267559http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-07-05/japan-wins-unesco-recognition-after-concession-to-south-koreahttp://ajw.asahi.com/article/behind_news/politics/AJ201507050021http://ajw.asahi.com/article/behind_news/politics/AJ201507050029***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Facebook to use lasers, satellites and drones to bring Internet to developing countries
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twMark Zuckerberg announced on Wednesday that Facebook is considering using lasers on drones and satellites to connect the next billion people to the internet.People in developing countries are more likely connect to the internet using mobile phones instead of computers.Initially, Facebook considered satellites, which work best for low-density areas.For suburban areas, the company is considering drones, which will fly much higher altitude than commercial airliners, at around 20,000 meters.The drones, which have a wingspan greater than that of a Boeing 737, are solar-powered and can remain airborne for months.On both the satellites and drones, Facebook would use lasers to beam data through the air and provide high-speed connectivity similar to that of fiber optic networks.According to Zuckerberg, the laser beams won’t actually be visible but will allow users to send data at dramatically improved speeds over longer distances.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Developing countries and mobile phone connection 2. Satellites bring the internet in low and high density areas 3. Drones altitude 4. Drones’ wingspan, solar powers and duration5. Laser beams between satellites; laser beams between drones6. Laser beams creating internet connection in developing countriesVOICEOVER (in English):“People in developing countries are more likely connect to the internet using mobile phones instead of computers.”“Initially, Facebook considered satellites, which work best for low-density areas.”“For suburban areas, the company is considering drones, which fly at a much higher altitude than commercial planes, at around 20,000 meters.”“These drones, which have a wingspan greater than that of a Boeing 737, are solar-powered and can remain airborne for months.” “On both the satellites and drones, Facebook would use lasers to beam data through the air and provide high-speed connectivity similar to that of fiber optic networks.” SOURCES: Engadget, Facebook@Mark Zuckerberg, Quartzhttp://www.engadget.com/2015/07/01/zuckerberg-facebook-lasers/https://www.facebook.com/zuckhttp://qz.com/443865/facebook-wants-to-use-lasers-to-beam-the-internet-from-drones-in-the-sky/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Tokyo’s Haneda Airport to begin using robots
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twIn September, the Tokyo city airport will lease 11 robots to help clean the facilities and carry passengers’ baggage, according to multiple reports. The robots look similar to wet-dry vacuums or motorized stools. Authorities say if the robots work well, more airports around the country may also begin to use them.“I want to expand it to all other airports in Japan, and also to airports worldwide,” Bloomberg quoted Japan Airport Terminal Co. President Isao Takashiro as saying. The airport operator leased the robots from Cyberdyne Inc., the two companies said in a statement released Thursday.Cyberdyne will also provide five exoskeletons designed to help workers in loading tasks. The company says the suits work by detecting electric signals from the wearer’s brain to help people move merchandise more easily.The announcement of robots in the airport comes after Japan’s Cabinet’s Tuesday approval of the government’s revamped Japan Revitalization Strategy, which includes support for robot research and development as one of the main areas of focus.As Japan’s workforce ages, robots are beginning to take over the work. According to Bloomberg, about 26 percent of Japan’s 127 million population are aged over 65. This is the highest percentage among the top seven industrialized nations.Haneda is the second-busiest airport in Asia and the fourth-busiest in the world, according to the International Air Transport Association.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Demonstration of exoskeleton 2. Continued demonstration of exoskeleton 3. Demonstration of robots at airport4. Disabled passenger unable to lift bags5. Robots helps passenger carry bags6. Depiction of all the robots that will be usedVOICEOVER (in English): “An exoskeleton that fits over airport workers’ bodies and interprets signals from their brains will help Haneda Airport staff in moving heavy merchandise.”“Robots that are designed to clean the facilities at the airport 24 hours a day will also be deployed.”“Meanwhile, robots capable of supporting 200 kg in weight will be used to aid passengers who are unable to carry their own luggage.”“Officials say the use of the robots will help reduce costs, and the program may possibly be expanded to other airports.”SOURCES: Bloomberg, Nikkei, NTV, TBS, Sankei, Japan Times, Kyodo Newshttp://www.bloomberg.co.jp/news/123-NQUPNF6JTSEB01.html http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-07-02/say-konnichi-wa-to-robots-in-tokyo-ahttp://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXLASDZ02HSK_S5A700C1TI5000/http://toyokeizai.net/articles/-/75530http://news.tbs.co.jp/newseye/tbs_newseye2531214.htmlhttp://www.sankeibiz.jp/business/news/150703/bsd1507030500003-n1.htmhttp://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2015/07/02/business/tech/haneda-airport-used-testing-ground-robot-technology/#.VZW8VvntlBchttp://www.kyodonews.net/news/2015/07/02/22918***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,robots,Haneda Airport,Japan,Tokyo,cleaning,luggage,News,Politics,Education,Educational,News & Politics

item.title: Toshiba to use scorpion-like robot to enter Fukushima nuclear power plant
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twToshiba is deploying a robot that looks like a scorpion to enter the Fukushima Dai-ichi nuclear power plant in Japan. This comes amid the ongoing struggle to clean up the power plant following the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in northern Japan that caused a radiation leak and long-term evacuations.The cylinder-shaped machine was developed with the International Research Institute for Nuclear Decommissioning (IRID), and is designed to enter the primary containment vessel (PCV) of the Unit 2 reactor at the plant.The aim of the device is to help authorities determine the condition and location of melted-down fuel in the reactor, which is too dangerous for workers to enter.The robot is 54 centimetres long and is able to pull itself right-side up if it falls over. A joint near the middle of the robot allows it to raise its tail like a scorpion to allow a camera and LED lights to sweep the environment. This complements another camera and LED lights in the nose section of the robot.Control signals are sent to the robot through a wire by operators using devices resembling PlayStation game controllers. The 5-kilogram (11-pound) machine also has a thermometer and a dosimeter, and can withstand about 100 Sieverts per hour of radiation for 10 hours.The robot could be exposed to as much as 70 Sieverts per hour of radiation in the No. 2 reactor. This is about seven times that encountered by robots that ventured into the No. 1 reactor, according to a Toshiba spokeswoman.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Conditions inside Fukushima nuclear power plant2. Depiction of robot3. Interior of robot4. Operators controlling robot5. Robot navigating6. Proposed date robot will be deployedVOICEOVER (in English): “A cylinder-shaped machine is designed to enter a primary containment vessel of the Fukushima Dai-ichi Nuclear Power Plant.”“The robot, measuring 26 centimetres along the base, can withstand about 100 Sieverts per hour of radiation for 10 hours.”“A camera and LED lights located on the robot’s tail allow it to visually sweep the environment.”“This is controlled by operators who send signals to the robot through a wire.”“Even in low visibility conditions, the robot can identify obstructions within a range of 3 metres.”“Experts will begin testing the device in July, with the robot expected to be deployed into the nuclear power plant in August.”SOURCES: http://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXLASGG30H0I_Q5A630C1000000/http://www.nikkan.co.jp/news/nkx0120150701bcak.htmlhttp://news.tv-asahi.co.jp/news_economy/articles/000053735.htmlhttp://www.computerworld.com/article/2942037/emerging-technology/toshiba-readies-scorpionlike-robot-for-fukushima-nuclear-plant.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Toshiba,scorpion,robot,Fukushima,nuclear power plant,News,Politics,Education,Educational,News & Politics

item.title: Helium suggests California fault is much deeper than previously thought
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA team led by a scientist from the University of California Santa Barbara have discovered that helium is leaking from an ancient fault line which suggests it is much deeper than previously thought.The helium leak was discovered along a stretch of the Newport-Inglewood fault that runs from LA’s westside to Newport Beach in Orange County.Samples of casing gases taken from two dozen oil wells along the fault line showed high levels of Helium 3, a gas whose only terrestrial source is the Earth’s mantle.The metamorphic rock blueschist rock was also found at the bottom of nearby wells indicating that the Newport-Inglewood fault was a subduction zone around 30 million years ago before the intersection jumped 40 miles east to the San Andreas fault.The study’s lead geologist Jim Boles said the results of the study indicate that the Newport-Inglewood fault is much more important than previously thought, although as of now they are not sure why.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Location of the Newport-Inglewood fault2. Depiction of casing gas samples from oil wells along the fault line3. The Earth’s mantle as the source of Helium 34. Blueschist indicating the Newport-Inglewood fault as an ancient subduction zoneVOICEOVER (in English): “The Helium leak was discovered along a stretch of the Newport-Inglewood fault that runs from LA’s westside to Newport Beach in Orange County.”“Samples of casing gases taken from two dozen oil wells along the fault line showed high levels of Helium 3, a gas whose only terrestrial source is the Earth’s mantle. “The metamorphic rock blueschist rock was also found at the bottom of nearby wells indicating that the Newport-Inglewood fault was a subduction zone around 30 million years ago before the intersection jumped 40 miles east to the San Andreas fault.”SOURCES: The Currenthttp://www.news.ucsb.edu/2015/015530/deep-dark-mystery***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,San Andreas,earthquake,fault line,helium 3,mantle,Newport-Inglewood fault,subduction zone,News,Politics,Education,Educational,News & Politics

item.title: U.S. Supreme Court upholds execution drug midazolam
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe U.S. Supreme Court has upheld the use of an execution drug that has been previously implicated in flawed executions.In Glossip v. Gross, three prisoners in Oklahoma argued that midazolam failed to achieve the level of unconsciousness required for surgery, creating risk of severe pain and suffering, the BBC reported.Midazolam is supposed to induce unconsciousness before other drugs are injected to stop a person’s breathing and their heart.Eight U.S. states, including Oklahoma, have either used midazolam or have proposed using the drug, the New York Times reported.Some U.S. states reintroduced other controversial methods, such as the gas chamber and firing squad during the shortage of various drugs, according to the BBC.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. U.S. turns to midazolam after EU bans the sale of lethal injection drugs 2. Midazolam supposed to induce unconsciousness during lethal injection 3. Oklahoma highlighted on map 4. Three inmates have flawed executions5. Eight states allow the use of midazolamVOICEOVER (in English): [TITLE CUT]“Several U.S. states began turning to midazolam after the EU banned the sale of products used in lethal injections.”“Midazolam is supposed to induce unconsciousness before other drugs are injected into a person to stop their breathing and their heart.”“In Glossip v. Gross, three prisoners in Oklahoma argued that midazolam failed to achieve the level of unconsciousness required for surgery, creating risk of severe pain and suffering.”“Eight U.S. states, including Oklahoma, have either used midazolam or have proposed using the drug.”SOURCES: BBC, New York Timeshttp://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-33314067http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/01/28/us/oklahoma-death-penalty-case.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: SpaceX rocket explodes after launch
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twAn unmanned SpaceX rocket exploded shortly after launch from Florida on Sunday, destroying supplies bound for the International Space Station.The cause of explosion in the Falcon 9 rocket was not yet clear, officials told Reuters. A preliminary analysis indicated a problem with the rocket's upper-stage engine, Space X CEO Elon Musk said on Twitter.Falcon 9 rockets will be grounded for "a number of months or so" but less than a year while an investigation into the explosion is conducted, SpaceX President Gwynne Shotwell said.The Falcon 9 rocket has flown 18 times successfully since its debut five years ago. These include six station cargo runs for NASA under a 15-fight contract worth more than $2 billion. RUNDOWN SHOWS: 1. Falcon 9 rocket2. Rocket separating from payload3. Supplies4. International space station5. Astronaut and Cosmonauts aboard space stationVOICEOVER (in English): “Officials are trying to ascertain what caused a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket to explode after liftoff on Sunday. Preliminary analysis indicates an oxygen tank malfunction.”“If the launch was successful, the unmanned rocket would have continued into orbit, eventually separating from its payload.”“The craft was carrying supplies bound for the International Space Station. These included food44, hardware, an international docking adapter and other materials.“Reuters reports that the mission is the second unsuccessful mission this year to resupply the space station, though this is the first failed attempt by SpaceX.”“Aboard the station right now are two Russians and one American. They have around four months of supplies left.”SOURCES: Reuters, CNNhttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/06/28/us-space-spacex-launch-idUSKCN0P80NM20150628http://money.cnn.com/2015/06/28/technology/spacex-failed-mission-what-we-know/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: How the Northern Lights are formed
item.description: For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twOngoing geomagnetic storms have led to sightings of the Northern Lights across North America this week, the result of a coronal mass ejection from the Sun that occurred on Sunday, sending a stream of charged particles toward Earth.The Northern Lights, or Aurora Borealis, are caused by blasts of magnetic plasma from the Sun that react with the Earth’s own magnetic field. Some of the charged particles from the solar wind enter the Earth’s atmosphere and are drawn to the magnetic north pole and magnetic south pole. These particles excite atoms and molecules in the atmosphere, causing them to give off photons of light as they quiet down.The solar wind can cause the Earth’s magnetic field lines to disconnect from the planet. When the magnetic field lines reconnect, charged particles from the solar wind enter the Earth’s atmosphere, causing aurora. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Solar storm2. Solar wind hitting Earth’s magnetic field3. Solar storm causing magnetic field line to disconnect4. Atoms excitedVOICEOVER (in English): “Ongoing geomagnetic storms have led to sightings of the northern lights across North America this week.”“The northern lights, or aurora borealis, are caused by blasts of magnetic plasma from the Sun reacting with the Earth’s own magnetic field.”“Some of the charged particles from the solar wind enter the Earth’s atmosphere and are drawn to the magnetic north pole and magnetic south pole. These particles excite atoms and molecules in the atmosphere, causing them to emit light.” “The solar wind can cause the Earth’s magnetic field lines to disconnect from the planet. When the magnetic field lines reconnect, charged particles from the solar wind enter the Earth’s atmosphere, causing aurora.”“When atoms are excited, electrons orbiting around the nucleus of the atom move to higher-energy orbits. When electrons move back down, they release photons, or particles of light.”“Scientists at NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland are hoping to use satellites to improve their ability to track and forecast the scale and impact of solar storms.”SOURCES: CBC, BBC, The Guardian, Northern Lights Centrehttp://www.cbc.ca/news/trending/aurora-northern-and-southern-lights-visible-far-and-wide-thanks-to-solar-ejection-1.3123977http://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-26381685http://www.theguardian.com/science/2015/mar/18/solar-storm-delivers-spectacular-aurora-displays-and-pictureshttp://www.northernlightscentre.ca/northernlights.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,aurora,aurora borealis,nothern lights,aurora explained,aurora australis,northern lights explained,solar storm,solar wind,magnetic fields,earths atmosphere,news,politics,education,news & politics,educational,nma,next media animation,taiwanese animators

item.title: Japanese carmakers expand recall of cars with Takata airbags
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twJapanese carmakers Toyota, Nissan and Mitsubishi are recalling more cars to replace airbags made by Takata, which have been linked to eight deaths and more than 100 injuries.Takata is at the center of a recall of tens of millions of cars around the world for potentially deadly air bag inflators that could deploy with too much force and spray metal fragments inside vehicles.The recalls initially were limited to North America but now how been expanded to cover the rest of the world.The faulty airbags are found in certain models made by Toyota, Honda, Mazda, BMW, Nissan, Mitsubishi, Subaru, Chrysler, Ford and General Motors.The inside of an airbag’s inflator assembly, which is located underneath the steering wheel, is filled with propellant granules and propellants. Unlike propellants made by most other brands, Takata-designed propellants are made from ammonium nitrate. If exposed to high humidity, the propellants can end up damaged or cracked, this causes them to produce too much pressure inside the inflator, causing it to crack and explode.When the airbag inflates, pieces of the damaged inflator may fly at the driver and passenger like shrapnel, putting people in a crash at greater risk of injury. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Passenger and driver-side airbags experience problems2. Location of an inflator assembly and propellant granules within the inflator heating up the propellants3. Propellant exposed to high humidity and causing damage to the inflator4. Airbag inflating and pieces of the inflator hitting the driver VOICEOVER (in English): “The recalled vehicles feature front passenger and driver-side airbags that may deploy abnormally, according to Takata.”“The inside of an airbag’s inflator assembly, which is located underneath the steering wheel, is filled with propellant granules and propellants. Unlike propellants made by most other brands, Takata-designed propellants are made from ammonium nitrate.”“If exposed to high humidity, the propellants can end up damaged, which causes them to produce too much pressure inside the inflator, causing it to crack and explode.” “When the airbag inflates, pieces of the damaged inflator may fly at the driver and passenger like shrapnel, putting people involved in a crash at greater risk of injury.”SOURCES: Reuters, National Highway and Traffic Safety Administration, NBC News, New York Times, ABC Newshttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/06/25/us-autos-takata-idUSKBN0P503D20150625http://www.nhtsa.gov/About+NHTSA/Press+Releases/2014/Vehicle-owners-with-defective-airbags-urged-to-take-immediate-actionhttp://www.nbcnews.com/business/autos/u-s-expands-recall-warning-cars-defective-air-bags-n231216http://www.reuters.com/article/2014/10/21/us-autos-takata-lawsuits-idUSKCN0IA1TK20141021 http://www.reuters.com/article/2014/10/22/us-autos-takata-warning-idUSKCN0IB03B20141022http://www.reuters.com/article/2014/10/22/us-autos-takata-warning-idUSKCN0IB03B20141022http://www.nytimes.com/2015/05/20/business/takata-airbag-recall.html?_r=0http://abcnews.go.com/US/takata-corp-declares-34-million-airbags-defective-agrees/story?id=31157446***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Woman gets flesh-eating bacteria after mud run
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA Texas woman is now blind in one eye after she was infected with flesh-eating bacteria while competing in a mud run in Dallas earlier this month.Brittany Williams from north Texas became infected with flesh-eating bacteria in her eye during a mud run in Dallas. Within 24 hours the bacteria had destroyed her cornea.“My eye started hurting, like maybe I’ve got mud or some debris in there,” Brittany Williams told CBS DFW. “When I opened my eye, it was just like white. The whole room was white.”Flesh-eating bacteria is an infection caused by the bacterium Streptococcus pyogenes. The bacteria can enter the human body through minor cuts or abrasions. It then produces toxins that destroy tissues such as muscles, skin and fat, according to MedicineNet.com.Williams has two jobs but no health insurance. Her family has set up a fundraising campaign to raise money to cover her $100,000 medical bills, CBS DFW reported.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Streptococcus pyogenes bacteria floating in midair2. Bacteria enters skin via an open wound3. Bacteria destroy tissues4. A debris cut William’s eye5. Bacteria destroy her corneaVOICEOVER (in English): “Flesh-eating bacteria is an infection caused by the bacterium Streptococcus pyogenes.”“The bacteria can enter human body through minor cuts or abrasions. Once inside the body the bacteria produces toxins that destroy tissue such as muscles, skin and fat.”“Brittany Williams caught flesh-eating bacteria after cutting her eye during a Dallas mud run around two weeks ago…” “.... and within 24 hours the bacteria had destroyed her cornea.’SOURCES: CBS DFW, MedicineNet.comhttp://dfw.cbslocal.com/2015/06/22/dirty-and-dangerous-woman-loses-sight-in-eye-after-mud-run/http://www.medicinenet.com/flesh_eating_bacterial_infection/views.htm***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,flesh-eating bacteria,mud run,Brittany Williams,eye infection,health,woman goes blind after mud run,skin infection

item.title: Samsung unveils ‘see-through’ trucks
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twSamsung is seeking regulatory approval for a new invention that literally makes trucks see-through and which the tech giant hopes may improve road safety.Dubbed the “Safety Truck”, Samsung installed a wireless camera to the front of a truck, which sends a live video feed to a video wall made of four exterior monitors on the back of the truck. Drivers behind the truck can see clearly what is going on in front of the truck and thus can decide when to overtake safely, according to an official blog of Samsung.The truck was developed and tested in Argentina, where traffic accident rates are among the highest in the world, CBS News reported.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. A car fails to overtake a truck on a single-lane road2. Camera and monitors installed on a truck3. A car sees the image on monitors and overtakes a truck 4. A car sees an animal crossing the road on the monitors on truckVOICEOVER (in English): “Overtaking trucks on a single-lane road can be extremely dangerous as it is often difficult to see the road condition in front of the truck.”“To solve this problem, Samsung has installed a wireless camera to the front of the truck, which sends a live video feed to a video wall made of four exterior monitors on the back of the truck.”“This enables drivers behind the truck to see clearly what is going on in front of the truck and thus can decide when to overtake safely.”“It may also reduce the risk of accidents caused by animals crossing roads.”SOURCES: Samsung Tomorrow, The Verge, CBS Newshttp://global.samsungtomorrow.com/the-safety-truck-could-revolutionize-road-safety/http://www.theverge.com/2015/6/21/8820059/samsung-road-safety-truck-prototypehttp://www.cbsnews.com/news/could-samsungs-see-through-safety-semi-truck-prevent-accidents/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Samsung,see-through truck,safety truck,road safety,road accident,technology,driving behind trucks

item.title: Russia touts new ‘super tank’ T-14 Armata
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twRussia’s fifth-generation main battle tank is so advanced its designers are telling Western media outlets that operating it is like “playing a computer game.”The T-14 Armata tank, which features an automated gun turret and a new type of reactive armor, was shown off by Russia during its May 9 Victory Parade in Moscow celebrating the 70th anniversary of the fall of Nazi Germany.Ilya Demchenko, deputy chief designer, told Sky News: “A new philosophy of these machines is that they have a remote controlled combat module, multi-spectre channels, new algorithms and, if I may draw an example, it's as if the crew, roughly speaking, plays a computer game.According to reports in Jane’s Defence and RT, the T-14 will be faster than America’s Abrams tank and will enter service next year. The new tank features a 125 mm smooth-bore cannon that fires missiles as well as shells, a remote-controlled machine gun and an advanced armor package along three-quarters of its length. For increased survivability, its three crew will be protected by a multilayer armor capsule that is separate from the ammunition container. This marks a departure from Soviet-era main battle tank designs, where crew safety, or “survivability,” did not appear to be a primary concern. The T-14 will replace Russia’s T-72 and T-90 main battle tanks. Russia plans for more than 2,300 Armatas to enter service with its military over the next 15 years. The official cost of the new tank has not been disclosed, but observers say it may cost as much as a fighter jet. The acquisition of 2,300 Armatas is part of a 22 trillion rouble ($400 billion) programme to upgrade Russia’s military that also includes hundreds of new aircraft and missiles and dozens of new navy ships.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. T-14 Armata in the Fulda Gap2. Reported features and capabilities of the T-14VOICEOVER: “The Armata will reportedly be faster than America’s Abrams tank and will enter service next year.”“The new tank features a 125 mm smooth-bore cannon that fires missiles as well as shells, a remote-controlled machine gun and an advanced armor package along three-quarters of its length.”“It could possibly hit speeds of over 80 kph, have a target detection range of over 5 km and have a shooting range of at least 3.5 km.”“For increased survivability, its three crew will be protected by a multilayer armor capsule that is separate from the ammunition container.”SOURCES: BBC, IHS Jane’s 360, RT, Sky Newshttp://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-32628236http://www.janes.com/article/50896/new-russian-heavy-armour-breaks-coverhttp://rt.com/news/253445-armata-tank-network-warfare/https://uk.news.yahoo.com/russian-tank-feels-playing-computer-game-105749427.html#NkwxSZ2***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Skinny jeans sends an Australian woman to the hospital
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twDoctors are warning of the dangers associated with wearing tight jeans after a 35-year-old ‘fashion victim’ in Australia had to be hospitalized for several days with severe numbness in her legs after spending hours squatting to clean out cupboards while wearing skinny jeans.Medical professionals say that skinny jeans can cause a condition called ‘compartment syndrome,’ where swollen muscles can end up severely damaging nerves in the leg.The squatting position, together with tight jeans, caused the woman’s muscles to swell, constricting the blood vessels and causing decreased blood supply to the legs. Looser pants would have allowed the muscles to expand to the side and relieve pressure on the blood vessels inside.The combination of swollen muscles and skinny jeans also placed pressure on two important nerves in the calf - the common peroneal nerve and the tibial nerve. This crushed the nerves and brought about a loss of feeling in the woman’s calves and feet.As the woman walked home that evening, she found that she couldn’t move her legs and feet properly and collapsed on the road.Doctors studied the woman’s nerves after she was hospitalized and found that there were blockages in her leg nerves. The woman spent a few days in the hospital recovering before she was able to walk on her own again.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Woman kneeling and cleaning cupboard2. Woman’s blood supply to lower legs is reduced3. Swollen muscles push on nerve in the back of the leg4. Woman collapses on the way homeVOICEOVER (in English): “The warnings about skinny jeans come after an Australian woman encountered severe numbness in her legs and had to be hospitalized after spending hours squatting to clean out cupboards.”“The squatting position, together with her tight jeans, caused the woman’s muscles to swell. The swelling constricted the blood vessels and led to decreased blood supply in the lower legs. Looser pants would have allowed the muscles to expand to the side and relieve pressure on the blood vessels inside.”“The combination of swollen muscles and skinny jeans also placed pressure on the nerves in the calf, crushing the nerves and causing a loss of feeling in the woman’s legs.”“As the woman walked home that evening, she found that she couldn’t move her legs and feet properly and collapsed on the road.”SOURCES: Time, The Sydney Morning Herald, The Guardian, Business Insiderhttp://time.com/3930558/skinny-jeans-harms/http://www.smh.com.au/national/health/close-call-skinny-jeans-wearer-hospitalised-with-leg-weakness-and-nerve-damage-20150623-ghue8m?skin=dumb-phonehttp://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2015/jun/22/skinny-jeans-bad-for-your-health-scientific-evidencehttp://www.businessinsider.com/skinny-jeans-are-bad-for-your-health-2015-6***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,skinny jeans,Australian,fashion victim,damage to the nerves,dangers of skinny jeans,health impact of skinny jeans

item.title: Amsterdam to get world’s first 3D-printed bridge
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twDutch startup company MX3D has announced plans to build the world’s first 3-D printed bridge across an Amsterdam canal. The company hopes the technique could become standard on future construction projects.The company has invented robotic printers that weld steel structures using 3-D technology. The process involves robotic arm printers “walking” across the canal as it slides along the bridge’s edges, allowing the structure that has already been printed to support the weight of the robots.The robotic arms work by heating metal to 1,500 degrees Celsius (around 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit) and welding the structure drop-by-drop, according to MX3D. A computer program plots the design of the structure.Company representatives hope the bridge in Amsterdam will pave the way for using the same technique on construction sites, especially those involving dangerous processes such as construction on high buildings.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. 3D bridge over Amsterdam canal2. Depiction of how robots print metal3. People on scaffolding replaced by 3D printer robots4. Robots supported by printed bridge that they buildVOICEOVER (in English): “Dutch company MX3D plans to print a bridge across an Amsterdam canal, with the project set to begin in September.”“A computer program plots designs while robotic arms heat metal to 1,500 degrees Celsius around 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit to weld structures drop by drop.”“This technique removes the need for scaffolding and people as the robotic arms are supported by the very structure they are printing.”“This essentially means robotic arms will ‘walk’ across the canal as a bridge is being created.”SOURCES: Japan Times, The Guardian, Science Alert, Huffington Posthttp://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2015/06/17/business/tech/robot-3-d-print-amsterdam-bridge/#.VYF4SPmqpBfhttp://www.theguardian.com/technology/2015/jun/17/dutch-startup-plans-first-3d-printed-steel-bridge-to-span-amsterdam-canalhttp://www.sciencealert.com/autonomous-robot-arms-are-going-to-3d-print-a-bridge-in-amsterdamhttp://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/06/15/amsterdam-3d-printed-steel-bridge-to-be-drawn-by-robots_n_7584316.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,MX3D,3D printing,Amsterdam,canal,bridge,3D technology,Netherlands,start up,nma,next media animation,Taiwanese animators

item.title: New technology would make houses hover during earthquakes
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twGreg Henderson, the co-founder and CEO of Arx Pax, says electromagnetic hoverboard technology may be the future of earthquake-proofed homes.Most earthquake-proofing systems decouple buildings from the ground using “base isolation bearings” so that they can move freely without compromising the building’s integrity.Henderson’s new system would rely on an electromagnet to produce repulsive magnetic force and generate lift.The house would be linked to the U.S. Geological Survey’s ShakeAlert system, allowing it to retract landing gears, activate the electromagnet and hover for up to 90 seconds when an earthquake is detected.The ShakeAlert system, which relies on a series of sensors placed near fault lines, has already proven effective in giving residents of earthquake-prone areas a head-start on incoming quakes.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Normal house destroyed in earthquake2. Base isolation bearings3. Arx Pax’s new patent4. Electromagnets5. Electromagnetic house6. ShakeAlert systemVOICEOVER (in English): “During an earthquake, the main danger to a building’s structure is lateral movement.”“Today, most earthquake-proofing systems decouple buildings from the ground using ‘base isolation bearings’ so that they can move freely without compromising the building’s integrity.”“Arx Pax currently hold a patent for a buffer system that uses water or gas to raise homes, protecting them from destructive lateral movement.”“But Henderson’s new system would rely on electromagnetics to produce repulsive magnetic force and lift the house.”“The house would be linked to the U.S. Geological Survey’s ShakeAlert system, allowing activate the electromagnet and hover for up to 90-seconds when an earthquake is detected.”“The ShakeAlert system, which relies on a series of sensors placed near fault lines, has already proven effective in giving residents of earthquake-prone areas a head start on incoming earthquakes”SOURCES: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-3119169/Could-hover-houses-protect-California-big-one-Firm-reveals-plans-raise-homes-giant-magnets-event-quake.htmlhttp://www.theverge.com/2014/10/21/7025197/i-rode-a-real-hoverboardhttp://www.foxnews.com/tech/2015/06/10/california-company-aims-to-hover-buildings/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,hoverboard,earthquake,hendo hoverboard,arx pax,electromagnet,electromagnetic,hovering,greg henderson,nma,next media animation,taiwanese animators

item.title: Deadly bacteria found in Gulf of Mexico is Florida causing beach-goers concern
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA deadly bacteria present in the Gulf of Mexico is causing concern for Florida beachgoers.The bacteria, Vibrio vulnificus, is from the same family as cholera and is most commonly found in warm coastal waters. It requires high concentrations of salt to survive.According to the Florida Department of Health, infections are rare in healthy people. The bacteria normally infects people who enter coastal waters with an open wound or through consumption of undercooked or raw oysters.Contrary to some reports, the bacteria doesn’t eat flesh, but it is still deadly under certain circumstances, writes CNN.If the bacteria enters the bloodstream, it can then damage the skin and in 50 percent of such cases is fatal, according to the Center for Disease Control and Prevention.Oysters feed by filtering water, where they extract food particles, and sometimes the Vibrio vulnificus bacteria, which then concentrates on the oyster tissue. If an infected oyster is eaten undercooked or raw, the bacteria can enter the individual’s digestive tract and multiply rapidly.Vibrio vulnificus has infected 214 people and killed 66 since 2008, according to the Florida Department of Health. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Background on the bacteria2. Man swimming with open wound and someone eating an undercooked oyster3. A man and his open wound 4. Bacteria in the bloodstream5. Oyster filtering water6. Bacteria multiplying in digestive tractVOICEOVER (in English): “Vibrio vulnificus is a bacterium from the same family as cholera. It is most commonly found in warm coastal waters as it requires salt to survive.”“While infections are rare, the bacteria normally infects people who enter coastal waters with an open wound or those who consume undercooked or raw oysters.”“Contrary to some reports the bacteria doesn’t eat flesh, but it can still harm the skin.”“If the bacteria enters the bloodstream, it can then damage the skin and in 50 percent of such cases is fatal.”“Oysters feed by filtering water, from which they extract algae and food particles, and sometimes the vibrio vulnificus bacteria.”“If an infected oyster is eaten undercooked or raw, the bacteria can enter the individual’s digestive tract and multiply rapidly.”SOURCES: Florida Department of Health, U.S. Food and Drug Administration, CNN, Center for Disease Control and Preventionhttp://www.floridahealth.gov/diseases-and-conditions/vibrio-infections/vibrio-vulnificus/index.html?utm_source=articlehttp://www.fda.gov/Food/ResourcesForYou/HealthEducators/ucm085365.htmhttp://edition.cnn.com/2014/08/07/health/vibrio-vulnificus-bacteria/http://www.cdc.gov/vibrio/vibriov.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,deadly bacteria,florida beaches,raw oysters,vibrio vulnificus,bacteria,florida waters,oysters,tomonews,bacteria water,bacteria oysters,bacteria that can kill

item.title: Philae comet lander wakes up after seven months
item.description: The Philae comet lander that lost contact with Earth after landing on a comet late last year has woken up and is now communicating with Earth.The Philae probe landed on comet 67P in mid November 2014, but ran out of power shortly afterwards because its solar panels could not pick up enough sunlight after it landed in the shadow of a cliff, according to the Telegraph.As 67P approaches the Sun, Philae’s solar panels have been able to absorb enough sunlight to communicate with the Rosetta probe that is in orbit around the comet. A signal from Philae was picked up on Saturday night and continued for 85 seconds, the Telegraph reported.“It's been a long seven months, and to be quite honest we weren't sure it would happen - there are a lot of very happy people around Europe at the moment,” the Telegraph quoted European Space Agency scientist Mark McCaughrean as saying.The mission was due to end in September but the European Space Agency said it would likely run to 2016, the Telegraph reported.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Location of the comet when Philae lost power in Nov 20142. Location of the comet when Philae makes contact in June 20153. Philae sending signals to Rosetta for 85 seconds4. Illustration of the comet and how it will be nearest to the Sun in August5. The comet throws out dust and gas as it approaches the SunVOICEOVER (in English): “The Philae probe landed on comet 67P in mid November 2014, but ran out of power shortly afterwards as its solar panels could not pick up enough sunlight as it landed in the shadow of a cliff.”“As the comet 67P approaches the Sun, Philae’s solar panels were able absorb enough sunlight to restart communications with the Rosetta probe that has been orbiting the comet.” “A signal from Philae was picked up on Saturday night and it continued for 85 seconds.”“Comet 67P is currently 205 million km from the Sun. It will be at the nearest point to the Sun in August.”“The comet is expected to become more active and could interfere with Philae’s communication with Rosetta as it approaches the Sun.”SOURCES: The Telegraph, European Space Agencyhttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/science/space/11673849/Philae-Europes-comet-lander-wakes-up.htmlhttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/science/space/11195744/The-Rosetta-mission-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-quest-to-catch-a-comet.htmlhttp://www.esa.int/Our_Activities/Operations/Rosetta_operations***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Philae,lander,Rosetta,probe,Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko,spacecraft,comet,solar system,European Space Agency

item.title: U.S. plans to store heavy arms in Baltic, Eastern Europe
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe U.S. in planning to store military equipment in eastern Europe to build up the region’s defense capabilities. If the Pentagon’s proposal is approved, it will be the first time Washington has stationed heavy weaponry in countries once under Russia’s sphere of influence.No final decision has yet been made, but the Pentagon plans to store equipment in Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania, as well as in Poland, Hungary, Romania and Bulgaria. If the proposal is approved, enough equipment for 150 soldiers will be stored in each of the Baltic states and enough for 750 soldiers will be stored in the four other eastern European ones. The Pentagon estimates that it will store about 1,200 armored vehicles in the region, including M1-A2 tanks, Bradley fighting vehicles and armored howitzers.The Pentagon also plans to build railways and warehouses to accommodate the new, American weaponry in the NATO member states. The warehouses will be guarded by local contractors, rather than American military personnel.The U.S. and NATO member states have been taking steps to strengthen defense forces in the region following Russia’s annexation of Crimea and the ongoing war in eastern Ukraine.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Barrier between NATO and Russia2. Pentagon upgrading railways and warehouses in eastern Europe3. Warehouses guarded by security contractors4. Pentagon will store equipment including 1,200 armored vehicles5. Amount of equipment U.S. plans to store in eastern EuropeVOICEOVER (in English): “The U.S. plans to store heavy weaponry to reassure Baltic and Eastern European allies concerned by Russia’s intervention in Ukraine.” “The Pentagon plans to build railways and warehouses to accommodate new, American weaponry in the member states.”“The weapons warehouses will be guarded by local contractors, rather than American military personnel.”“Washington plans to store about 1,200 armored vehicles, including M1-A2 tanks, Bradley fighting vehicles and armored howitzers.” “Equipment will be stored in Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania, as well as in Poland, Hungary, Romania and Bulgaria. The equipment will be enough for 150 soldiers in each of the Baltic states and 750 soldiers in the four other states.”SOURCES: Reuters, The New York Times, RThttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/06/14/us-usa-military-europe-idUSKBN0OT0TR20150614http://www.nytimes.com/2015/06/14/world/europe/us-poised-to-put-heavy-weaponry-in-east-europe.htmlhttp://rt.com/news/267106-us-poland-weapons-deployment/http://rt.com/news/267031-us-heavy-weapons-baltics/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: High-tech smart bikini designed to prevent sunburns
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA French company has unveiled a bikini with a special sensor that they say warns users if they’ve spent too much time in the sun.The Connected Bikini requires wearers to input information about their skin type. The sensor will then monitor the user's interaction with the sun and send an alert to their phone when it thinks they have been out for too long and need to reapply sunscreen.The bikini costs around $167 and can be custom made.The waterproof sensor is removable and wearers will be able to download an app to enter pertinent background information regarding their skin. A ‘Valentine’s Day' version sends a message to partners who can apply the sunscreen on the wearer’s behalf and a beach towel offering the same function is also available. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Woman sunbathing2. Smart bikini sensors 3. Sensors detecting UV rays4. User enters skin type data5. Sensor calculates information6. User receives alert from sensorVOICEOVER (in English): French design firm Spinali Design this week began selling a new age suit that helps prevent sunburns.The device, dubbed the Connected Bikini, is equipped with a removable waterproof UV sensorthat monitors the time a user spends in the sun. To get started, users first input their skin type into an associated app, available for iOS and Android.Throughout the day, the sensor monitors the temperature...warning users when they’ve spent too much time under direct sunlight by sending an alert to their smartphones.SOURCES: The Local Frhttp://www.thelocal.fr/20150611/french-start-up-invents-smart-bikini***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
