item.title: Is this the largest great white shark ever filmed?
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.tw A shark expert posted a video to his Facebook page that shows him exiting his shark cage to give an enormous great white shark a high five. Mauricio Hoyos Padilla, who works at environmental conservation organization Pelagios Kakunja, shared the video on Tuesday. The video has since been removed from his page, but it has received more than 3 million views. The Discovery Channel featured the great white shark during its 2014 Shark Week program. In the Discovery Channel’s video, the team refers to the female shark as Deep Blue. The shark is at least 20 feet long, which is about the limit for a full-grown female, according to National Geographic. Deep Blue was pregnant at the time of filming, the Discovery team said, and “likely to be hungry.” Deep Blue has scars on her left side, which may have come from fights with other sharks or mating, according to Discovery. Discovery found Deep Blue off the coast of Guadalupe Island in Mexico. Padilla, who hails from Mexico City and lives in La Paz, said it was the first time he had seen the shark. The team estimated the shark to be about 50 years old. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Shark approaching diver’s cage 2. Line measuring length of shark’s body 3. Shark placed vertically next to average-sized shark and diver, showing scale 4. Map showing where Discovery team spotted the shark5. Shark swimming under the team’s boat 6. Team member tagging shark with tag gun VOICEOVERA video that’s making the rounds online shows what might be the largest shark ever filmed under water. The great white shark, named Deep Blue, is an estimated 20 feet long. The average Great white measures roughly 14 feet still more than twice the Adiver’s height. Deep Blue was first spotted off the coast of Mexico’s Guadalupe island during Discovery’s 2014 Shark Week filming. the team managed to tag Deep Blue, whom they estimate to be about 50 years old. SOURCES: Discovery, GrindTV, The Guardian http://www.discovery.com/tv-shows/shark-week/shark-feed/learn-more-about-deep-blue-one-of-the-biggest-great-white-sharks-ever-filmed/http://www.grindtv.com/wildlife/largest-great-white-shark-ever-videotaped-underwater/#Lo5Ws8eid6D7SSIi.97http://www.theguardian.com/environment/video/2015/jun/11/giant-great-white-shark-diving-cage-guadeloupe-video***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,great white,shark,diver,viral video,cage,high five,Mexico,Discovery,Mauricio Hoyo Padilla

item.title: Cyberattack targeted Iran nuclear talks venues: Kaspersky Lab
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twKaspersky Lab say they have uncovered a sophisticated malware infection in venues that hosted high-level discussions surrounding Iran’s nuclear programme.Duqu 2.0, an advanced espionage virus with links to Israel, is thought to have been used in a cyberattack on hotels where the P5+1 talks took place in Europe. Kaspersky Lab explained that the malware exploits zero-day vulnerabilities. These attacks occur the same day a software weakness is discovered and before its creators can make a fix available via an update.The malware modifies system rules, allowing it to spread within a network through files commonly used to install software on remote computers. Additionally, the malware doesn’t change any disk files or system settings, making it difficult to trace.According to the Wall Street Journal, the malware contained modules designed to control infected computers and compress video feeds, possibly from surveillance cameras. Additionally, the malware targets communication networks, including Wi-Fi and phones, allowing hackers to listen in on connected users and steal sensitive information.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Hacker targeting hotel2. Explanation of zero-day vulnerabilities3. Malware spreading throughout a network4. Detectability of malware 5. Capabilities of malware 6. Hacker stealing files and listening in on phone conversationsVOICEOVER (in English): “An advanced spy malware with links to Israel is thought to have been used in a cyberattack on hotels hosting the P5+1 talks in Europe.” “Kaspersky Lab says the malware exploits zero-day vulnerabilities. These attacks happen the same day a software weakness is discovered and before its creators can make a fix.”“Once inside, the malware modifies system rules, allowing it to spread within a network through files commonly used to install software on remote computers.”“Dubbed Duqu 2.0, the malware doesn’t change any preferences or system settings, making it difficult to trace.”“According to the Wall Street Journal, the malware contained modules designed to control infected computers and compress video feeds, possibly from surveillance cameras.”“As well as this, it targets communication networks, including Wi-Fi and phones, allowing hackers to listen in on connected users and steal sensitive information.”SOURCES: Wall Street Journal, Kaspersky, Guardianhttp://www.wsj.com/articles/spy-virus-linked-to-israel-targeted-hotels-used-for-iran-nuclear-talks-1433937601http://www.kaspersky.com/about/news/virus/2015/Duqu-is-backhttp://www.theguardian.com/technology/2015/jun/11/duqu-20-computer-virus-with-traces-of-israeli-code-was-used-to-hack-iran-talks***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: US EPA moves toward regulating aircraft emissions
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe U.S. Environmental Protection Agency issued a draft scientific finding on Wednesday on how aircraft emissions contribute to climate change. The findings serve as the foundation for the EPA’s proposal to begin regulating aircraft emissions.The EPA’s findings, the so-called “endangerment finding,” is a precursor to the EPA’s proposal to curb emissions from commercial aircraft. The EPA plans to partner with the United Nations’ International Civil Aviation Organization and develop worldwide carbon dioxide standards for planes. The United Nations is scheduled to release its proposed emissions standards by February 2016. Commercial aircraft contribute 11 percent of emissions in the U.S. transportation sector, and make up three percent of total U.S. emissions. While car emissions are already regulated in the U.S., and power plant emissions will be soon come under the Clean Power Plan, the airline industry still goes largely unchecked.The UN and the EPA’s carbon dioxide standards are expected to apply only to new aircraft designs certified from 2020 onwards, leaving the majority of the world’s aircraft unregulated. The EPA also excluded military aircraft or small planes such as turboprops from its proposal.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. The EPA regulates car and power plant emissions but not plane emissions2. EPA starting to regulate plane emissions3. Aircraft contribution to total U.S. emissions4. Plan will not include regulating military planes and small planesVOICEOVER (in English): “Car emissions are already regulated in the U.S., and power plant emissions will soon come under the Clean Power Plan, but the airline industry remains largely unchecked.”“The EPA aims to change this by partnering with the United Nations’ International Civil Aviation Organization to develop carbon dioxide standards for planes.”“Commercial aircraft contribute 11 percent of emissions in the U.S. transportation sector, and makes up three percent of total U.S. emissions.”“The EPA has found that commercial aircraft contribute to climate change and seeks to regulate their emissions. However, the EPA has not mentioned the impact of military aircraft or small planes such as turboprops.”SOURCES: The Washington Post, CNN, The Wall Street Journal, USA Todayhttp://www.washingtonpost.com/news/energy-environment/wp/2015/06/10/epa-moves-toward-limits-on-emissions-from-u-s-airlines/http://edition.cnn.com/2015/06/10/politics/epa-regulating-airplane-emissions/http://www.wsj.com/articles/obama-administration-to-take-aim-at-airline-emissions-1433946834http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2015/06/10/epa-airlines-greenhouse-gas-emissions-a4a-iata-icao/28487755/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,EPA,Environmental Protection Agency,aircraft emissions,climate change,EPA regulations,aircraft regulation,airline industry

item.title: Australian man rare blood type saves 2 million babies
item.description: For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twAustralian man James Harrison is known as ‘The Man with the Golden Arm’ after his blood was used to develop an injection that has since saved the lives of an estimated two million babies from rhesus disease.Harrison, now aged 78, is from Australia’s central coast. He has been donating his blood plasma on a weekly basis for the past 60 years, CNN reported.“In 1951, I had a chest operation where they removed a lung and I was 14. When I came out of the operation, or a couple days after, my father was explaining what had happened. He said I had (received) 13 units (liters) of blood and my life had been saved by unknown people. He was a donor himself, so I said when I’m old enough, I’ll become a blood donor,” CNN quoted Harrison as saying.Harrison has an unusual antibody in his blood, which was used to develop an injection called Anti-D, a medicine used to prevent rhesus disease. Rhesus disease is caused by an incompatibility that happens when a pregnant woman has rhesus-negative blood and the baby in her womb has rhesus-positive blood. The mother’s body produces antibodies that destroy the baby’s red blood cells during pregnancy. This process is known as sensitization.The injection prevents women with rhesus-negative blood from developing antibodies to attack the baby’s red blood cells during pregnancy.“His blood is actually used to make a life-saving medication, given to moms whose blood is at risk of attacking their unborn babies. Every batch of Anti-D that has ever been made in Australia has come from James’ blood,” Jemma Falkenmire of the Australian Red Cross Blood Service told CNN.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Pregnant woman with rhesus-negative blood and the baby has rhesus-positive blood2. The woman produces antibodies to attack the baby’s red blood cells3. An unusual antibody found in James Harrison’s blood4. Illustration of the antibody is used to develop an injection5. The woman stops producing antibodies after receiving the injectionVOICEOVER (in English): “Rhesus disease is caused by an incompatibility that occurs when a pregnant woman has rhesus-negative blood and the baby in her womb has rhesus-positive blood.”“When this occurs, the mother’s body produces antibodies to destroy the baby’s red blood cells during pregnancy. This process is known as sensitization.”“Australian James Harrison was found to have an unusual antibody in his blood, which was then used to develop an injection called Anti-D.”“The injection prevents women with rhesus-negative blood from developing antibodies to attack the baby’s red blood cells during pregnancy.”SOURCES: Fox 13, Parents.comhttp://fox13now.com/2015/06/09/man-with-the-golden-arm-has-saved-lives-of-2-million-babies/http://www.parents.com/pregnancy/stages/1st-trimester-tests/rh-disease/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Anti-D,rhesus disease,James Harrison,man with the golden arm,medicine,blood donation,Australia

item.title: Home batteries from Tesla and Mercedes-Benz help spread distributed power generation
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twNew large-capacity batteries for home use from companies such as Tesla and Mercedes-Benz are increasing the viability of renewable energy for distributed generation. Solar energy is gaining popularity, with several U.S. states providing large subsidies to homeowners who install solar panels, but so far integrating it into the power grid has been a problem. Most energy still comes from centralized power plants, with home-generated solar energy being used or sold to the grid as it is produced. No solar energy is produced at night. During the hot summer months, power utilities produce more energy and charge more during peak hours in the middle of the day. Other than fuel, the utilities’ main expenses are from maintaining the grid itself.With a home battery, homes with solar panels can save their own power during the day, and homes without solar panels can store cheap power from off-peak hours at night. Unused energy stored in the batteries can be sold back to the grid during peak hours. If home renewable energy generation and home battery storage became widespread, power plants could reduce their excess generation capacity. Power utilities would primarily be in the business of maintaining the grid, and the flow of energy from utility to customer would no longer be a one-way street. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Home solar only working during daylight 2. Power plant burning coal at peak time3. Houses use peak power for air conditioning in summer4. Utilities responsible for maintaining grid5. Home batteries can store solar power or cheap off-peak power6. Battery houses can use stored energy at peak time7. Solar and battery equipped homes sell power back to grid at peak8. When batteries and solar panels are ubiquitous, power plant burns less coal9. Utility still responsible for maintaining grid10. Less coal required, energy market now a two way streetVOICEOVER (in English): “Solar energy is increasing in popularity, but so far integrating it into the power grid has been a problem. Most energy comes from power plants, with home-generated solar energy being used or sold to the grid as it is produced, and none is produced at night.” “Power utilities burn fuel to produce electricity. They produce more and charge more during peak hours in the middle of the day. Other than fuel, their main expenses are from maintaining the grid itself.” “Now, large home batteries are being marketed for homes with renewable generation, to save their own power, and to regular homes, so they can store cheap power from off-peak hours. Excess capacity can even be sold back to the grid during peak hours.” “With ubiquitous home renewable energy generation, and home battery storage, power plants can reduce their excess generation capacity. Power utilities will primarily be in the business of maintaining the grid. The flow of energy will no longer be a one-way street.” SOURCES: Bloomberg, Engadget, Power-eng.com,http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-06-08/elon-musk-says-utilities-shouldn-t-fear-his-battery-systemshttp://www.engadget.com/2015/06/09/mercedes-benz-home-battery/http://www.power-eng.com/blogs/power-points/2015/01/the_debate_over_dist.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Tesla motors,Powerwall,Lithium-ion,li-on battery,power utility,how to save energy,solar power,cheap electricity,power bill,Con Edison

item.title: Britain approves world’s first tidal lagoon power project
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twBritain has given the go ahead for a 1 billion pound tidal power plant in Wales' Swansea Bay, the Department of Energy and Climate Change said on Tuesday. The project, developed by Tidal Lagoon Power, is expected to generate enough electricity to power around 155,000 homes. The project will create a 750-meter-long lagoon-shaped seawall in Swansea Bay and use the difference in water levels between the sea and the water inside the lagoon. Up to 26 low-head bulb turbines will be installed inside concrete turbine housings that are permanently submerged. Each turbine is equipped with sluice gates that will remain closed until the water level on either side is high enough to pass through and generate electricity. Hence, the process can be operated on flood tides as well as ebb tides. Developers say that this is the first step towards producing 10 percent of UK’s energy from tides. According to Bloomberg Business, Tidal Lagoon Power has started planning a second project: a second tidal power plant that can generate enough electricity for every home in Wales. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Top view of the lagoon in Swansea Bay2. Illustrating the construction of the lagoon wall3. Illustrating the capacity of the turbine housings4. Illustrating the process of generating power on the flood tide5. Illustrating the process of generating power on the ebb tideVOICEOVER (in English):“The project will create a 750-meter-long lagoon-shaped seawall in Swansea Bay.”“The wall will be made from hydraulically filled geotextile tubes and compact sand fill. Layers of rocks will be added on top to protect the wall from degradation.”“Concrete turbine housings will hold up to 26 low-head bulb turbines that are permanently submerged. Each turbine can generate up to 16 megawatts per hour.”“The turbines’ sluice gates will be closed until the water level outside the lagoon is high enough. It will then open to let the water flows into the lagoon through the turbines to generating electricity.”“This process then occurs in reverse on the ebb tide.” SOURCES: IEEE Spectrum, Wales Online, This is South Wales, Reuters, Sky News, Bloomberg Businesshttp://spectrum.ieee.org/green-tech/geothermal-and-tidal/tidal-power-makes-a-surprising-comebackhttp://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/business/business-news/tidal-lagoon-power-signed-mou-4035952http://www.thisissouthwales.co.uk/Swansea-Bay-tidal-lagoon-report-works-access/story-19307111-detail/story.html#axzz2WlX2gq2yhttp://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/06/09/uk-britain-wavepower-lagoon-idUKKBN0OP1VW20150609http://news.sky.com/story/1499090/uk-to-get-underwater-power-stationhttp://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-06-09/u-k-tidal-lagoon-project-in-swansea-wins-planning-permission***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,UK tidal lagoon project,Britain,Wales,tidal power plant,tidal power,UK tidal power

item.title: Malaysia to lodge protest over Chinese coast guard “intrusion”
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA Chinese coast guard vessel spotted anchored 93 miles north of Malaysia is causing diplomatic tension between the two pacific nations.Malaysia’s national security minister Shahid Kassim said the country would protest what it called an intrusion by the Chinese ship.The Malaysian government said the Chinese ship was spotted anchored near Luconia Shoals, a series of islets within an exclusive economic zone claimed by Malaysia.Hong Lei, a spokesman for China’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs, said he did “not have knowledge” of the case and declined to offer further comment.Last year China conducted naval exercises near the James Shoal reef, also claimed by Malaysia, prompting the country to change tact in dealings Beijing, senior diplomats told Reuters.China in recent years has caused regional tensions with its claims to virtually all of the South China Sea that cover approximately 1.35 million square miles of the area.Vietnam, the Philippines, Taiwan and Brunei all also have competing claims to various areas of the South China Sea.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Malaysia and China2. Chinese vessel at Luconia Shoal3. South China Sea claims by Malaysia and China4. Chinese naval exercises at the James Shoal reef5. South China Sea claims by Vietnam, Philippines and BruneiVOICEOVER (in English): Malaysia’s national security minister said the country would protest what it called an intrusion by a Chinese coast guard ship close to Borneo.Malaysia said the Chinese ship was spotted anchored near Luconia Shoals, a series of islets within an exclusive economic zone claimed by Malaysia.China in recent years has caused regional tensions with its claims over virtually all of the South China Sea.Last year China conducted naval exercises near the James Shoal reef, also claimed by Malaysia, prompting the country to change tact in dealings Beijing, senior diplomats told Reuters.Vietnam, the Philippines and Brunei all also have competing claims to various parts of the South China Sea.SOURCES: Reuters, Wall Street Journalhttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/06/09/us-southchinasea-malaysia-china-idUSKBN0OP06120150609http://www.wsj.com/articles/malaysia-toughens-stance-with-beijing-over-south-china-sea-1433764608***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Drone that can fly forever patented by Boeing
item.description: For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twBoeing obtained a patent for a drone and related charging system on June 2 that would allow the aircraft to remain aloft indefinitely. Titled “Autonomous aircraft with disconnectable tether,” Boeing’s patent describes a lighter-than-air craft that connects to charging towers. The design would reduce the system’s footprint from the long airstrip required by fixed wing drones down to the area of a charging tower, which could be situated in populated areas the way communications towers are.Boeing’s patent describes a buoyant aircraft that can navigate to a ground-based power supply, then lower a tether that latches onto the power supply. The craft’s control system can then order the tether to disengage after charging is complete. The power supply end of the system could be attached to a land-based tower, a high-altitude tethered balloon, a ship at sea or a terrestrial vehicle. The drone would lower its own tether down to the power supply, similar to the probe-and-drogue system used by planes for air-to-air refueling. Drones using this charging technology could find applications in parcel delivery, surveillance or other tasks where landing frequently would be impractical. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Balloon drone flying over city2. Balloon drone connecting to charging tower3. Balloon drone battery charging complete4. Cityscape with balloon drones charging and flying5. Balloon drone charging from Navy ship or public bus6. Balloon drone charging from a tethered balloon in the sky7. Balloon drone delivering a package without landing8. Winged drone taking off and landing at same airport9. Helicopter drone unable to travel same distance on one charge10. Winged drone unable to monitor ocean area for long, balloon drone monitors continuously11. Balloon drone dispatched from office roof with a package12. Balloon drone arriving at private home to deliver packageVOICEOVER (in English): “Boeing has obtained a patent for a type of drone that could potentially fly forever. The patent describes a lighter than air craft, which charges via tether while remaining aloft.” “When the drone receives a signal, it detaches from the charging tether and changes location. The drones could also be charged via a ship, a moving land vehicle, or a high-altitude balloon.” “The system address two drawbacks of traditional drones. Fixed-wing drones require a runway to take off and must return to base to recharge. Vertical-takeoff drones have limited range and cumbersome landing gear.” “The floating drones could provide persistent monitoring of an area or rapid delivery service without needing to land.” SOURCES: Geekwire, U.S. Patent Office,http://www.geekwire.com/2015/new-patent-shows-how-boeing-plans-to-recharge-drones-in-mid-air/http://patft.uspto.gov/netacgi/nph-Parser?Sect1=PTO1&Sect2=HITOFF&d=PALL&p=1&u=%2Fnetahtml%2FPTO%2Fsrchnum.htm&r=1&f=G&l=50&s1=9045218.PN.&OS=PN/9045218&RS=PN/9045218***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Boeing,Eye in the sky,patent,drone,drone program,drone spy,drone safety,FBI drone,CIA drone,drone law

item.title: Israel tests ‘dirty bombs’ in the Negev Desert
item.description: Israel carried out a four-year series of tests on nuclear explosives to measure the effects were “hostile forces” ever to use them against Israel, Israel’s Haaretz daily newspaper reported Monday.Between 2010 and 2014, Israel conducted tests on “dirty bombs” in the Negev Desert. The project, supervised by staff from Israel’s Dimona nuclear facility, included 20 detonations mostly in the desert and involved between 250 grams and 25 kilograms of explosives. “Dirty bombs” combine radioactive material with conventional explosives such as dynamite and are usually detonated using a battery. After the explosives were detonated, mini-drones were used to measure the radiation levels of the explosions. The tests found high-level radiation near the center of the blasts, while low-level particles further from the blast center weren’t found to pose any danger.Israel began conducting drills on how to respond to a radioactive attack after Al-Qaeda started threatening to use ‘dirty bombs’ on the U.S. following the 9/11 attacks. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Components of a dirty bomb2. Employees from an Israeli nuclear reactor testing the bombs3. Tests are conducted in the Negev Desert4. Drones calculating radiation levels after the explosions5. Another type of test conducted VOICEOVER (in English): “Israel conducted several tests on ‘dirty bombs,’ which combine radioactive material with conventional explosives such as dynamite.”“Most of the tests were conducted in the Negev Desert, and were supervised by staff from Israel’s Dimona nuclear facility.”“After the explosives were detonated, mini-drones were used to measure radiation levels near the site of the explosions.”“It found high-level radiation at the center of the blasts, while lower level radiation carried by the wind was found not to pose a significant danger.”“In order to measure the impact of a radioactive substance being released in a crowded space, researchers also put radioactive material into the ventilation system of a simulated shopping mall. However, the building’s air conditioning filters caught most of the radiation.”SOURCES: Haaretz, Sputnik International, United States Nuclear Regulatory Commission, RThttp://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.660067http://sputniknews.com/middleeast/20150608/1023085033.htmlhttp://www.nrc.gov/reading-rm/doc-collections/fact-sheets/fs-dirty-bombs.htmlhttp://rt.com/news/265831-israel-tests-dirty-bomb/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Israel nuclear testing,dirty bombs,testing dirty bombs,testing nuclear weapons,Negev Desert,nuclear warfare,Israel nuclear weapons

item.title: Multiple toxic air claims lodged against British airlines companies
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twSeventeen former and current flight crew are planning to sue British airlines for contaminated cabin air, the BBC reports. Workers believe they all fell ill after breathing in fumes that was mixed with engine oil and other toxic chemicals in the air circulating through aircraft.The cases are funded by the Unite union, which represents 20,000 flight staff.However, the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) says incidents of smoke or fumes on planes are rare and there is no evidence of there being a high enough concentration of contaminants to cause health problems or even long-term health effects.The Unite union is calling for a public inquiry into contaminated cabin air, according to the BBC. The union has even opened a dedicated legal unit to record and process claims from its membership.Uncensored safety reports submitted to the CAA, and obtained by the Victoria Derbyshire programme, show that between April 2014 and May 2015 there were 251 separate incidents of fumes or smoke inside a large passenger jet operated by a British airline.A version released by the BBC does not include cases which could be blamed on an internal fault, such as a broken toilet or air conditioning system. The statistics also do not include incidents on international airlines, even when planes are travelling through British airspace.The BBC reports that around around half the air on board most modern commercial jets is pumped into the aircraft through the engines. Those who claim cabin air toxic say when there is a problem with the engine seals, a mix of potentially poisonous gases can reach the cabin. Among these toxic gasses includes TCP, an organophosphate known to be dangerous to human health if there are high enough quantities in the air.Some cabin crew believe it is exposure to such toxins that over a long period of time that has damaged their long-term health. The problems also reportedly affect the central nervous system and brain.However, the CAA insists there is no evidence to support the claim that there are chemicals at high enough concentrations to cause bodily harm. Meanwhile, in 2013, an independent group of scientists the Committee on Toxicity could not establish a link between contaminated cabin air and ill health. Instead, the committee reported that an explanation for crew falling ill could be the "nocebo" effect, which is a psychological condition where exposure to even a harmless substance can lead to nausea, fatigue and other medical symptoms.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Inner workings of plane engine2. How air is circulated through cabin3. Cabin contaminated with poisonous gasses4. Effect of TCP gas on human bodyVOICEOVER (in English): “According to a BBC report, around half the air on board most modern commercial jets is drawn through the engines and circulated through the aircraft.”“Those who claim there is toxic air on board planes say potentially poisonous gases can reach the cabin through leaks in the engine, including TCP, an organophosphate.”“This gas can be dangerous to human health in high enough quantities.”SOURCES: BCC, The Independenthttp://www.bbc.com/news/business-33008356http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/british-airlines-to-be-sued-because-planes-contain-toxic-air-10304369.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,toxic air,poisoning,airlines,UK,British,aerotoxic fumes,TCP,nma,next media animation,Taiwanese animators

item.title: Chinese doctor transplants mice heads, plans trials with monkeys
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA Chinese doctor who has performed hundreds of head transplants on mice says he plans to perform the procedure on monkeys.Ren Xiaoping, who left a position at the University of Cincinnati to continue his research in China, first transplanted the head of a mouse on to the body of another in 2013. According to a report in the Wall Street Journal, he has performed about 1,000 such procedures since then. Ren uses a diamond-bladed knife to create a cut that cleanly separates the recipient’s head from its body. Next, the donor animal’s head is separated at the midbrain to preserve the brainstem so that the heart continues to beat and lungs continue to breathe. Blood vessels are then connected using silicone tubes so that oxygen-rich blood from the donor body can reach the recipient’s head as quickly as possible, after which spinal cord nerves from the recipient’s head and the donor body are fused together using polyethylene glycol, or PEG.The recipient head is then affixed to the donor body with pins, wires and screws before the silicon tubes are removed and blood vessels muscles and skin are joined using tiny stitches. The mice have lived for as long as a day, a record Ren is hoping to improve on. According to a report in the Wall Street Journal, Ren hopes to to transplant the head of a monkey in 2015.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. A mouse is shown having its head severed in preparation for transplant2. The donor mouse’s head is shown being severed at the midbrain area3. Blood vessels are shown being connected with silicone tubes4. Spinal cord nerves from the two animals are fused using polyethylene glycol5. The head and body of the two mice are shown being connected6. Tiny stitches complete the connection between donor and recipient mouseVOICEOVER (in English): “Chinese doctor Ren Xiaoping transplants the heads of mice by using a diamond-bladed knife to create a clean cut that separates the recipient mice’s head from its body.” “Next, the donor animal’s head is separated at the midbrain in order to preserve the brainstem, so that the heart and lungs continue to function.” “Blood vessels are then connected using silicone tubes so that oxygen-rich blood from the donor body can reach the recipient head as quickly as possible.” “Spinal cord nerves from the recipient’s head and the donor body are then fused together using polyethylene glycol or PEG.”“The recipient head is affixed to the donor body with pins, wires and screws before the silicon tubes are removed.” “The blood vessels, muscles and skin are then joined using tiny stitches. The mice have lived for as long as a day, a record Dr. Ren is hoping to improve on.” SOURCES: The Wall Street Journal http://www.wsj.com/articles/surgerys-far-frontier-head-transplants-1433525830***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,head transplants,organ transplants,Chinese doctor mice head transplants,mice head transplants,Dr. Ren Xiaoping China Harbin mice head,TomoNews,Dr. Xiaoping Ren China mouse head

item.title: Peruvian doctors remove worm from boy’s eye
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twDoctors in Peru successfully used basil leaves to lure a worm from a teenage boy’s eye.Seventeen-year-old Peruvian boy Jamie suffered an eye infection reportedly after being bitten by a human botfly, which drops its eggs when it lands on skin, International Business Times reported.Jamie’s left eye was extremely swollen for several weeks. After performing an MRI scan at the National Children’s Hospital in Lima, doctors found out that a three-centimetre long larva was taking residence inside his eye, according to International Business Times.“The location of the worm from the lower lid, which was getting bigger, made the risks increase because the youth's tissue was swelling in an area close to the sinuses that's close to the delicate part which is the triangle of death,” International Business Times quoted ophthalmologist Carolina Marchena as saying.Doctors tried to remove it by luring it out with a piece of basil leaf before removing the rest using tweezers. Jamie is expected to make a full recovery.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. A human botfly bites the boy and drops eggs on his skin2. The boy’s left eye is swollen for weeks3. MRI scan reveals a worm is in his eye4. The location of the worm is close to the danger triangle of the face5. Illustration of doctors lure the worm by basil and then remove it by tweezersVOICEOVER (in English): “Doctors in Peru successfully used basil leaves to lure a worm out of a teenage boy’s eye.”“A seventeen-year-old Peruvian boy suffered an eye infection reportedly after being bitten by a human botfly, which drops its eggs when it lands on the skin.”“Following the bite, his left eye was extremely swollen for several weeks.”“An MRI scan revealed the three-centimetre long larva taking residence inside his eye.”“The location of the worm was close to the part known as the ‘danger triangle’ of the face, meaning the infection could easily spread to the brain.” “Doctors first used a piece of basil leaf to lure the larva from its burrow before removing the rest of it using tweezers.”SOURCES: International Business Timeshttp://www.ibtimes.co.uk/peru-doctors-use-basil-coax-worm-out-boys-eye-after-month-long-stay-1504538***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: US woman begins a 6,000-mile voyage across the Pacific
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA US woman began a 6,000 mile voyage across the Pacific from Japan on Sunday in an attempt to become the first woman to cross the Pacific Ocean alone in a rowboat.US athlete Sonya Baumstein began her trip from Choshi in Japan on Sunday headed for San Francisco. She aims to finish the epic cross-Pacific journey by late September, Newser reported.Her gear and supplies include six oars, 900 dehydrated meals, 180 drink supplements, 60 liters of spare water and two desalination machines as well as 20 bags of clothing, according to the Expedition Pacific website.The boat is integrated with a system of devices that takes readings including seawater and temperature, as well as the boat’s GPS coordinates every 10 seconds. The information will be uploaded via satellite every hour throughout the journey, according to the website.Only two men have successfully crossed the Pacific Ocean in rowboats out of the 16 attempts in the past, Reuters reported.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Route of the expedition2. Details of Baumstein’s gear and supplies3. Baumstein rows 12 to 16 hours per day4. Illustration of the boat taking samples of seawater and temperature every 10 seconds5. Illustration of the data is sent to satellite every hourVOICEOVER (in English): “US athlete Sonya Baumstein began her trip from Choshi in Japan on Sunday headed for San Francisco. She aims to finish the epic 6,000 mile cross-Pacific journey by late September.”“Her gear and supplies include six oars, 900 dehydrated meals, 180 drink supplements, 60 liters of spare water and two desalinating machines as well as 20 bags of clothing.”“Baumstein will be rowing for 12 to 16 hours per day.”“The boat is integrated with a system of devices that sample the seawater and temperature, as well as charting the boat’s GPS coordinates every 10 seconds. The information will be uploaded via satellite every hour throughout the journey.”SOURCES: Reuters, Newser, Expedition Pacifichttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/06/07/us-usa-rowing-journey-idUSKBN0ON0YI20150607http://www.newser.com/story/207910/rower-begins-6k-mile-quest-to-cross-pacific.htmlhttp://expeditionpacific.com/discover/the-boat***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Vietnam eyeing western warplanes in response to Chinese assertiveness at sea
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twVietnam is in talks with European and U.S. contractors to buy fighter jets, maritime patrol planes and unarmed drones, sources said according to a Reuters report.Reuters says Vietnam is looking to improve its aerial defenses as China's continues ot assert its presence in disputed waters.Vietnam has already acquired three Russian-built Kilo-attack submarines and has three more on order as part of a $2.6 billion deal agreed in 2009.Reuters reports that previously discussions have involved Swedish defense contractor Saab European consortium Eurofighter, the defense wing of Airbus Group and U.S. firms Lockheed Martin Corpand Boeing, according to unnamed industry sources.One Western defense contractor told Reuters that Vietnam seeks to modernize its air force by replacing more than 100 Russian MiG-21 fighters. The nation has also ordered about a dozen more Russian Sukhoi Su-30 front-line fighters to add to its fleet of older Su-27s and Su-30s.U.S. Defense Secretary Ash Carter has promised Vietnam US$18 million to help the nation buy U.S. patrol boats. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Vietnam agreement with Russia in 20092. Vietnam seeks to replace aging planes, orders Sukhoi Su-30 fighters3. U.S. pledges US$18 million to help Vietnam buy patrol boatsVOICEOVER (in English): “As part of an agreement in 2009, Vietnam has already acquired three Russian-built Kilo-attack submarines as part of a US$2.6 billion deal. “Reuters reports one Western defense contractor said Hanoi wants to also modernize its air force by replacing more than 100 ageing Russian MiG-21 fighters. The nation has ordered about a dozen more Russian Sukhoi Su-30 front-line fighters as well.”“U.S. Defense Secretary Ash Carter has also pledged US$18 million to help Vietnam buy U.S. patrol boats.”SOURCES: Reuters, Business Insiderhttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/06/05/us-vietnam-airforce-exclusive-idUSKBN0OL04U20150605http://www.businessinsider.com/r-exclusive-vietnam-eyes-western-warplanes-patrol-aircraft-to-counter-china-2015-6***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Ocean cleaning technology to make 2016 debut near Japan
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA self-sustaining system designed to rid the world’s oceans of millions of tonnes of floating plastic garbage is set to make its debut next year off the coast of Japan.The Ocean Array Platform, brainchild of 20-year old Dutch inventor Boyan Slat, is designed to collect plastic trash that currently floats on or near the water’s surface.The one-mile wide array features two large booms on either side which use ocean currents to direct the plastic toward a central receptacle. The trash is then filtered into a large trash receptor on the back of the floating platform for recycling.With solar panels and water-generated turbines below the ocean surface, the platform is completely self sustaining.The array will be installed near the Japanese island of Tsushima in 2016 as part of a two-year long trial.Should the trial prove successful the project will be gradually expanded, with the ultimate aim to deploy a 62-mile-long array to capture around half of the trash in the Great Pacific Garbage Patch, a huge area of floating marine plastic and trash located between Hawaii and California.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Large amounts of garbage floating along a sandy beach shore2. Ocean Cleanup Array platform sitting in the water3. Aerial view of the platform shows the direction of an ocean current4. Trash moves into the side of the trash receptacle on either side of the platform5. Highlight solar panels and spinning turbines6. Garbage is sorted into a trash receptor on the back of the platformVOICEOVER (in English): “The Ocean Array Platform is designed to collect plastic trash that currently floats on or near the water’s surface.“The one-mile wide array features two large booms on either side which use ocean currents to direct the plastic toward a central receptacle. The trash is then filtered into a large trash receptor on the back of the floating platform for recycling.“With solar panels and water-generated turbines below the ocean surface, the platform is completely self sustaining.SOURCES: Al Jazeera US, New York Daily News, boyanslat.comhttp://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2015/5/29/first-ocean-cleanup-system-to-be-deployed.htmlhttp://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/plan-aims-rid-oceans-7-25m-tons-plastic-article-1.1299892www.boyanslat.com***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Great Pacific Garbage Patch,Ocean Array,microplastics,pollution clean up,Boyan Slat

item.title: Combination of cancer drugs can shrink tumor size by up to a third, research suggests
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twTwo immunotherapy drugs when used together can shrink cancerous tumours by up to a third in some patients, a new British trial suggests.Combining two cancer drugs, ipilimumab and nivolumab, shrank cancerous tumors by a third in 58 percent of cases in a 945-patient medical trial published in the New England Journal of Medicine.The immune system has brakes in place to stop it from attacking the body’s own tissue. Cancer uses these brakes to evade detection. The drugs used in the trial, ipilimumab and nivolumab, remove these brakes, helping the immune system deal with the cancer, according to the BBC.Response to the combined treatment varied among those patients trialled, with many reacting well, and others not seeing any benefit.Experts warned that combining the two treatments can cause severe side effects such as diarrhea and fatigue, as well as elevated liver enzymes and other symptoms.According to Bloomberg, the combined treatment would have an annual cost of more than $250,000 at current rates.It is hoped that the immunotherapies will lead to more effective cancer treatment in the future.The British-led trial was conducted by researchers from the Royal Marsden Hospital, London, South West Wales Cancer Institute and several other international institutions. The research was funded by Bristol-Myers Squibb, the company that manufactures the drugs being tested.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. T-cells destroying infected cells.2. Cancerous cell avoiding detection from t-cells.3. PD-L1 and PD-1 “secret handshake”4. Nivolumab disrupting "secret handshake"5. Ipilimumab and CTLA-4.6. T-cells destroying cancerous cell.VOICEOVER (in English): “The body’s immune system uses T-cells, or immune cells, to target and destroy infected cells.” “However, cancer cells produce a certain protein which allows them to avoid detection from T-cells.”“Known as PD-L1, this protein acts as what scientists have called a ‘secret handshake’ between it and its T-cell counterpart, PD-1, to avoid detection.”“Though if this ‘handshake’ can be disrupted, as the nivolumab drug does, the cancer cell becomes detectable to T-cells.”“The other drug, ipilimumab, stimulates T-cells to target cancer cells by blocking their ‘off switch’, known as CTLA-4.”“The combination of both drugs enabled the immune system’s T-cell to target and destroy cancerous cells.”SOURCES: BBC, Guardian, NHS, Bloomberg, Cancer Research UK, New England Journal of Medicine, http://www.bbc.com/news/health-32951892http://www.theguardian.com/science/2015/jun/01/immunotherapy-the-big-new-hope-for-cancer-treatmenthttp://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-05-31/cancer-drug-combination-is-potent-in-response-and-side-effectshttp://www.nhs.uk/news/2015/06June/Pages/Immunotherapy-drug-combo-could-combat-melanoma.aspxhttp://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-us/cancer-news/news-report/2015-06-01-immunotherapy-drugs-show-continued-promisehttp://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMoa1504030?query=featured_home#t=articleTop***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,immunotherapy cancer treatment,new research,drugs can reduce tumor size,tomonews,immunotherapy,nivolumab,ipilimumab,melanoma treatment,new england journal of medicine

item.title: Pentagon chief pledges $18 million for Hanoi to buy patrol boats
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twU.S. Defense Secretary Ash Carter pledged to expand the US’ military ties with Vietnam during a visit to Hai Phong on Sunday on the latest stop on his 11-day trip to Asia-Pacific.During Carter’s visit to Vietnam, he toured a Vietnamese coast guard vessel that was damaged after being rammed by a Chinese vessel during a skirmish between the two countries last year. After Carter’s visit, the Pentagon pledged $18 million to Hanoi to buy Vietnam six aluminium Metal Shark patrol vessels to help Vietnam build up its maritime defense capabilities.Taiwan, Vietnam and China have all reclaimed land in the South China Sea. However, China has outpaced other nations by reclaiming around 2,000 acres of land according to US estimates, raising concerns in the region.Vietnam has also been aggressive in its maritime claims in the disputed territories. In the Spratly Islands, Taiwan, Malaysia, China and the Philippines have all constructed military outposts, although Vietnam has the most, with 48 in total.The Pentagon has called on all countries in the region to halt their island-building efforts in disputed territories.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. China outpacing other countries in amount of land reclaimed2. Military buildup in the Spratly Islands3. Pentagon official touring Vietnamese coast guard vessel rammed by Chinese ship4. Vietnam receiving $18 million for six Metal Shark patrol vesselsVOICEOVER (in English): “Taiwan, Vietnam and China have all reclaimed land in the South China Sea. However, China has outpaced the others by reclaiming around 2,000 acres of land according to US estimates, raising concerns in the region.”“In the Spratly Islands, Taiwan, Malaysia, China and the Philippines have all constructed outposts, although Vietnam has the most, with 48 in total.”“U.S. Defense Secretary Ash Carter toured a Vietnamese coast guard vessel that was damaged after being rammed by a Chinese vessel during a skirmish last year.”“After Carter’s visit, the Pentagon pledged $18 million to Hanoi to buy Vietnam six aluminium Metal Shark patrol vessels, which can reach speeds of up to around 40 knots.”SOURCES: http://news.yahoo.com/pentagon-chief-pledges-18-million-hanoi-buy-patrol-142027920.htmlhttp://www.metalsharkboats.com/75-defiant/http://www.foreign.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/051315_Shear_Testimony.pdf***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Texas Senate votes to allow concealed carry of guns on campuses
item.description: For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe Texas Senate voted on Saturday to allow individuals with a concealed carry license, to bring handguns onto university campuses. Current Texas law prohibits guns in federal buildings, public sporting events, bars, and on school property. The 21 years of age requirement for a concealed carry permit, means many college students would be ineligible. The proposed bill would allow for college administrators to designate a “gun-free zone” on their campus.The bill will likely pass through the House of Representatives on Sunday before it’s signed into law by Texas Governor Greg Abbott. A related bill allowing for open carrying of handguns was passed by both the Texas Senate and the House. Abbott expressed his enthusiasm to sign the open-carry bill via Twitter. The governor is also expected to sign off on the campus concealed carry bill. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Bill passing through Senate2. Details of current Texas concealed carry law3. Student carrying a concealed weapon4. Campus president designating “no-gun zone”5. Bill goes to House of Representatives and Governor AbbottVOICEOVER: "The Texas Senate voted on Saturday to allow individuals with a concealed carry license, to bring handguns onto university campuses.""Current Texas law prohibits guns in federal buildings, public sporting events, bars, and on school property." "The 21 years of age requirement for a concealed carry permit, means many college students would be ineligible.""The proposed bill would allow for college administrators to designate a “gun-free zone” on their campus.""The bill will likely pass through the House of Representatives on Sunday before it’s signed into law by Texas Governor Greg Abbott."SOURCES: REUTERS, NRAhttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/05/31/us-usa-texas-guns-idUSKBN0OG00720150531https://www.nraila.org/gun-laws/state-gun-laws/texas/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: NASA starts testing new lander for 2016 mission to Mars
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twNASA is testing a new stationary lander called InSight for a planned mission to Mars in March 2016.The lander, which is equipped with two gallium arsenide solar array panels, will launch from Vandenberg Air Force Base in California and land on Mars about six months later.The InSight will not rove around Mars. Instead, it will act as a stationary driller, offering NASA for the first time in-depth analysis of Mars’ underground layers.Before the mission, InSight must pass tests to show it can endure extreme temperatures and near zero air pressure. Other tests include vibration testing meant to simulate launch conditions and checking for electronic interference between different parts of the spacecraft. According to NASA, examining Mars’ deep interior could reveal how all rocky planets, including Earth, have formed and evolved.The InSight is one of several missions NASA has planned as a prelude to the eventual goal of sending astronauts to the red planet by the 2030s.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. The InSight lander size2. The lander launch location3. The lander landing on Mars4. The lander drilling Mars soil 5. The lander tested for temperature and air pressure6. The lander tested for vibrations VOICEOVER (in English): “The lander, called InSight, is about the size of a car. It’s powered by two gallium arsenide solar array panels”“InSight will launch from Vandenberg Air Force Base in California and land on Mars abAout six months later.”“The InSight will not rove around Mars. It will stay in place as a stationary driller, offering NASA in-depth analysis of the planet’s underground layers.”“But before the mission, InSight must pass several test to show it can withstand extreme temperatures and near zero air pressure.” A vibration test simulates the vibrations during launch launch conditions SOURCES: NASA, UPIhttp://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/news.php?feature=4601http://www.upi.com/Science_News/2015/05/27/NASA-begins-testing-Mars-lander-InSight/7241432756148/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: IRS says hackers stole information of more than 100,000 taxpayers
item.description: For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twHackers gained access to more than 100,000 IRS accounts after compromising an online service on the Internal Revenue Service website. The IRS’ ‘Get Transcript’ application has been temporarily shut down after hackers accessed more than 100,000 IRS accounts between February and mid-May. The hackers used the IRS’ ‘Get Transcript’ application to retrieve individual filing histories.Hackers may have bought information about individual taxpayers, such as social security numbers and addresses, from other hackers in an online marketplace. They then used this information to clear the multi-step authentication process on the Internal Revenue Service website before gaining access to the ‘Get Transcript’ application.The hackers tried to hack into more than 200,000 IRS accounts and were successful in more than half of their attempts. The hackers have already claimed tax refunds for some of the accounts. The hackers may use the information to open bank accounts as well as steal tax refunds in the future.By downloading these transcripts, the hackers now have access to information that allows them to better masquerade as a legitimate taxpayer and file more fraudulent tax returns.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Hacker buying information from other hackers in an online marketplace2. Hacker using information to access IRS accounts3. Hacker gaining access to the IRS’ ‘Get Transcript’ application4. Information hacked is used to claim tax returns and open bank accounts5. Hacker attempts to hack 200,000+ IRS accounts and is able to hack half of them“The IRS’ ‘Get Transcript’ application has been temporarily shut down after hackers accessed more than 100,000 IRS accounts between February and mid-May.”“Hackers may have bought information about individual taxpayers, such as social security numbers, names, birthdates and addresses, from other hackers in an online marketplace...”“...and then used this information to clear the multi-step authentication process on the Internal Revenue Service website.”“Once inside an account, the hackers used the website’s ‘Get Transcript’ application to retrieve individual filing histories of tens of thousands of taxpayers.”“The hackers have already claimed fraudulent tax refunds. They could potentially open bank accounts and steal future tax refunds as well.”“The hackers tried to hack into more than 200,000 IRS accounts and were successful in about half of their attempts. SOURCES: USA Today, Ars Technica, CNN, The Washington Posthttp://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2015/05/26/irs-breach-100000-accounts-get-transcript/27980049/http://arstechnica.com/security/2015/05/report-irs-admits-its-been-hacked-tax-info-stolen-for-100000-plus/http://money.cnn.com/2015/05/26/pf/taxes/irs-website-data-hack/http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/federal-eye/wp/2015/05/26/hackers-stole-personal-information-from-104000-taxpayers-irs-says/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: China to build two lighthouses in the South China Sea
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twChina hosted a groundbreaking ceremony on Tuesday for the construction of two large lighthouses it says it is building to improve navigation safety in waters in the contested South China Sea. The two multifunctional lighthouses are planned for Cuarteron Reef and Johnson South Reef in the disputed Spratly Islands.Beijing has also recently said that it has the right to establish an Air Defense Identification Zone over the South China Sea.“This is a cause for concern because China acts like there’s an ADIZ although there has been no formal declaration,” Philippine Defense Secretary Voltaire Gazmin said in a televised press conference in Manilla reported by Bloomberg.According to the Straits Times, the Philippines has defied China’s warnings by declaring that it will continue to fly military and commercial planes over the disputed area.China has recently been challenging not only flights by the Philippines but also by the United States over disputed islands in the South China Sea. Last week, the Chinese navy warned an American P8-A Poseidon surveillance plane eight times to fly away from the area. Washington has expressed concerns that China may at some point declare an exclusion zone in that could limit free movement of both aircrafts and ships in the area.China’s lighthouse project, along with the recent warnings to the U.S. and Philippines, is likely escalate tensions in a region where China aggressively claims territory that is also claimed by the Philippines, Vietnam, Malaysia, Brunei and Taiwan.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Spratly islands in the South China Sea on map2. Two lighthouses on Spratly islands3. Possible Chinese air defense identification zone in the South China Sea4. Philippines planes flying over disputed territory5. China and other countries’ claims in the South China Sea VOICEOVER (in English): “China plans to build two multifunctional lighthouses on Cuarteron Reef and Johnson South Reef in the disputed Spratly Islands.”“China has also recently said that it has the right to establish an Air Defense Identification Zone over the South China Sea.”“The Philippines, defying China’s warnings, has declared that it will continue to fly military and commercial planes over the disputed area.” “China’s claims, which extend to most of the South China Sea, overlap with the claims of several other countries including the Philippines, Vietnam, Malaysia and Brunei.”SOURCES: REUTERS, STRAITS TIMES, BLOOMBERGhttp://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/05/26/uk-china-southchinasea-idUKKBN0OB0D120150526http://www.straitstimes.com/the-big-story/asia-report/china/story/philippines-keep-flying-planes-over-disputed-isles-20150526http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-05-08/china-reserves-right-to-declare-air-zone-over-south-china-sea***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: China warns US plane to turn away from South China Sea islands airspace
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twChina’s navy issued multiple demands to a U.S. surveillance aircraft on Wednesday to leave the airspace near islands in Southeast Asia’s most dangerous flashpoint.An American P-8A Poseidon was conducting a surveillance flight over facilities on reclaimed land that China is building in the contested South China Sea.In response, China’s navy issued eight warnings and told the aircraft’s pilots to turn away. At its lowest point, the Poseidon reached an altitude of 15,000 feet.Footage taken by the Poseidon shows construction activity on the islands and Chinese navy ships nearby. On Fiery Cross Reef, the footage shows that a military barracks, lookout tower and runway have already been built.The 3,000 metre-long runway could be fully operation by the end of the year and long enough for any aircraft in the Chinese military to take off from and land on.The U.S. is now considering moving aerial and surface missions closer to the islands. Until now, the U.S. has stayed outside the islands’ 12 nautical mile territorial zone.Some Analysts warned the U.S. actions might escalate tensions in the region. The US says China’s grab for territory risks setting a precedent in which larger countries are free to muscle in on and intimidate smaller ones.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. P-8A Poseidon approaching artificial islands2. A Chinese radio operator warning US aircraft pilot to leave3. The P-8A Poseidon altitude4. Construction works on the Chinese islands 5. Fiery Cross Reef island’s military barrack, lookout tower and runway6. The US aircraft Poseidon and warship approaching the islandsVOICEOVER: “A US P-8A Poseidon aircraft was conducting a surveillance flight over reclaimed-land islands China is building in the contested South China Sea.”“In response, China’s navy issued eight warnings and told the aircraft’s pilots to turn away.”“At its lowest point, the Poseidon reached an altitude of 15,000 feet.”“Footage taken by the Poseidon shows construction activities on the islands and Chinese navy ships nearby.”“On Fiery Cross Reef island, for instance, military barracks, a lookout tower and a runway have already been built.”“The U.S. is now considering pushing its aerial and surface missions closer to the islands. Until now, the U.S. has stayed outside the islands’ 12 nautical mile territorial zone.”SOURCES: CNN, THE GUARDIAN, REUTERS, http://edition.cnn.com/2015/05/20/politics/south-china-sea-navy-flight/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/may/21/china-warns-us-plane-to-leave-airspace-over-disputed-islandshttp://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/05/21/uk-southchinasea-usa-china-idUKKBN0O60B220150521***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Honeybee colony collapse tackled in new White House environmental strategy
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe Obama administration has unveiled a strategy intended to stop beehive colony collapse, after 40 percent of commercial honeybee colonies in the United States died off last winter.The White House’s plan, which was unveiled on Tuesday and is to be carried out by the USDA and EPA, includes devoting 7 million acres of federal land to pollinator habitat, reducing annual honeybee deaths to 15 percent by 2025 and returning monarch butterfly numbers from 30 million to 220 million in five years. The plan also calls for more studies of the class of pesticides known as neonicotinoids, also known as “neonics”. Research now indicates neonics may also weaken bees’ immune systems. Weaker bees are more easily killed by invasive varroa mites and poor nutrition stemming from monocultural farming practices in the U.S. Critics of the plan say it focuses too narrowly on commercial honeybees, only one of species 4,000 of bees in North America, and that there is no specific action plan to increase monarch butterfly numbers. Some insist neonic pesticides should be banned immediately, as they have been in the European Union. Neonic defenders point out that Australia uses the pesticides yet has avoided widespread colony collapse. Some suggest Australia’s immunity may be due to the absence of invasive varroa mites in the country. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Bee on watermelon flower2. Beekeeper checking hive3. 40 percent of honeybee hives lost4. Obama plan to devote 7 million acres to pollinators 5. Bar graph, reduce honeybee hive loss to 15 percent by 20256. Boost monarch butterfly population to 220 million in five years7. Neonicotinoids explained: caterpillar bites leaf, dies; bee lives8. Varroa mite infects bee hive9. Bees losing nutrition source to farms10. Criticism that Obama plan focuses only on honey bees11. Not enough focus or research on monarch butterflies12. Neonics combined with mites in the U.S. kill more bees than neonics alone in AustraliaVOICEOVER (in English): “On Tuesday, the Obama administration unveiled a strategy intended to stop beehive colony collapse in the United States. Bees pollinate much of the agricultural food we eat, but 40 percent of commercial honeybee colonies died off last winter, putting our food supply at risk.” “The White House’s plan, to be carried out by the USDA and EPA, includes devoting 7 million acres of federal land to pollinator habitat, reducing annual honeybee deaths to 15 percent by 2025, and returning monarch butterfly numbers from 30 million to 220 million in five years.” “The plan also calls for more studies of the class of pesticides known as neonicotinoids, which kill pests, but might also weaken bee immune systems. Weaker bees are more easily killed by invasive varroa mites, and poor nutrition from monocultural farming practices.” “Critics of the plan say it focuses too narrowly on commercial honeybees, out of 4,000 bee species in North America, and that there is no specific action plan to increase butterfly numbers.” “Finally, some insist neonic pesticides should be banned immediately, though Australia, which is free of varroa mites, uses neonics yet has avoided colony collapse.” SOURCES: Vox, Reuters, Washington Post, Office of Science and Technology Policyhttp://www.vox.com/2015/5/19/8625183/honeybees-obamahttp://blogs.reuters.com/great-debate/2015/05/19/thats-billion-with-a-bee-measuring-the-massive-cost-of-hive-collapse/http://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/whats-all-the-obama-buzz-about-bees/2015/05/18/5ebd1580-fd6a-11e4-805c-c3f407e5a9e9_story.htmlhttps://www.whitehouse.gov/blog/2015/05/19/announcing-new-steps-promote-pollinator-healthhttp://apps.washingtonpost.com/g/page/national/we-all-get-stung-by-bee-colony-collapse/1108/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Save the bees,honeybee death,beehive collapse,colony collapse,bees die,white house strategy,Obama environment

item.title: US indicts six Chinese nationals for economic espionage
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe United States has indicted six Chinese nationals for stealing a technology used in mobile devices.The Chinese nationals, including three Tianjin University professors, are charged with stealing FBAR technology from their U.S. employers on behalf of the Chinese government, according to a statement released by the FBI’s San Francisco Division.One of the defendants, Hao Zhang, a professor at Tianjin University, was arrested at Los Angeles International Airport over the weekend while he was on his way to a conference. The other five defendants remain in China, according to the statement. FBAR technology is used in mobile devices to filter unwanted wireless signals so that the user only receives or transmits communications to specific destinations intended by the user.The defendants could face up to 15 years’ imprisonment if convicted.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Illustration of six Chinese nationals stealing U.S. mobile phone technology2. FBAR technology blocks unwanted signals3. Defendant arrested in Los Angeles4. The other five defendants remain in ChinaVOICEOVER (in English): “Six Chinese nationals, including three Tianjin University professors, were charged with stealing FBAR technology from their U.S. employers on behalf of the Chinese government.” “FBAR technology is used in mobile devices to filter unwanted wireless signals so that the user only receives or transmits communications to specific destinations intended by the user.”“One of the defendants was arrested at Los Angeles International Airport over the weekend as he was on his way to a conference. The other five defendants remain in China.”SOURCES: BBC, New York Times, Federal Bureau of Investigationhttp://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-32805227http://www.nytimes.com/2015/05/20/technology/6-chinese-men-indicted-in-theft-of-code-from-us-tech-companies.html?_r=0http://www.fbi.gov/sanfrancisco/press-releases/2015/chinese-professors-among-six-defendants-charged-with-economic-espionage-and-theft-of-trade-secrets-for-benefit-of-peoples-republic-of-china***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: More than 33 million birds affected by avian flu in the U.S.
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThree deadly strains of avian flu, H5N8, H5N2 and the highly pathogenic HPAI strain, have hit North America's poultry flocks, causing the worst avian flu outbreak in the U.S. on record.More than 160 cases of avian flu have been reported since December, affecting more than 33 million turkeys, chickens and ducks who have been killed or are expected to be culled in 15 different states in the U.S., according to the U.S. Department of Agriculture.Wisconsin, Minnesota and Iowa have declared state emergencies due to the epidemic. According to the USDA, about 40 percent of egg-laying hens in Iowa are dead or will be euthanized, and more than 14 percent of hens have died in Minnesota. In Minnesota, lawmakers have approved $20 million funding to help farmers contain the virus. Earlier this year, the federal government approved $330 million in funding to help states fight the spread of bird flu.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. States affected by bird flu2. How the virus is spread3. How to affected birds are culled4. How bird carcasses are disposed ofVOICEOVER (in English): “More than 33 million turkeys, chickens and ducks in 15 different states have been affected by the avian flu since December.”“About 40 percent of hens in Iowa are dead or will be euthanized, while in Minnesota, more than 14 percent of hens have died.”“The virus is spread by wild bird droppings left on farms, dust and dander, or from the shoes of a person who moves from one facility to another.”“The infected birds are culled using carbon dioxide gas or a water-based foam that is similar to that used to suppress a fire.”“The carcasses are then buried in giant rectangular pits or incinerated.”SOURCES: http://in.reuters.com/article/2015/05/12/us-health-birdflu-usa-timeline-idINKBN0NX2QH20150512http://www.latimes.com/science/la-na-bird-flu-20150517-story.htmlhttp://minnesota.cbslocal.com/2015/05/17/state-leaders-approve-funding-to-stop-bird-flu/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Security researcher tells FBI he hacked into airplane controls
item.description: For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twSecurity researcher Chris Roberts was kicked off a United Airlines flight for a tweet about hacking the plane’s electronic system. Chris Roberts told FBI agents that he’s hacked into commercial in-flight entertainment, or IFE, systems approximately 15-20 times.Roberts acquired access to the IFE system by removing a panel underneath passenger seats. He then connected a modified Ethernet cable from the IFE system to his computer. Using default username and passwords, Roberts gained access to other flight systems such as cabin and thrust controls. On one occasion he caused a plane to temporarily fly sideways, Roberts told FBI agents. Roberts was removed from a United Airlines flight from Chicago to Syracuse, New York last month after publishing a tweet suggesting he might compromise the plane’s electronic system.The FBI confiscated Roberts computer equipment while the search warrant was being processed. Roberts is the founder of One World Labs. They protect people and organizations from cyber threats. No charges have been filed against Roberts in connection to the aircraft systems hack. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Roberts gaining access to panel2. Roberts connecting to IFE3. Controlling from his laptop4. Flight compromised5. Roberts publishes a tweet6. FBI agents confiscate itemsVOICEOVER (in English): “Roberts acquired access to the IFE system by removing a panel underneath passenger seats.” “He then connected a modified Ethernet cable from the IFE system to his computer.”“Using default username and passwords, Roberts gained access to other flight systems such as cabin and thrust controls.” “On one occasion he caused a plane to temporarily fly sideways, Roberts told FBI agents.” “Roberts was removed from a flight after publishing a tweet suggesting he might compromise the plane’s electronic system.”“The FBI confiscated Roberts computer equipment while the search warrant was being processed.” SOURCES: Wired, APTNhttp://www.wired.com/2015/05/feds-say-banned-researcher-commandeered-plane/http://aptn.ca/news/2015/05/15/hacker-told-f-b-made-plane-fly-sideways-cracking-entertainment-system/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: U.S. plans on sending Australia B-1 bombers to ensure freedom of navigation in South China Sea
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe United States military plans to station B-1 strategic bombers and surveillance aircraft in Australia, according to U.S. Defence Department Assistant Secretary for Asian and Pacific Security Affairs David Shear.The move is seen as part of an effort to deter Chinese ambitions in the South China Sea. Shear’s announcement came ahead of any announcement by the Australian government.The U.S. is already planning to boost naval forces and airpower in the South China Sea to assert the right of free passage, as China continues its efforts to assert its maritime territorial claims in the region. China has already begun construction of airfields and artificial islands in the South China Sea.The B-1 Lancer bomber, commonly called "Bone" (originally from "B-One") was first deployed by the US Air Force in the mid 1980s, according to the Sydney Morning Herald. The aircraft is expected to continue in serve as a strategic bomber until the mid 2030s.The aircraft is able to rapidly deliver 84 500-pound bombs and is currently being used to attack Islamic State in Iraq, ABC News in Australia reported.Shear also said U.S. military movements will also be taking place in other countries in the region, including the “deployment of Global Hawks and F-35s in Japan.” Washington will be adding to the stock of V-22s in Japan, according to Shear.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. China making maritime claims in South China Sea2. China building artificial islands3. U.S. increasing naval forces in the region4. U.S. sends B-1 bomber to Australia5. Aircraft payload6. U.S. sends Global Hawks, F-35s and V-22s to JapanVOICEOVER (in English): “As China continues to boost its maritime territorial claims in the South China Sea through the construction of airfields and artificial islands,”“The U.S. is increasing its naval forces and airpower in the region to assert the right of free passage.”“The U.S. military has announced plans to station B-1 strategic bombers and surveillance aircraft in Australia.”“The B-1 Lancer bomber is able to quickly deliver a total of 84 500-pound bombs ‘anywhere in the world, at any time’. It is currently being used against the Islamic State in Iraq.”“The U.S. defence secretary stated that Global Hawks and F-35s would also be deployed to Japan, while the military would add to the stock of V-22 Ospreys in the country.”SOURCES: Sydney Morning Herald, Australia Broadcasting Corporation, RThttp://www.smh.com.au/world/b1-bombers-coming-to-australia-to-deter-beijings-south-china-sea-ambitions-us-20150514-gh23zl.htmlhttp://www.abc.net.au/news/2015-05-15/united-states-sends-b1-bomber-aircraft-to-australia/6471528http://rt.com/usa/258713-b1-bombers-china-dispute/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
