item.title: LightSail solar spacecraft to be launched soon
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe construction of the LightSail spacecraft, a solar spacecraft designed by the Planetary Society, will start next year thanks to a crowdfunded campaign that reached it’s goal in only one day, CBS News reported.On Wednesday afternoon, the private, non-profit Planetary Society and its CEO Bill Nye, managed to raise US$200,000, only a day after the campaign was launched. The money raised so far for the project will cover construction of the first spacecraft to be launched in 2016. However, the entire project is expected to cost $5.46 million.The LightSail is a spacecraft with solar sails which mirrored surfaces are designed to capture momentum, or photons, from solar energy. The constant barrage of solar energy generates continuous acceleration which eventually allows the spacecraft to reach high speed without burning any fuel.The spacecraft is also equipped with cameras which every seven seconds take photographs of the mylar sails deployment.The Planetary Society was co-founded by astronomer Carl Sagan. The organization tried to launch Cosmos 1, the first solar sail in the world, in 2005 but the craft never reached the orbit due to a failure of the launch vehicle.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. The Lightsail spacecraft and its width2. The LightSail launched into space 3. The lightsail solar panel swings opening up 4. The lightsail 4 triangular sails unwinding, the cameras taking pictures of it 5. Light photons pushing the lightsail6. The Lightsail traveling in space thanks to sunlightVOICEOVER (in English): “The spacecraft, when closed, has a width of only 10 centimeters.”“Once in space, the LightSail’s solar panels are designed to swing open to eight meters wide.”“After the mylar sails are fully deployed, the craft’s cameras take photographs of the deployment every seven seconds.”“The solar sails’ mirrored surfaces then capture momentum from solar energy, or photons. The constant barrage of solar energy generates continuous acceleration and eventually allows the spacecraft to reach high speed without burning any fuel.”SOURCES: CBC Newshttp://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/bill-nye-s-lightsail-solar-sailing-spacecraft-wins-on-kickstarter-1.3072962***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Hackers are stealing money using the Starbucks app
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twHackers are stealing money from the credit cards, bank and PayPal accounts of Starbucks customers by hacking into their Starbucks mobile apps. The Starbucks app allows customers to make purchases at Starbucks with their phones, check their Starbucks Card balances, transfer funds to their Starbucks Cards and transfer funds between cards, according the app’s description on iTunes.Hackers have discovered that apps such as these that store consumers’ credit card numbers and other personal information are easier to steal money from than financial institutions. They can drain money from the Starbucks app by siphoning off funds from Starbucks Cards, transferring funds to Starbucks Cards or creating new Starbucks Cards, and repeating the process. By enabling the app’s auto-reload function to drain funds, hackers can steal hundreds of dollars in a matter of minutes.The story was first reported by consumer journalist Bob Sullivan.Starbucks told CNN Money that the company does not believe its app was hacked and said that the incidents are more likely due to weak passwords. Starbucks suggests that its customers use unique passwords to prevent hackers from hacking into the app.However, enabling two-step authentication a common feature which the Starbucks app lacks that sends a text message to your phone whenever you sign in from an unfamiliar device would have better protected Starbucks customers.Starbucks has yet to decide whether it will add new security measures such as two-step authentication to its system. In the meantime, customers can protect themselves by creating strong passwords and by not saving their financial information in their Starbucks app accounts.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. How hackers steal money from the Starbucks app2. How to prevent hackers from stealing money from the appVOICEOVER (in English): “Hackers can steal money from the Starbucks app by adding a new e-gift card, transferring funds over, and repeating the process when funds are reloaded.”“Hackers can also hack into existing gift cards and turn on the auto-reload function to drain the funds.”“Enabling two-step authentication, which sends a text to your phone whenever you sign in from a new device, would have protected Starbucks customers”SOURCES: CNN Money, iTunes, bobsullivan.nethttp://money.cnn.com/2015/05/13/technology/hackers-starbucks-app/https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/starbucks/id331177714?mt=8https://bobsullivan.net/cybercrime/identity-theft/exclusive-hackers-target-starbucks-mobile-users-steal-from-linked-credit-cards-without-knowing-account-number/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Toyota, Nissan recall over 5 million cars for faulty airbags
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twToyota Motor Corp. and Nissan Motor Co. have issued a global recall of millions of vehicles over problems with their airbags, which are designed by Japanese supplier Takata Corps.Toyota said on Wednesday that it is recalling around 5 million vehicles globally due to of airbag problems. The recall will affect 35 Toyota models globally. Nissan has recalled another 1.56 million vehicles globally for the same airbag problems. The inside of an airbag’s inflator assembly, which is located underneath the steering wheel, is filled with propellant granules and propellants. Unlike propellants made by most other brands, Takata-designed propellants are made from ammonium nitrate. If exposed to high humidity, the propellants can end up damaged or cracked, this causes them to produce too much pressure inside the inflator, causing it to crack and explode.When the airbag inflates, pieces of the damaged inflator may fly at the driver and passenger like shrapnel, putting people in a crash at greater risk in injury.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Passenger and driver-side airbags experience problems2. Location of an inflator assembly and propellant granules within the inflator heating up the propellants3. Propellant exposed to high humidity and causing damage to the inflator4. Airbag inflating and pieces of the inflator hitting a driver and his passengerVOICEOVER (in English): “In the recalled vehicles, front passenger and driver-side airbags may deploy abnormally.”“The inside of an airbag’s inflator assembly, which is located underneath the steering wheel, is filled with propellant granules and propellants. Unlike propellants made by most other brands, Takata-designed propellants are made from ammonium nitrate.”“If exposed to high humidity, the propellants can end up damaged, this causes them to produce too much pressure inside the inflator, causing it to crack and explode.”“When the airbag inflates, pieces of the damaged inflator may fly at the driver and passenger like shrapnel, putting people in a crash at greater risk in injury.”SOURCES: The Straits Times, Time, Agence France-Pressehttp://www.straitstimes.com/news/singapore/more-singapore-stories/story/best-straits-times-infographics-2014-20141224http://time.com/3856965/toyota-nissan-takata-airbag-recall/http://news.yahoo.com/toyota-nissan-recall-6-5-mln-cars-over-055536436--finance.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Australian agency reports an El Nino has formed
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA major El Niño event has been officially declared by Australia’s Bureau of Meteorology (BoM).The bureau reports the weather system is likely to lead to prolonged drier, hotter conditions across much of the eastern portion of the country.According to the Bureau, an El Niño occurs when sea surface temperatures in the central and eastern tropical Pacific Ocean become markedly warmer than average. This causes a shift in atmospheric circulation. The impacts of this will most likely be felt through autumn of 2016.Normally, trade winds blowing from east to west across the equatorial Pacific send warm surface waters to the eastern Pacific, generating a low-pressure area over which storms form. El Niño occurs when the winds reverse for periods as long as several months, causing warm water to spread over the central and eastern Pacific. This reorganises rainfall and atmospheric circulation bringing unseasonal and intense weather which can cause bushfires in Australia and flooding in South America.The Climate Prediction Center (CPC) says there is a 50-60% chance that the 2015 El Niño will continue through spring. El Niño will likely provide some rainfall relief to drought-stricken California but it’s not expected to have drastic global effects.El Niño tends to increase precipitation along U.S. coastlines, but the Midwest and Northwest tend to see a decrease from the average. The frequency of precipitation tends to increase in comparison to average frequency. El Niño also tends to suppress hurricane activity in the Atlantic Ocean by causing higher wind shear which spreads storms out over a larger area.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. A map of the world with the equator marked.2. Trade winds blow push warm waters to the eastern Pacific, generating storms in the western Pacific. Then winds reverse, dispersing warm water across the Pacific, generating storms in the eastern Pacific3. 50-60% chance, El Niño will run March - May4. Rainfall over California 5. U.S. map with difference in precipitation amount caused by El Niño6. U.S. map with difference in precipitation frequency caused by El Niño7. How wind shear suppresses hurricanes in the Atlantic OceanVOICEOVER (in English): “The Climate Prediction Center (CPC) says there is a 50-60% chance that the 2015 El Niño will continue through spring.”“El Niño will likely provide some rainfall relief to drought-stricken California but it’s not expected to have drastic global effects.”“El Niño tends to increase precipitation along U.S. coastlines, but the Midwest and Northwest tend to see a decrease from the average.” “The frequency of precipitation is also affected in comparison to average frequency.” “El Niño also tends to suppress hurricane activity in the Atlantic Ocean by causing higher wind shear which spreads storms out over a larger area.” SOURCES: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Association, Climate Prediction Center, Wunderground, http://www.abc.net.au/news/2015-05-12/el-nino-officially-declared-drier-hotter-conditions-predicted/6463966http://www.climate.gov/news-features/blogs/enso/march-2015-enso-discussion-el-ni%C3%B1o-herehttp://www.cpc.ncep.noaa.gov/products/analysis_monitoring/enso_advisory/ensodisc.htmlhttp://www.wunderground.com/news/el-nino-2015-noaa***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: US to challenge China’s South China Sea claims
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe Pentagon is considering sending aircraft and naval ships to challenge China’s territorial claims in the South China Sea and demonstrate the United States’ regular observance of ‘freedom of navigation’ operations in the disputed waters.U.S. aircraft and naval ships have approached, but have not yet penetrated, the 12-nautical-mile zone declared by China around the artificial islands that China is busy constructing. The Pentagon is now considering penetrating these zones, although American aircraft and ships will maintain a 12-nautical-mile distance from the original islands.U.S. Defense Secretary Ash Carter has asked staff to consider options such as flying Navy surveillance aircraft over the islands and sending U.S. naval ships into the reefs around China’s reclaimed islands. China, ignoring laws governing international waters, regularly deploys Chinese coast guard vessels to waters within 12 nautical miles of the Senkaku Islands. That, and its rapid, artificial island expansion in the Spratly Island chain have raised concerns in the region and in the Pentagon. Since March 2014, China has reclaimed seven sites in the Spratlys and China is also constructing an airstrip on at least one artificial island.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Chinese coast guard vessels traveling within 12 nautical miles of the Senkaku Islands2. China’s artificial island expansion in the South China Sea3. U.S. aircraft and the USS Fort Worth maintain their distance from the Spratly Islands4. U.S. navy ship traveling within 12 nautical miles of the artificial islands but will stay clear of the original islandsVOICEOVER (in English): “China, in contravention of laws governing international waters, regularly deploys Chinese coast guard vessels to waters within 12 nautical miles of the Senkaku Islands.”“That, and its rapid, artificial expansion of islands in the Spratly Island chain have raised concerns in the region and in the Pentagon.”“U.S. aircraft and naval ships have approached, but have not yet penetrated, the 12-nautical-mile zone declared by China around the artificial islands.”“The Pentagon is now considering penetrating these zones, although American aircraft and ships will maintain a 12-nautical-mile distance from the original islands.”SOURCES: Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, BBChttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/05/12/us-usa-china-military-idUSKBN0NX2ON20150512http://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-military-proposes-challenge-to-china-sea-claims-1431463920http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-32666046***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Tennessee Subway installs anti-robber DNA spray system
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.tw A Subway restaurant in Knoxville, Tennessee just became the first U.S. business to implement an intruder spray system, a security device that sprays robbers with synthetic DNA.“It’s exciting to lead in something that’s not just on the food side of things,” Subway Director of Operations A.J. Underwood told WATE. SelectaDNA, the distributor of the device, has already set up similar security systems in 30 countries around the world, according to the company’s website. The system comes with warning signs and an alarm. But if a robber still manages to steal from the store, the security device sprays him or her with an odorless and colorless DNA mist. The DNA markings stick to the thief’s clothing fibers and skin cracks and are only visible under a UV light. Even if a criminal is stopped 7 weeks after the crime, an officer can still spot the DNA markings. Every system has a unique DNA code, so the robber can be traced back to a specific location. Subway plans to install the device at hundreds of locations to thwart robberies, according to True Crime. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1.DNA security spray system scanning inside of restaurant 2.Robber leaving restaurant, pull-out showing DNA code of spray system 3.Security system spraying robber 4.DNA spray sticking to robber’s clothing fibers and skin cracks5.Cop with UV light questioning robber 6.Cop linking robber’s DNA markings to security system’s DNAVOICEOVERA Knoxville Subway just became the first U.S. business to implement the intruder spray system - A Security device that sprays robbers with synthetic DNA that links them to the crime. The odorless and colorless spray is only visible under a UV light. The marks are shower-proof as they get into the intruder’s clothing fibers and skin cracks. Even if a criminal is stopped 7 weeks after the crime, an officer can still spot the DNA markings. Every system has a unique DNA code, so the robber can be traced back to a specific location. SOURCES: ABC 6, True Crime, SelectaDNAhttp://wate.com/2015/05/11/new-security-system-makes-nationwide-debut-at-knoxville-subway/http://truecrime.io9.com/restaurant-installs-intruder-spray-to-tag-burglars-wi-1703737555https://www.selectadna.co.uk/dna-intruder-sprays/selectadna-spray-warning-sign-foamex-400x300mm***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

item.title: The science behind Kylie Jenner’s plump lips
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twKylie Jenner, the youngest “Keeping up with the Kardashians” star, admitted to using lip fillers, after insisting for months her plump lips were all natural.“It’s just an insecurity of mine, and it’s what I wanted to do,” the 17-year-old said during a sneak peek of an upcoming episode.Jenner admitted to using temporary lip augmentation, which likely means a medical professional numbed her lips and then injected a hyaluronic acid. There are several types of hyaluronic acids, but they all work by essentially adding moisture and cushioning to the skin.Hyaluronic acid -- which does not strip the skin the way most acids do -- is a naturally-occurring polysaccharide in the eyes, joints and in between the skin cells, according to a feature by Beauty Editor. It acts as a smoothing agent for skin, and as humans age, our bodies produce less and less of it.Injection results typically last between six and nine months before a patient needs another lip augmentation, New York City plastic surgeon Dr. Matthew Schulman told People.Side effects can include bruising, scarring and infections. But the procedure seems to be safer than the Kylie Jenner Lip Challenge.“I don’t think there’s a safety concern,” Schulman said of Jenner’s lip filler treatment. “I think the bigger concern with her being 17 is more of a psychological concern: whether she’s old enough or mature enough to undergo body transformation.” The next “Kardashians” episode airs Sunday at 9 EST on E!. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1.A syringe injecting fluid into a person’s top lip2.Fluid filling the lip3.Hyaluronic acid compounds moving around in the lips4.Highlights showing naturally-occurring acid in eyes, joints and space between cells 5.Lips shrinking over 6-month period 6.Red highlights showing potential injury around lips "Kylie Jenner admitted to using temporary lip augmentation -- which likely means a medical professional numbed her lips and then injected a hyaluronic acid." "Hyaluronic acid works by essentially adding moisture and cushioning to the skin.""It’s a naturally-occurring carbohydrate in our eyes… joints… and the spaces between our skin cells." "Cosmetic results typically last about 6 months before the patient needs a touch-up.Side effects can include bruising around the lips, scarring and even infections on rare occassion." SOURCES: Fox, People, LA Timeshttp://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/2015/05/07/kylie-jenner-needed-her-mothers-permission-for-lip-fillers/http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2015/05/07/kylie-jenner-lip-fillers-plastic-surgeron-reacts/http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/gossip/la-et-mg-kylie-jenner-lip-filler-20150506-story.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: UK teen may have died from chewing too much gum, coroner says
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twChewing too much gum may have played a role in the sudden death of a Samantha Jenkins, 19, in Wales in June of 2011.Jenkins was feeling ill in the weeks leading up to her death, when she collapsed and died after complaining about a headache.Her mother, Maria Morgan, told Wales Online: “I then looked through my daughter’s bags, drawers and bedroom and as a typically untidy teenager found hundreds of sugar free Trident wrappers and receipts.”Excess intake of aspartame and or sorbitol, two sweetener ingredients in sugar-free gum, may have interfered with electrolytes in Samantha Jenkins’ body, causing her salt levels to drop.Lumps of gum found in her stomach may also have affected the teenager’s ability to absorb vital minerals.Jenkins suffered a brain stem death due to swelling of the brain caused by convulsions from lack of salt, magnesium and calcium.Jenkins was eating 14 sticks of chewing gum per day, which means she was consuming about 16.8 grams of artificial sweeteners, “a fairly substantial amount,” pathologist Paul Griffiths told Swansea coroner’s court.The Carmarthenshire Coroner is set to open an inquest into Samantha's death next week.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Excess intake of aspartame and or sorbitol causes salt levels to drop2. Lumps of chewing gum in the stomach prevent vital minerals from being absorbed by the body3. Brain stem death lead to convulsions from lack of vital mineralsVOICEOVER: “Excess intake of aspartame and or sorbitol, two sweetener ingredients in sugar-free gum, may have interfered with electrolytes in Samantha Jenkins’ body, causing her salt levels to drop.”“Lumps of gum found in her stomach may have also have affected the teenager’s ability to absorb vital minerals.”“Jenkins suffered a brain stem death due to swelling of the brain caused by convulsions from lack of salt, magnesium and calcium.”SOURCES: The Guardian, The Mirror, Wales Onlinehttp://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2015/may/05/chewing-gum-role-teenagers-death-inquesthttp://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/did-chewing-gum-kill-daughter-5616300http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/samantha-jenkins-my-daughter-no-9189168***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: How a hung parliament in the UK works
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twAs millions of voters head to the polls in the UK general elections, the country could be heading toward a hung parliament.In UK elections, a party must win at least 326 of 650 seats in the House of Commons to obtain an absolute majority.In the event that no party wins that number, a hung parliament occurs,, which means that no party has the majority.Without the cooperation of other parties, the party with the plurality of seats might not have enough votes to pass legislation.In this event, the largest parties -- either the Conservative Party or the Labour Party -- can attempt to form a coalition with other parties and reach a majority.If there is no ground for a coalition, the party with most seats will have to start negotiations with the other parties.The final results of the UK general elections are expected on May 8th in the afternoon.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. House of Commons: conservative party getting 326 seats (representational)2. Hung parliament: no party has more than 325 seats3. A party with less than 326 seats might not get legislation passed4. Leading party creating a coalition with other parties5. Leading party negotiating with other parties VOICEOVER (in English): “In UK elections, an absolute majority happens when a party has won at least 326 out of 650 seats in the House of Commons.”“In the event that no party gets that number, a hung parliament is formed, which means that no party has the majority of seats available.”“Without the cooperation of other parties, the party with the plurality of seats might not have enough votes to pass legislation.”“In this event, the largest parties -- either the Conservative Party or the Labour Party -- can attempt to form a coalition with other parties and reach a majority.”“If there is no ground for a coalition, the party with more seats will have to start negotiations with the other parties.”SOURCES: THE GUARDIAN , BBChttp://www.theguardian.com/politics/2015/may/06/general-election-2015-britain-heading-for-hung-parliamenthttp://www.bbc.com/news/election-2015-32618577***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Smartphones detects parasites in blood
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twUS researchers have developed a system CellScope that uses a smartphone to detect the Loa loa parasite, commonly known as the “eye worm” in blood samples.The smartphone needs to be mounted on a base, which contains a slot for the blood sample. The camera on the smartphone records the motion of any organisms in the blood sample and an algorithm analyzes the data within two minutes, according to a press release by UC Berkeley.The result can be used to determine whether the patient is suitable for treatment with the drug ivermectin, which can be fatal to those with high levels of Loa loa worm, the BBC reported.“There are drugs to treat many neglected tropical diseases, these are problems that should be solved, but there is not the technology to identify people who need the right drugs,” Prof Daniel Fletcher, one of the project’s researchers told the BBC.The method has successfully reduced the rate of human error in early field tests. Researchers are expanding the study to include about 40,000 people in Cameroon, according to the press release.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Illustration of a smartphone that can detect Loa loa parasites2. A blood sample is inserted into the device3. Phone captures the motion of worms in the blood sample4. Illustration of worm count calculated within 2 minutes5. The study will be tested on 40,000 people in CameroonVOICEOVER (in English): “Researchers from the University of California, Berkeley, have developed a system that can detect the presence of Loa loa parasites, commonly known as the “eye worm,” in blood samples.”“The smartphone is mounted on a base, which contains a slot for the blood sample.”“The camera on the smartphone then records the motion of any organisms in the blood sample and an algorithm analyzes the data within two minutes.”“The new diagnosis method is now set to be tested on about 40,000 people in Cameroon.”SOURCES: BBC, Popular Science, UC Berkeleyhttp://www.bbc.com/news/health-32610097http://www.popsci.com/smartphone-platform-detects-loa-loa-parasites-faster-everhttps://newscenter.berkeley.edu/2015/05/06/video-cellscope-automates-detection-of-parasites/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: New England Patriots probably deflated footballs: report
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA 243-page report released by the NFL on Wednesday has revealed “it is more probable, than not” that New England Patriots personnel deliberately deflated footballs below league standards, according to a New York Times report. The long awaited report, commissioned in response to the“deflategate” controversy, investigated allegations that New England Patriots personnel purposely deflated balls used in January’s AFC championship game, which saw them defeat the Indianapolis Colts 45-7.The report says New England Patriots locker room attendant Jim McNally and equipment assistant John Jastremski released air from 11 of 12 game balls with Patriots quarterback Tom Brady aware of the deflation. No other Patriots personnel, including Coach Bill Belichick, are believed to have been aware of the deflated footballs. A regulation NFL football has to be inflated between 12.5 to 13.5 pounds per inch. 11 footballs tested during the AFC championship game in January, were found to be significantly underinflated.Deflated balls are easier to throw, catch, and grip than standard regulation footballs. The report separately determined that the Patriots had not deliberately tried to introduce an improper football for kicking and cleared kicker Stephen Gostkowski of any wrongdoing.RUNDOWN SHOWS:Standard football vs deflated Patriots football Two Patriots assistants deflating 11 footballs Tom Brady knows about the deflating footballs Standard football vs deflated football thrown farther because of weightStephen Gostkowski successfully kicks the football in the goalOfficials find out 11 footballs have been deflated VOICEOVER (in English): "A regulation NFL football has to be inflated between 12.5 to 13.5 pounds per inch. 11 footballs tested during the AFC championship game in January, were found to be significantly underinflated.""A New England Patriots locker room attendant and equipment assistant are believed to have released air from 11 of 12 game balls with Patriots quarterback Tom Brady aware of the deflation." "Deflated balls are easier to throw, catch, and grip than standard regulation footballs. The report separately determined that the Patriots had not deliberately" "tried to introduce an improper football for kicking and cleared kicker Stephen Gostkowski of any wrongdoing.""A member of the Indianapolis Colts, whom the Patriots defeated 45-7, gave officials a ball that was underinflated during halftime." SOURCES: New York Timeswww.nytimes.com/2015/05/07/sports/patriots-probably-deflated-footballs-on-purpose-report-says.html?hp&action=click&pgtype=Homepage&module=first-column-region&region=top-news&WT.nav=top-news***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: How the UK electoral system works
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twOn May 7 Britain is called to vote for the composition of the House of Commons, and by extension, for a new government.To elect the 650 members of the House of Commons, or lower house, the UK prime minister has to meet with the Queen before five years and a month have passed since the previous elections. The Queen then dissolves the Parliament and the new elections can begin. The elections for the new seats are held in the 650 territorial constituencies in England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland. About 60,000 electors in each constituency vote for their favorite candidate.The candidate with more votes gets a seat, and the leader of the party with the majority of seats automatically becomes the country’s Prime Minister and is called to form the government.If neither of the leading parties, Labour party or the Conservative party, obtains a majority, as it happened in 2010, the party with most seats can try to form a coalition government with the largest of the smaller parties, the Liberal Democrats.If there is no ground for a coalition however, a minority government could also be formed and the largest party, despite lacking a majority, could still see legislations get through.According to the Independent, in this 2015 elections, neither leading party looks like it will get a majority, and a coalition seems a necessary step. If David Cameron, UK current prime minister, wins, he will probably continue the coalition with the Liberal Democrats. If Labour party leader Ed Miliband wins, he will have to work with the Scottish National Party, with the Liberal Democrats and more likely with some of the small parties like the Greens, Plaid Cymru or the ones from Northern Ireland. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. 650 seats in the House of Commons dissolved by the Queen 2. Elections in 650 territorial constituencies3. Party with majority of seats and election of the Prime Minister4. Coalition created by Labour or Conservative parties with Liberal DemocratesVOICEOVER (in English): “To elect the 650 members of the House of Commons, the UK prime minister has to meet with the Queen before five years and a month have passed since the previous elections. The Queen then dissolves the Parliament.” “The elections for the new seats are held in the 650 territorial constituencies in England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland. About 60,000 electors in each constituency vote for their favorite candidate.”“The candidate with more votes gets a seat, and the leader of the party with the majority of seats automatically becomes the country’s Prime Minister and forms the government.” “If neither of the leading parties, Labour or the Conservatives, obtains a majority, the party with most seats would try to form a coalition government with the largest of the smaller parties, the Liberal Democrats.SOURCES: FINANCIAL TIMES, THE INDEPENDENThttp://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/bdc37cd6-3cf9-11df-bbcf-00144feabdc0.html#axzz3ZLYcP7dthttp://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/generalelection/general-election-2015-what-will-happen-on-7-may--and-all-of-the-questions-you-were-too-afraid-to-ask-10229048.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Boeing 787 Dreamliner electrical glitch might cause plane to shut down mid flight
item.description: For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe Federal Aviation Administration warned on Friday that a software glitch in the Boeing 787 Dreamliner could cause the plane to power down mid flight. According to the Sydney Morning Herald, Boeing has found that if the four engine generators are left working continuously for about eight months or 248 days, a software internal counter could possibly overflow and cause a loss of all electrical power, even mid flight.The aerospace manufacturer told the New York Times that it would be rare for a plane to remain powered on without interruption for eight months.Four of the Dreamliner’s six electrical generators are mounted on its two engines. The generators provide power for a variety of functions, including the plane's electronic systems, cabin pressure and wing de-icers.Even if the main generators failed, the Dreamliner’s main lithium-ion batteries could still provide power to the flight deck for six seconds, before a ram air turbine could be deployed. The amount of power provided by the turbine would be sufficient to allow the pilots to turn the engines back on or fly to the nearest airport.According to Boeing, shutting the plane’s electrical systems down periodically would also eliminate the risk of the all plane’s power generators shutting down at the same time.Boeing has so far delivered more than 250,000 dreamliners to several carriers, including Jetstar, Japan Airlines, Air India, and Ethiopian Airlines.
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Dreamliner 787

item.title: Apple Watch's heart monitor may not work on tattooed people
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twDisgruntled Apple fans have taken to the Internet to complain that the Apple Watch’s built-in heart monitor does not work properly on people with wrist tattoos.Critics say that the heart monitor function may not work properly over wrist tattoos because the ink pigment obstructs the penetration of infrared and LED lights used by the device’s sensors.A pulse oximeter monitors a user’s heart rate by detecting the amount of oxygen in the blood stream. Each heartbeat leads to a slight increase in the level of blood oxygen.The Apple Watch’s pulse oximeter emits infrared and green LED lights and monitors the amount of light reflected to gauge the level of blood oxygen. However, infrared light reflection may be blocked on people with tattoos.Experts say the glitch could be resolved if more powerful LED lights were installed in the watch’s heart monitor.The problem is not unique to the Apple Watch. The performance of hospital pulse oximeters that are attached to the fingernails can be affected by substances including nail varnish.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Apple Watches worn by a man with a tattoo 2. Heartbeat 3. Increase in oxygen in blood stream 4. Apple Watch emitting infrared and green LED light 5. Less light passing through the bloodstream 6. More powerful LED light to be installed on Apple Watch VOICEOVER (in English): “Disgruntled Apple fans have taken to the Internet to complain that the Apple Watch’s built-in heart monitor does not work properly on people with wrist tattoos.” “A pulse oximeter monitors a user’s heart rate by detecting the amount of oxygen in the blood stream. Each heartbeat leads to a slight increase in the level of blood oxygen.” “The Apple Watch’s pulse oximeter emits infrared and green LED lights and monitors the amount of light reflected to gauge the level of blood oxygen. However, light may be blocked on people with tattoos.” “Experts say the glitch could be resolved if more powerful LED lights were installed in the watch’s heart monitor.” SOURCES: Vocativ, Time http://www.vocativ.com/culture/health-culture/tattoos-apple-watch-dark-skin/ http://time.com/3840383/apple-watch-tattoo-heart-rate-monitor/ ***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Daredevil Nik Wallenda walks across ferris wheel
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twDaredevil Nik Wallenda added a new record to his thick portfolio Wednesday morning when he successfully walked across a giant moving ferris wheel in Orlando. The Orlando Eye rotated at walking pace as Nik crossed from one pod to another, moving against the spin’s direction. The new ferris wheel is 400 feet tall, which is roughly equivalent to a 35-story building and taller than the Statue of Liberty. It’s not Nik’s highest accomplishment -- he was about 1400 feet in the air when he crossed the Grand Canyon -- but normally he has a balancing pole with him, which aids his center of gravity. “Without a balancing pole, it’s really challenging,” Wallenda said in a video interview provided by Reuters. “Everything happens quicker. With the balancing pole, it buys me a little time,” he said. He also had to duck under obstacles during the ferris wheel walk, which added an additional challenge. “There’s gonna be a lot going on for sure,” Wallenda said prior to the walk. Overnight rain made the steel beam slippery, and Wallenda estimated the wind to be at 20 mph as he crossed the wheel. Despite the challenges, Wallenda completed the walk in just four minutes. The walk aired live on NBC’s “Today.” The Orlando Eye is the tallest observation wheel on the East Coast, USA Today reported. The ferris wheel is set to open publically on May 4th. RUNDOWN SHOWS:1.Highlight shows pathway across ferris wheel rim 2.35-story building next to ferris wheel to demonstrate height3.Comparison of ferris wheel to Grand Canyon tightrope walk4.Nik Wallenda using a balancing pole to cross a tightrope5.Nik Wallenda crossing the ferris wheel without a balancing bar6.Water dripping from steel beams, wind blowing as Nik crossesVOICEOVER (in English): "The Orlando Eye rotated at walking pace as Nik crossed from one pod to another Wednesday morning." "The new ferris wheel is 400 feet tall -- about the equivalent of a 35-story building." " It’s not Nik’s highest accomplishment. He was about 1400 feet in the air when he crossed the Grand Canyon." "But normally he has a balancing pole with him, which aids his center of gravity. During Wednesday’s walk he had no balancing pole, AND he had to duck under obstacles." "The walk was further complicated by the overnight rain in Orlando and 20-mile-per-hour wind." SOURCES: Reuters, Today, USA Today, The Orlando Eye, WRALhttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/04/29/us-usa-florida-wallenda-idUSKBN0NJ2E420150429http://www.today.com/news/nik-wallenda-prepares-walk-spinning-orlando-eye-live-today-show-t18086http://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/destinations/2015/04/29/nik-wallenda-orlando-eye/26523155/https://www.officialorlandoeye.com/http://www.wral.com/nik-wallenda-completes-walk-of-400-foot-wheel-in-orlando/14612381/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Drug tunnel discovered beneath US - Mexico border
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA drug tunnel was discovered on Tuesday beneath the US - Mexico border, San Diego 6 reported. US federal officers were patrolling near the San Ysidro Port of Entry fence when they found a sinkhole in the ground. The discovery led them to an underground tunnel that connected the northern edge of the Mexican city of Tijuana with the south end of San Diego.According to El Pais, the tunnel, which was destroyed the day after its discovery, had a single entry inside a home in Tijuana and was about 220 yards long and 60 feet deep.Tall enough for a person to walk through, the tunnel was still under construction but already fitted with reinforced walls, electric lighting and a cart-and-rail cargo-hauling system. This kind of tunnel underneath the border between the US and Mexico isn’t uncommon and is usually used for drugs or people’s smuggling. Since 2006, US authorities have found more than 80 smuggling tunnels.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Federal officers noticing a sinkhole near San Ysidro Port of Entry2. The tunnel length and depth 3. The tunnel single opening4. The tunnel on map5. The tunnel’s height6. The tunnel’s reinforced walls, electric lighting and a cart-and-rail cargo hauling system VOICEOVER (in English): “US federal officers were patrolling near San Ysidro Port of Entry fence when they found a sinkhole in the ground.” “The discovery led them to an underground tunnel, about 600 feet long and 60 feet deep.” “The tunnel, which had a single entry inside a home in Tijuana, connected the northern edge of the Mexican city with the south end of San Diego.” “The tunnel, was tall enough for a person to walk through [CUT 6], was fitted with reinforced walls, electric lighting and a cart-and-rail cargo-hauling system. SOURCES: SAN DIEGO 6, EL PAIShttp://www.sandiego6.com/news/local/Suspected-drug-tunnel-found-near-US--Mexico-border--301621351.htmlhttp://www.elpais.com.uy/mundo/descubren-extenso-tunel-pasar-droga.html***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Florida avocado crop threatened by deadly fungus (UPDATE)
item.description: CORRECTION: Refeed replaces SD video with HD videoRESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twResearchers in Florida are using dogs and drones in the fight against a disease that is threatening the state’s multimillion dollar avocado industry, as part of a Florida International University program funded by the Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services.The disease, laurel wilt, is caused by the fungus Raffaelea lauricola, and kills more than 90 percent of trees within six weeks of infection. Laurel wilt is vectored by the ambrosia beetle, an invasive species from Asia.For the project, researchers are testing the use of a drone and dogs to detect the disease before symptoms are visible to the human eye. Using drones allows large areas to be scanned much faster than it would take humans to examine every individual tree.The drone uses a digital thermal imaging camera to scan areas for infected trees. If a problem area is detected, disease-sniffing dogs are dispatched to confirm the presence of an infection. If the infection is caught early enough, the tree can be saved by treating it with fungicide.Florida’s avocado industry is worth more than $35 million a year to the state’s economy.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. A fungus-carrying ambrosia beetle bores into a tree2. The beetle feeds on fungus growing inside the tree, and the infected tree wilts3. A drone flies over an avocado orchard and detects an infection with its thermal imaging camera4. Dogs inspect the infected tree5. The infected tree is cut down and burned6. Nearby trees are treated with fungicideVOICEOVER (in English): “Laurel wilt is vectored by the ambrosia beetle, an invasive species from Asia. The fungus is introduced when the beetle bores into a tree.”“The fungus grows inside the tree and the beetle feeds on it. The fungus spreads in the tree’s vascular system, causing it to wilt and die.”"Researchers in Florida are using a drone with a thermal digital imaging camera to detect infections that are not yet visible to the human eye. If a problem area is spotted, disease-sniffing dogs are used to confirm the infection.""If detected early enough, the tree can be saved with fungicide. If not, the tree is cut down and burned.""The surrounding trees are then treated with fungicide to contain the outbreak."SOURCES: WSNV, Georgia Forestry Commission, Florida International University, University of Floridahttp://www.wsvn.com/story/28834461/fiu-researchers-use-dogs-drones-to-search-for-diseased-beetleshttp://www.gatrees.org/forest-management/forest-health/laurel-wilt-disease/http://news.fiu.edu/2015/03/canines-battle-deadly-avocado-fungus/86155http://edis.ifas.ufl.edu/fe837***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,avocado,drones,laurel wilt,ambrosia beetle,invasive species,Florida International University,Raffaelea lauricola

item.title: Oxford-based start-up to use drones to plant one billion trees a year
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twOxford-based start-up Biocarbon Engineering is planning to fight industrial deforestation by planting 1 billion trees a year using drones.Currently, 26 billions trees are cut down every year, while only 15 billions are replanted. The drones used by Biocarbon Engineering could solve the problem by making tree planting faster and cheaper. In a video made by the company, Biocarbon Engineering explains that the drones would first fly above a selected area, map its level of deforestation and report back its potential for reforestation. Then, automated planting drones carrying seed pods would fly one to two metres above the ground, following a pre-determined planting pattern, and fire germinated seeds into the soil.A small pressurized canister would provide the necessary propulsive force for the seed pods to easily penetrate the soil surface. The seed pods, filled with nutritious hydrogel to reduce the force of the seed’s impact with the soil, would then break open upon impact and allow the germinated seeds to grow. According to the Independent, one drone is able to plant 10 seeds per minute. With two operators controlling multiple drones, 36,000 trees could be planted in a single day.Biocarbon Engineering hopes to have the system fully working by the end of the summer. According to the Independent, the drone system is not as good as hand-sowing, but it’s much quicker and less expensive than traditional planting systems.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. A drone mapping a deforested area 2. A drone flying two to one meter above the ground3. A drone following a predetermined planting pattern 4. The drone small pressurized canister 5. The drone firing seed pod with nutritious hydrogel out ; the seedling growing6. Number of trees planted in one minute by one drone ; number of trees planted by multiple drones in one dayVOICEOVER (in English): “The drones used by Biocarbon Engineering would first fly above a selected area, map its level of deforestation and then report its potential for reforestation.” “After that, automated planting drones carrying seed pods would fly one to two metres above the ground, following a pre-determined planting pattern, and fire germinated seeds into the soil.”“A small pressurized canister would provide the necessary propulsive force for the seed pods to easily penetrate the soil surface.”“The seed pods, filled with nutritious hydrogel to reduce impact forces on the seedling during planting, would then break open upon impact and allow the germinated seeds to grow. “One drone can plant 10 seeds per minute. With two operators controlling multiple drones, 36,000 trees could be planted in a single day.” SOURCES: THE INDEPENDENT, RT, http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/exnasa-man-to-plant-one-billion-trees-a-year-using-drones-10160588.htmlhttp://rt.com/news/247709-drones-planting-trees-forests/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: SCIENCE-SMARTPHONE-EARTHQUAKE-DETECTOR
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twU.S. scientists found sensors in smartphones and similar devices can be used to build early earthquake warning systems, according to a study published in the inaugural issue of the American Association for the Advancement of Science’s journal Science Advances.“The use of mobile phone fleets as a distributed sensor network and the statistical insight that many imprecise instruments can contribute to the creation of more precise measurements has broad applicability including great potential to benefit communities where there isn’t an existing network of scientific instruments,” Bob Iannucci of Carnegie Mellon University, Silicon Valley said in a statement released by the U.S. Geological Survey.The study, led by scientists at the U.S. Geological Survey, found that smartphones can be used to issue warnings for earthquakes with a magnitude of roughly 7 or greater. Only a tiny percentage of people in a given area is needed to contribute information from their smartphones to achieve crowdsourced early earthquake warnings, according to the statement.The scientists are planning to place several hundred smartphone-based sensors on buildings near fault lines in their next study in Chile.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Illustration of a smartphone with GPS receiver2. The phone detects ground movements3. The phone detects earthquake magnitude 7 or above4. Illustration of a tiny percentage of smartphones is need to send out warningsVOICEOVER (in English): “Smartphones with GPS receivers can detect ground movement during an earthquake.”“They can be used to issue warnings for earthquakes with a magnitude of roughly 7 or greater.”“Only a tiny percentage of people in a given area is needed to contribute information from their smartphones to achieve crowdsourced early earthquake warnings.”SOURCES: USGS, Vocativ, Lauderdale Daily Newshttp://www.usgs.gov/newsroom/article.asp?ID=4189&from=rss&utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=twitter#.VSxy4pM0h8Hhttp://www.vocativ.com/culture/science/early-earthquake-warnings-smartphones-gps/http://www.whatlauderdale.com/news/earthquake-detectors/10621/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Baby who lived only 100 minutes becomes Britain’s youngest organ donor
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe parents of Teddy Houlston, a twin boy born without a brain, decided to donate his organs when he died just 100 minutes after his birth, making him the youngest organ donor in Britain.Jess Evans from Cardiff, was pregnant with twin boys and 12 weeks into her pregnancy when she was told that one of the boys was suffering from anencephaly, a rare condition that halts development of the brain and skull.Evans refused an abortion and the boys were born on April 22 last year. The other boy was born healthy, but Teddy Houlston only lived for 100 minutes. His parents donated his kidneys and heart valves to patients in need.After Houlston died, his kidneys were extracted and transported from Cardiff to Leeds.A patient with renal failure received the organs and the child size kidneys have since grown, reaching three-quarters the size of an adult kidney.The details of the heart valve transplant have not been disclosed because of a confidentiality agreement. The surviving twin remains healthy.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Twin foetuses 2. Birth of the twins; kidneys and heart valves of Teddy Houlston3. Kidneys transported to Leeds from Cardiff 4. Kidneys growing inside the patient receiving the transplant VOICEOVER (in English): “Jess Evans from Cardiff, was pregnant with twin boys and 12 weeks into her pregnancy when she was told that one of the boys was suffering from anencephaly, a rare condition that halts development of the brain and skull.” “Evans refused an abortion and the boys were born on April 22 last year. The other boy was born healthy, but Teddy Houlston only lived for 100 minutes. His parents donated his kidneys and heart valves to patients in need.” “After Houlston died, his kidneys were immediately extracted and transported from Cardiff to Leeds.” “A patient with renal failure received the organs and the child size kidneys have grown inside the adult, reaching three-quarters the size of a normal kidney.” SOURCES: news.com.au, The Guardian http://www.news.com.au/lifestyle/real-life/newborn-baby-teddy-houlston-becomes-uks-youngest-organ-donor/story-fnq2o7dd-1227318623151?from=public_rss&utm_content=lifestyle&utm_campaign=socialflow&utm_source=twitter&utm_term=lifestyle&utm_medium=banner http://www.theguardian.com/society/2015/apr/23/boy-who-lived-for-100-minutes-becomes-uks-youngest-organ-donor ***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Embryonic twin thought to be a tumor removed from woman’s brain
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twLos Angeles doctors discovered and removed an embryonic twin from inside the brain of a 26-year-old Indiana university student who doctors earlier had thought was suffering from a brain tumor.The embryo inside Yamini Karanam’s brain, despite having never developed, was found with bones, hair and teeth, Sky News reported.Karanam first sought medical help last year after she experienced comprehension problems. Doctors told her she was affected by a brain tumor. Instead, after surgery she found out that the tumor was in fact an embryonic twin. An embryonic twin occurs when a twin embryo develops in utero and the pair doesn’t fully separate. One embryo then keeps developing at the expense of the other one.The non-dominant embryo eventually dies in utero and is partially or completely reabsorbed by the dominant twin.Karanam made fun of her embryonic twin by telling NBC Los Angeles that it was her “evil twin sister who’s been torturing me for the past 26 years.”After undergoing minimally invasive brain surgery, she is expected to make full recovery.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Embryonic twin bone, hair and teeth2. Twin embryo developing inside a uterus3. Two embryos not fully separating 4. One of the embryos dominating the other5. The non dominant embryo dying and being absorbed by the dominant embryoVOICEOVER (in English): “The embryo inside the woman’s brain, despite never developing, was still found with bones, hair and teeth.”“Los Angeles doctors discovered and removed an embryonic twin with its own bones, hair, and teeth inside the brain of a 26-year-old Indiana university student.”“An embryonic twin occurs when a twin embryo develops inside the uterus and the pair doesn’t fully separate. “One embryo then keeps developing at the expense of the other.”“The non-dominant embryo eventually dies in utero and is partially or completely reabsorbed by the dominant twin.” SOURCES: NBC Los Angeles, Sky Newshttp://www.nbclosangeles.com/news/local/Embryonic-Twin-Discovered-in-Womans-Brain-During-Surgery-300891281.htmlhttp://news.sky.com/story/1470409/evil-twin-embryo-removed-from-womans-brain***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: North Korea nuclear capability on the rise
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twChina has increased its estimate of North Korea’s nuclear capability while warning that Pyongyang’s growing arsenal poses a threat to international security and the U.S.China’s top nuclear experts said North Korea may already possess as many as 20 nuclear warheads and it has the capability to double the size of its arsenal by 2016, the Wall Street Journal reported.“We have been and remain concerned about North Korea’s nuclear program and believe China should continue to use its influence to curtail North Korea’s provocative actions,” Patrick Ventrell, a spokesman for the U.S. National Security Council told the Journal.U.S. defense officials believe North Korea is capable of mounting a nuclear warhead on its KN-08 intercontinental ballistic missile, which has a range of about 5,600 miles and can reach the western edge of the United States, the Journal said.The United States has mutual defense treaties with South Korea and Japan, meaning an attack against either countries is regarded as an attack on the U.S.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. North Korea’s éstimated 20 nuclear warheads2. The number of warheads doubling by 20163. A warhead mounted on a KN-08 missile4. The range of the missile shown on a mapVOICEOVER (in English): TITLE CUT“China’s top nuclear experts have said that North Korea may already have as many as 20 nuclear warheads.”“They added that Pyongyang has the capability of doubling the size of its arsenal by 2016.”“Adding to the threat, U.S. defense officials believe North Korea is capable of mounting a nuclear warhead on its KN-08 intercontinental ballistic missile...”“...which has a range of about 5,600 miles and can reach the western edge of the United States.”SOURCES: The Wall Street Journalhttp://www.wsj.com/articles/china-warns-north-korean-nuclear-threat-is-rising-1429745706***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Hubble Space Telescope turns 25
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFriday marks the 25th anniversary of the Hubble Space Telescope’s launch on April 24, 1990 from the Kennedy Space Center aboard the space shuttle Discovery.At 13.2 metres long and with a maximum diameter of 4.2 metres, the Hubble Space Telescope is similar in size to a large tractor-trailer truck. It orbits the Earth about every 95 minutes, traveling at speeds of about 27,300 kmph.Among the discoveries astronomers have made using Hubble are bright and dark regions on the dwarf planet Ceres, four new Pluto moons and measurements of the motion of the Andromeda galaxy, which scientists used to determine the galaxy will merge with the Milky Way in approximately 4 billion years. Astronomers also used Hubble to determine the age of the universe 13.82 billion years with an accuracy of about 5 percent.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Dimensions of the Hubble space telescope 2. Dimensions of Hubble’s primary mirror and secondary mirror3. How the mirrors capture and reflect light in space 4. Scientific instruments on the Hubble Space Telescope5. Speed and orbital period of the Hubble Space Telescope 6. Communication between the Hubble telescope and a satellite VOICEOVER (in English): “At 13.2 metres long and with a maximum diameter of 4.2 metres, the Hubble Space Telescope is similar in size to a large tractor-trailer truck.” “Hubble has a primary mirror and secondary mirror. The concave primary mirror has a 2.4 metre-diameter while the convex secondary mirror has a diameter of 0.3 metres.” “When light in space travels through the telescope, it is collected by the primary mirror, which then reflects it to the secondary mirror. The light is then bounced back the primary mirror and focused on a small area called the focal plane.” “An array of scientific instruments enables Hubble to capture light of different wavelengths. These include the Wide Field Camera 3, the Advanced Camera for Surveys, the Near Infrared Camera and Multi-Object Spectrometer, the Cosmic Origins Spectrograph, the Space Telescope Imaging Spectrograph and three Fine Guidance Sensors.” “Hubble travels at speeds of about 27,300 kmph and orbits the Earth in about 95 minutes.” SOURCES: Hubble 25th, NASA, Hubble site http://hubble25th.org/education/21 http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/hubble/main/index.html http://hubblesite.org/the_telescope/hubble_essentials/quick_facts.php ***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
item.media:keywords: animation,Next Animation Studio,NAS,Hubble telescope,space telescope,25th anniversary,space,space image,technology,NASA

item.title: Blue Bell Creameries recalls all products over listeria contamination
item.description: For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twTexas-based Blue Bell Creameries is voluntarily recalling all of its products due to a potential Listeria contamination.The recall comes weeks after listeria bacteria was found in Blue Bell’s chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream produced on March 17, 2015, according to the company’s press release. The bacteria was traced to two production lines in Brenham, Texas and Broken Arrow, Oklahoma, NBC News reported. The recall covers retail outlets in 23 US states and internationally.“We’re committed to doing the 100 percent right thing, and the best way to do that is to take all of our products off the market until we can be confident that they are all safe,” Fox31 Denver quoted Paul Kruse, Blue Bell CEO and president as saying. Listeriosis is a bacterial infection that primarily affects elderly, pregnant women, newborns and people with weak immune systems. Its symptoms include fever, muscle aches and gastrointestinal disorders.The recall comes two weeks after an earlier smaller recall which followed the deaths from listeriosis of three people at a Kansas hospital who authorities believe may have gotten the illness after eating Blue Bell products.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Listeria bacteria found in ice cream2. Listeria bacteria found in two production lines in Texas and Oklahoma3. Listeriosis affects elderly, pregnant women and newborns4. Symptoms of listeriosis include fever, muscle aches and gastrointestinal disorders5. Blue Bell recovers all products from 23 states and internationallyVOICEOVER (in English): “Blue Bell Creameries is recalling all of its products after listeria bacteria was found in its chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream.”“The bacteria was traced to two production lines in Brenham, Texas and Broken Arrow, Oklahoma.”“Listeriosis is a bacterial infection that primarily affects the elderly, pregnant women, newborns and people with weak immune systems.” “Its symptoms include fever, muscle aches and gastrointestinal disorders.”“The recall covers retail outlets in 23 US states and internationally.”SOURCES: Blue Bell Creameries, CDC, Fox31 Denver, NBC Newshttp://www.bluebell.com/the_little_creamery/press_releases/all-product-recallhttp://www.cdc.gov/listeria/http://kdvr.com/2015/04/20/blue-bell-ice-cream-recalls-all-of-its-products-amid-listeria-outbreak/http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/blue-bell-creameries-pulls-all-its-products-after-ice-cream-n345276***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: SCIENCE-CALIFORNIA-DESALINATION
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twCalifornia's three-year-old drought is prompting San Diego County to push ahead with the largest desalination plant in the western hemisphere. The Carlsbad Desalination Project is located at the Encina Power Station in the city of Carlsbad, California. Water is drawn from seawater that passes through a series of filters to remove solids and other suspended particles not visible to the naked eye.Pressure pumps then move the filtered seawater into pressure vessels housing reverse osmosis membranes. The membranes convert the water into high-quality drinking water and concentrated seawater.The drinking water is then stored and the concentrated seawater is released back into the ocean.The high costs of constructing and running the desalination plant may pose challenges. Environmentalists have also expressed concerns about the impact of the facilities on marine life.The $1 billion project has been under construction since 2012 by Poseidon Water and is due to being operating in November. It will deliver up to 50 million gallons of water a day to San Diego County, enough to supply roughly 112,000 households, or about 10 percent of the county's drinking water needs.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Location of the Carlsbad Desalination Project2. Water goes into a series of filters3. Water goes into reverse osmosis membranes4. Water separates into drinking water and concentrated salt water5. Drinking water stored while the brine goes back into the oceanVOICEOVER (in English): “The Carlsbad Desalination Project is located at the Encina Power Station in the City of Carlsbad, California.”“Water is drawn from seawater that goes through a series of filters to remove solids and other suspended particles not visible to the naked eye.”“Pressure pumps then move the filtered seawater into pressure vessels housing reverse osmosis membranes.”“The membranes convert the water into high quality drinking water and concentrated seawater.”“The drinking water is then stored and the other half, containing the salt removed is then released back into the ocean.”SOURCES: Reuters, Inhabitat, Carlsbad Desalination Projecthttp://www.reuters.com/article/2015/04/15/us-usa-desalination-california-idUSKBN0N601V20150415http://inhabitat.com/san-diego-county-is-building-a-massive-1-billion-desalination-plant-to-address-drought/http://carlsbaddesal.com/project-overview***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Plane hacking made easier by better Internet connections
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twNew passenger planes with WiFi connections and advanced cockpits are more vulnerable to hacking, and in the worst case scenario, hackers could possibly take control of an aircraft, according to a new report published by the U.S. Government Accountability Office.Onboard firewalls are designed to protect avionics from cyber attacks but they can become vulnerable if the inflight entertainment system and flight control use the same routers.Through a WiFi connection on board, hackers could theoretically gain access to the flight control computer systems.Computer systems on aircraft could also be compromised if passengers unknowingly visit websites infected with a virus or malware.Gerald Dillingham, one of the authors of the report, said in an interview with CNN that newer planes such as the Boeing 787 Dreamliner, the Airbus A350 and A380, are at greater risk of cyber attacks as the cockpits of these planes share the same WiFi system as passengers.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Firewall protecting avionics 2. Router shared by inflight entertainment system and cockpit 3. & 4. Onboard hacking attack5. Passenger visiting a website infected with virus VOICEOVER (in English): “Onboard firewalls are designed to protect avionics from cyber attacks…” “... but they can become vulnerable if the inflight entertainment system and flight control use the same routers.” “Through a WiFi connection on board, hackers could theoretically gain access to the flight control computer systems.” “Computer systems on aircraft could also be compromised if passengers unknowingly visit websites infected with virus or malware.” SOURCES: Reuters, CNN http://www.reuters.com/article/2015/04/14/us-usa-airlines-gao-idUSKBN0N52HL20150414 http://www.cnn.com/2015/04/14/politics/gao-newer-aircraft-vulnerable-to-hacking/ ***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377

item.title: Logical reasoning question in Singaporean Math Olympiad goes viral
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twA logical reasoning question for 14-year-olds in the Singapore and Asian Schools Math Olympiad has gone viral after a TV presenter posted it on Facebook, leaving many people across the globe stumped.The mind-boggling question states that two boys, Albert and Bernard, became friends with a girl called Cheryl and wanted to know her birthday. Cheryl gave them ten possible dates, including May 15, May 16, May 19, June 17, June 18, July 14, July 16, August 14, August 15 and August 17. Then, she told Albert and Bernard the month and day of her birthday respectively.The question continues and states that Albert is not sure about her birthday yet but certain that Bernard, who was told the day, does not know either. From this, it is possible to eliminate the two unique dates, May 19 and June 18. If Cheryl had told Albert her birthday was in May or June then these two dates would still be valid. But Albert knows that Bernard does not know her birthday so this means she must have told Albert that the month is either July or August.Bernard then says he has deducted the answer from the five remaining dates. It is impossible that the day of Cheryl’s birthday is 14 because if this was the case, there would be two possible dates, July 14 and August 14, and Bernard would not be able to ascertain the answer. So, only three possible dates, July 16, August 15 and August 16 are left.Albert also obtains the answer after these clues. Since he only knows the month of Cheryl’s birthday, the answer must be July 16. If Cheryl told Albert she was born in August, Albert could not have deducted the answer because there would still be two possible dates.Henry Ong, executive director of the Singapore and Asian Schools Math Olympiad, said the birthday question is a difficult one that aims to sift out the most intelligent students.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. Logical reasoning question in the Singapore and Asian Schools Math Olympiad2. Ten dates given out by Cheryl 3. Cheryl telling Albert and Bernard the month and the date of her birthday separately 4. Dates eliminated after Albert’s first statement 5. Dates eliminated after Bernard’s statement and Albert’s second statement VOICEOVER (in English): “The mind-boggling question states that two boys, Albert and Bernard, became friends with a girl called Cheryl and wanted to know her birthday.” “Cheryl gave them ten possible dates…” “... and then told Albert and Bernard the month and day of her birthday respectively.” “The question continues and states that Albert is not sure about her birthday yet but certain that Bernard, who was told the day, does not know either. From this, it is possible to eliminate the two unique dates, May 19 and June 18. If Cheryl had told Albert her birthday was in May or June then these two dates would still be valid. But Albert knows that Bernard does not know her birthday so this means she must have told Albert that the month is either July or August.” “Bernard then says he has deducted the answer from the five remaining dates. It is impossible that the day of Cheryl’s birthday is 14 because if this was the case, there would be two possible dates, July 14 and August 14, and Bernard would not be able to ascertain the answer. So, only three possible dates, July 16, August 15 and August 17 are left.” “Albert also obtains the answer after these clues. Since he only knows the month of Cheryl’s birthday, the answer must be July 16. If Cheryl told Albert she was born in August, Albert could not have deducted the answer because there would still be two possible dates.” SOURCES: Queensland Times, Mothership Sghttp://www.qt.com.au/news/how-solve-school-maths-problem-stumped-world/2606149/ http://mothership.sg/2015/04/p5-logic-question-is-actually-a-math-olympiad-question-for-sec-3-and-4-students/?hc_location=ufi ***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73

item.title: U.S. upset over 'unsafe' interception by Russian fighter jet
item.description: RESTRICTIONS: NONE For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twThe United States defense department has accused Russia of an aggravated and unsafe air interception of a reconnaissance plane over the Baltic Sea on April 7.A U.S. RC-135U plane was flying in international airspace over Poland near Russia’s Kaliningrad region, when a Russian SU-27 Flanker approached the aircraft from behind at high speed. According to early reports, the Russian aircraft reportedly passed within six meters of the unarmed American plane.The SU-27 then performed two more close passes of the U.S. plane.Russian officials have denied doing anything wrong and alleged the RC-135U’s transponder was turned off. Russian Defense Ministry spokesman. Major General Igor Konashenkov claimed the Russian jet made several passes was only trying to identify the plane and its tail number. A U.S. European Command official said that claim was false, and that the Pentagon intends to file a complaint with the the Russian military.“Unprofessional air intercepts have the potential to cause harm to all aircrews involved. More importantly, the careless actions of a single pilot have the potential to escalate tensions between countries,” Pentagon spokesman Mark Wright said on Sunday.RUNDOWN SHOWS:1. U.S. RC-135U plane flying over Baltic Sea2. Russian SU-27 approaching the U.S. plane from behind3. Russian plane passes the U.S. plane 4. Russian plane performs two more passesVOICEOVER (in English): “A U.S. RC-135U plane was flying in international airspace over Poland,”“when a Russian SU-27 Flanker approached the U.S. aircraft from behind at high speed.“According to early reports, the Russian aircraft reportedly passed within six meters of the unarmed U.S. plane.”“The SU-27 then performed two more close passes of the U.S. plane.”SOURCES: The Wall Street Journal, The Telegraph, CNNhttp://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-to-protest-unsafe-intercept-of-reconnaissance-plane-by-russian-fighter-jet-1428835391http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/11531795/Russian-fighter-jet-intercepts-US-Air-Force-reconnaissance-flight.htmlhttp://edition.cnn.com/2015/04/11/europe/russia-u-s-plane-intercept/***For story suggestions please contact tips@nma.com.twFor technical and editorial support, please contact:Asia: +61 2 93 73 1841Europe: +44 20 7542 7599Americas and Latam: +1 800 738 8377
